Manage and process large amounts of data in near real-time to deliver up-to-date metrics.

Good knowledge on data structure and algorithms and an ability to use them practically when implementing solutions.

Experience in using predictive models using statistical or machine learning methods, and building dashboards in tools such as Tableau, Google Data Studio or Microsoft Power BI. 

Good to have:
Experience in developing and maintaining ETL data pipelines.
Experience in building tools to manage, automate and monitor data and data processing infrastructure.

title: Verification for integrated circuit design through image processing/Machine Learning
description:
Design verification via circuit extraction of delayered integrated circuit's images is an important part of hardware assurance which protects covert trojan insertion during the fabrication process.  However these images tend to have high noise level that result in failed electrical nets extraction. The objective of this project is to explore using Machine Learning and/or image processing techniques to improve the accuracy and robustness of extraction.	

Student will be tasked to use image processing and machine learning techniques to develop toolset for design verification

title: Experimenting with Digital Waveform Generators
description:
Digital waveform generators are used in many transceiver systems such as radars in order to generate specific pulse characteristics such as spread-spectrum coding. This project aims to explore the implementation of digital waveform generators in hardware using FPGAs and DACs. Depending on the aptitude and internship duration, the project can include signal processing algorithms such as pre-distortion in order to overcome DAC hardware limitations in order to improve the performance of the waveforms generated. 	

The student will learn about the digital hardware architecture for a waveform generator, as well as HDL coding to implement the waveform generator on a FPGA. The stretch goal will be to study signal processing methods to improve the DAC performance using matlab.

title: Digital Receiver Hardware for Electronically-scanned Antennas in Space Environment
description:
To deliver the next generation of satellite applications, spacecraft are increasingly using electronically-scanned antenna arrays, where the multiple individual antenna elements are combined digitally to improve overall performance. However this poses a challenge for the digital electronics to synchronize each individual received signals with minimum skew. The scope of this project includes:
1) To understand the hardware challenges and problems in doing digital receivers for electronically-scanned antenna arrays
2) To understand the issues of space radiation on electronics and to design mitigations against these effects. 
3) To implement the solutions on a FPGA based electronics module	

The student will learn about satellite and electronically-scanned antenna array hardware electronics, as well as HDL coding for FPGA development. The project will also provide exposure to lab test equipment to perform hardware implementation and debugging.

title: Detection of Unknown Radio Communication Signals
description:
Unknown radio communications signals occur frequently especially in the high frequency spectrum and detecting such signals is important for spectrum surveillance and intelligence gathering. Currently, unknown signals are detected manually which is manpower intensive, slow and prone to missed detection. Detection of unknowns is currently an active area of research in the machine learning community. 

In this project the intern will explore various machine learning methods such as deep learning to detect unknown signals automatically and robustly. If time permits, the intern can also explore clustering of these unknown signals.

The intern will learn more about communication signal processing, considerations in choosing appropriate pre-processing techniques, training and evaluating machine learning models such as neural networks. 

The intern will also gain hands-on experience in using popular deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow and Pytorch to develop solutions for real-world applications. 

Prerequisites: basic Python programming skills, interest in machine learning and communication signal processing.

description:

The spectrum analyser will be developed using FPGA or computer programming codes. The developed spectrum analyzer will be tested and its performance documented in a report.

title: Passive Surveillance Systems
description:
Aircraft and ships equipped with transponders can be tracked by intercepting broadcasted ADS-B or AIS messages. The content of these messages includes information of the platform, identity, location, and velocity etc.  The information embedded within the signals are of an open source format. 

In this project, the intern will study further into this solution, and improve on its robustness through baseband digital signal processing techniques on low-level ADS-B and AIS signals. The student will also develop a user interface to aid in the visualization and decoding of key signal parameters.

The intern will acquire knowledge of surveillance schemes and signal decoding. Thereafter, the intern will develop and implement a solution with improvement features. The student is expected to demonstrate system working in real environment.

description:
Visual Studio Team Foundation Server is slowly being replaced with Azure Devops Server. And opensource Kubernetes + Docker is quickly gaining popularity with Devops users.

Implement Azure devops using Azure Container Services and VMs, and implement pipelines on the Gitlab repositories to automate the build on build VMs, and deployment onto production VMs.

Azure provides an easy means for ensuring a consistent dev environment, as well as production environment. And it is not just suitable only for cloud applications, but also for desktop and embedded applications as well.

title: Continuous Integration Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) DevOps
description:
Continuous Integration aims to alleviate integration nightmares by validating each check-in through automated build and tests, thus detecting problems earlier and facilitating practices such as AGILE development. The student is expected to evolve the current CI framework via the writing of scripts and developing unit/integration/static/dynamic tests to validate the behaviour of the software. These will be utilised in a build server that listens to the repository, which upon detecting code changes, triggers a build and tests the system.

The project takes a step further by developing quality management functionality for Continuous Deployment into actual systems. If the new changes pass the CI tests and meet the requirements, the build server is expected to release them to the users (or the rest of the project team, who may not be software developers), generate code documentation or installers.

1. Web stack development
2. Understanding the software engineering workflow
3. Development of CI/CD scripts and runners
4. Software test tools and testing methodologies

title: High Efficiency Reliable Logging Library
description:
Logging of data is a useful method for software analysis, testing, debugging, etc. However, performing logging introduces overheads, which can impact the performance of the software. This is of significant importance in systems where timing or real-time functionality is critical, such as in aviation or mission-critical software.

Through this project, the student will reference open source logging libraries such as spdlog and G3log, and modify them in order to integrate the logger into the embedded systems, and benchmark it against existing loggers. The student will also be exposed to crash-safe logging, where application crashes will be captured properly and previously buffered log entries will not be lost.

1. C/C++ Programming and OOP
2. Embedded systems development
3. Understanding file synchronization, thread safety, system latency and other performance concerns

description:
Visible and thermal sensors can be exploited in a complimentary fashion to overcome the limitations associated with using only a single modality. When both visible and thermal sensors are fused together, it may be possible to detect and track vehicular targets with greater reliability and at a longer range. In this project, the student will explore and develop algorithms to fuse both visible and thermal sensors to improve vehicle detection and tracking performance. 	

In this project, the student will explore and develop algorithms to fuse both visible and thermal sensors to improve vehicle detection and tracking performance.

title: Self-supervised Learning for Visual Object Tracking
description:
Visual object tracking (VOT) plays a crucial role in the computer vision community that finds numerous applications such as motion analysis, action recognition, video surveillance, and autonomous driving, to name only a few. However, teaching a machine to visually track objects is challenging partly because it requires large, labeled tracking datasets for training, which are impractical to annotate at scale. Self-supervised pre-training on large unlabeled image datasets has the potential to improve performance on VOT. Self-supervised learning is a family of techniques for converting an unsupervised learning problem into a supervised one by creating surrogate labels from the unlabeled dataset.  In this project, we will explore the effectiveness of self-supervised learning on VOT.	

The student will gain proficiency in areas of computer vision, tracking, deep neural networks and self-supervised learning.

title: Model-based Reinforcement Learning (MBRL) with Efficient Exploration
description:
Reinforcement Learning (RL) considers the problem of an agent learning to construct actions that result in an agent receiving high rewards in each environment. Recent works show benefits of Model-based Reinforcement Learning (MBRL) which allows decoupled learning of task-dependent policy and task-agnostic dynamics. However, many of these methods lack a principled mechanism to acquire data for training the model. In this project, we will explore efficient exploration strategies for a MBRL agent to effectively acquire data for training its world models from the first few interactions. 	

The student will gain proficiency in areas of reinforcement learning (RL), deep neural networks and model-based RL methods.

title: Defending against Real World Adversarial Attacks on Deep Neural Networks
description:
Deep neural networks have achieved state-of-the-art performance in a variety of fields. However, there have been a myriad of demonstrations showing that deep neural networks can be easily fooled by carefully perturbing pixels in an image. Of concern, adversarial perturbation on real world objects, subsequently captured by a camera and fed through neural network classifiers, are shown to be possible. Various defenses against adversarial attacks in digital space are shown to be ineffective against real world attacks.  In this project, we will explore possible defenses against real world adversarial attacks. 	

The student will gain proficiency in areas of computer vision, deep neural networks, and adversarial attacks and defense methods.

title: Reinforcement Learning for Smart Autonomous Agent Systems
description:
AI and Machine Learning technologies such as reinforcement learning play more and more important roles in both the civilian and military world. Leveraging on AI and reinforcement learning technology, this project aims to develop self-learning capabilities for intelligent agents (e.g., computer generated forces such as military aircraft/tanks in simulation or simulated robots) so as to enable them to auto-program themselves (i.e., the intelligent agents in the simulation environments would automatically learn/discover interesting or new behaviours for a given task). This self-learning/self-programming capability (instead of humans having to manually program the agents’ behaviours) is a key element towards the intelligentization of such systems; it is a game-changing approach with significant potential applications in the future.	

This project will expose the student to the areas of AI and machine learning technologies and software engineering to gain invaluable experience, e.g., (a) learn and apply reinforcement learning for autonomous agents; (b) learn and apply analytical skills for intelligent systems; (c) gain proficiency in developing smart solutions; (d) gain proficiency and confidence in programming skills and abilities.

title: Technology Scouting Intern
description:
Ever wonder what it takes to work with and work in a startup? Interested in working with the next major technology in space and unmanned aerial systems? Want to glean insights to the largest growing air traffic market in the world? Want to change the way aviation works? After a successful 2013 launch in Europe, we decided in 2016 to open an office in Singapore and bring together a startup community dedicated to aerospace here in Asia.

Work with leaders and role models from Singapore Airlines alongside the most well-regarded names in the industry including Boeing, Thales, Panasonic and more. Get involved with the venture capital investors and help us grow the next unicorn!

Who are we?

Starburst offers startups business development, mentoring, and procurement success through a variety of startup accelerator programs ranging from early to late stage. We work closely with industry to promote a more inventive pick of suppliers to work with by accelerating the purchasing process and introducing new technologies that demonstrate value in the aerospace supply chain.

What will you be doing?

Think of it as a cross of McKinsey project delivery, Google strategic analysis, Y-Combinator networking, Boeing supply chain and NASA program support.
Help manage and develop the accelerator program:
• Scouting, sourcing and identifying potential startups to join the Starburst community;

title: Advanced Cyber Security Tools, Experimentations and Analytics against APTs
description:
Organizations today are fighting an increasingly uphill battle defending against fast evolving Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs). They will need to harness advances in AI, Cloud and open sources such as MITRE ATT&CK Matrix in their cyber security solutioning.  In this project we aim to develop tools and techniques to enhance cyber security against APTs. Project tasks may include scalable cloud-based experimentations, implement enhanced system monitoring, execute adversarial simulations, and use AI techniques to perform Big Data log analysis.	

The student will pick up key cyber security domain knowledge and develop a deep understanding of the evolving APT landscape. Depending on the tasks assigned, the student may also learn one or more of the following:

title: Advanced Malware Peekaboo!
description:
Advanced malware are capable of detecting and evading a dynamic analysis environment to hide their intent.  They are also often morphed by packers and code mutation tools to evade antivirus detection and deter the analysis process.  Some more sophiscated malware translates the actual code into a special format that only a special virtual machine can run i.e. virtualised code as an advanced form of anti-analysis protection.  It is an arms race between the malware writers and malware analysts.
In this project, we aim to:
- Study state-of-art malware anti-antivirus and anti-analysis techniques, and formulate viable conuntermeasures
- Evaluate alternative approaches for malware analysis to complement the traditional static and dynamic techniques

Student will gain in-depth understanding of :
• malware evasion technique.
• malware analysis techniques and tools
• antivirus internals

title: Developing Hack-Proof Software for Unmanned and Robotics Systems
description:
Software today controls numerous critical systems, such as autonomous vehicles. Cyber-attacks could turn these vehicles into killer machines. The security of a computer system depends on its foundations: its operating system, and the compilers and libraries used to build its software. Given that some of the modules might be available only in binary form, we would also explore ways to harden these via binary rewriters. In addition, classical techniques such as Multi-Level Security (MLS) can be used to harden unmanned and robotics systems to limit the damage suffered during an external attack. In future unmanned/robotics systems, we also envision significant use of 5G wireless technologies, which may impact the security of these systems.

In this project the student can choose to focus on: (I) evaluating the correctness of binary programs that have been hardened by binary rewriters,
(ii) developing secure solutions for autonomous systems (eg, AV), using secure foundations such as verified OSes and libraries, and/or MLS separation techniques, and
(iii) studying and mitigating the impact of 5G on the security of unmanned and robotics systems. 

Depending on the topics chosen, interns may learn one or more of the following:
(1) Design and implement cyber-security solutions for AV, using verified software and/or MLS separation
(2) Learn about binary transformations and patching, and develop binary analysis tools and techniques.

[Minimal Requirements]
• Singaporeans only
• CGPA of 3.5 and above (University students) / 3.8 and above (Polytechnic students)
• Not a recipient of a scholarship with a specified bond obligation
• Able to work and perform research independently
• Natural curiosity in how things work under the hood
• Passion in cyber security or network protocols
• Comfortable with using Linux 
• Knowledge of C/C++, Java and Python

[Preferred Requirements (at least one of the following)]
• Knowledge of assembly/binary and Dalvik/Java VM bytecode
• Familiarity with ROS2/DDS
• Knowledge of secure programming languages e.g. Rust.
• Knowledge of formal methods, e.g., model-checking, theorem proving, software verification
• Must have taken introductory module to compilers
• Interest in program transformations and binary analysis
• Familiarity with Linux scheduling, separation, cgroups, SELinux

title: Discovering Hidden Behaviours and Security Vulnerabilities in (Smart) Devices
description:
We are surrounded by devices in our everyday life, from smart locks, smart light bulbs, Internet of Things for the smart home, routers, switches, firewall and security appliances in the modern enterprise, to CCTV, sensors, drones for smart nation. These devices are integral to the cyber security of homes, enterprises and Singapore. Are there hidden behaviours in such devices that work against our interests? How do we assess and improve the security of these devices?  

This project seeks to develop tools and techniques to analyse and enhance the security of smart devices. Interns may learn one or more of the following:
1) Analyse wireless communication protocols
2) Analyse firmware of smart devices
3) Develop and enhance techniques for debugging, instrumenting and emulating smart devices
4) Improve and automate analysis and identification of vulnerabilities in smart devices
5) Leverage on machine learning to improve security of smart devices

title: Evaluating Wireless Security in a Post-COVID-19 World
description:
By the march of technology, devices are becoming ever more networked wirelessly, so as to leverage on network advantages, for exciting new vistas in IoT, personal area network and smart city designs. Accelerated by the COVID-19 outbreak, wireless technology adoption does help reduce unnecessary human-to-human touch, and these facilitate work-from-home and contactless transactions. New wireless standards or newer versions are getting released (eg. WiFi, Bluetooth LE, DSRC, RDS, Zigbee, LoRA, etc), and devices supporting these are being shipped. But software bugs are commonplace.  Technical standards themselves are not perfect, taking several versions to get them right. Certain protocols are proprietary, and they often depend on security by obscurity. Unfortunately, malicious hackers do not rest. When not implemented securely, these wireless avenues can be exploited by a hacker to gain access and remotely control the device and even other systems it is networked to. In view of the trends, it is useful to investigate into the newer and less-studied wireless technologies, and even look at older wireless technologies with newer tools.


The project objectives are: to review a wireless protocol or standard selected after discussion and its security mechanisms, obtain such wireless traffic for study, analyse the cybersecurity vulnerabilities for a use case of the wireless technology in a particular implementation and configuration, using manual and automated analysis techniques – eg. using emulator, using software composition analysis, fuzzing, etc. The student could look into the different processing involved in a communication system, how to make sense of the signal and protocol involved, and develop tools to interact with the system over-the-air. In terms of learning by doing, the steps would typically include: literature study, setup, installation, scripting/programming, experimentation, prototyping, and debugging. Through this project, the student would be able to learn valuable up-to-date cybersecurity skills.

[Minimal Pre-requisites]
• Singaporeans only
• CGPA of 3.5 and above (University students)
• Not a recipient of a scholarship with a specified bond obligation
• Able to work and perform research independently
• Natural curiosity
• Passion in cyber security and wireless technologies
• Familiarity with programming (C/C++, scripting) and development
• Familiarity with Linux and embedded systems

Internship Allowance (CPF exempted): $2000 to $2500

title: Finding Novel Bugs in Software
description:
Fuzzing is a popular technique used to uncover software flaws.  Over the years, new and improved fuzzing techniques have helped uncover new software flaws. We would like to evaluate such techniques and to improve them.

In addition, while fuzzing has been applied to many kinds of software, there are some more complex software where fuzzing is in its infancy.  Examples include virtualization, network protocols and cryptography. They are critical as they form the foundation in typical network environment.

In this project there are several tracks of work that a student can explore with us.  The student will focus on one of the following tracks: adapt fuzzers to work with binary codes efficiently, compare and adapt Javascript fuzzers, develop fuzzers to find race condition bugs or bugs in crypto libraries, or network protocols.

title: Software Engineering Intern
description:
Atomionics is a Singapore based VC-backed startup building quantum sensors for Navigation and Resource Exploration. We measure gravity, acceleration, and rotation 1000x better than the state of the art. Atomionics sensors can build a complete map of the underground, thus help pinpoint underground structures, like tunnels and bunkers, predict earthquakes, provide precise navigation, and build a universal positioning system that works everywhere – underground, underwater, and even in space. We have deep expertise in bringing complex technologies from a lab environment to the dynamic real world.  

At Atomionics, we like to cultivate a casual and friendly environment. We are a small focused group in a high-energy environment. The core of what we are building is called cold atom interferometry, where we cool down atoms to microkelvin temperatures by shooting lasers at them. This allows us to measure the forces acting on them precisely. Our team has over 30 years of combined relevant research experience. Due to the complexity of our work, our employees get to interact with other interdisciplinary domains such as electronics engineering, software engineering, and physics. Our company likes to treat our work as a “gym for our minds”.  

In addition, we are backed by some fantastic investors from the private and public sectors, such as Wavemaker, SGInnovate, Capvista, 500startups, and other prominent angels.

Responsibilities
• Work on hardware-software interaction and visualization of data
• Develop software to interface with FPGA hardware used for precision timing control and data acquisition

What we can offer you 
• A chance to learn about the intricacies of deep tech research, product development, and strategy in a high-growth startup while working with some of the best engineers and physicists. Learn the best practices in engineering and physics 
• Work on the cutting edge of quantum technology 
• Develop robust applications for translational research 
• A book/hobby project allowance to help you grow and collectively build the Atomionics library 
• Board games and curry night

title: Information Security Research Intern
description:
PayPal’s Information Security team is looking for creative and passionate Interns who are excited about learning what it takes to work as a member of a talented team to secure customers, systems and data in today’s rapidly evolving threat environment. 

Internship Opportunity & Exposure
While our project assignments vary, all interns will be embedded in a security team, and with the guidance of an individual internship mentor, can expect to:
•	Engage with their internship mentor to craft an Information Security project that is interesting to the intern and has significant value for PayPal, and potentially the wider technology ecosystem
•	Engage Information Security and business teams to understand context, research needs, develop insights and get buy in to their project
•	Develop and document a set of deliverables that meet the goal of the project
•	Pitch their project or research findings to Information Security leaders
What interns will learn
•	Real world experience of how to be successful in a business context
•	The state of Information Security in today’s world
•	Information Security knowledge, skills and capabilities
•	Verbal and written communication within a large business

Primary Responsibilities
For interns who are interested in security research, they would be embarking on technology research in at least one of these areas:- network security, cryptography, vulnerability analysis, security threat intelligence, application of artificial intelligence and machine learning to threat detection and/or security testing automation. During the course of research, the intern will be expected to read technical papers and scientific publications to learn and understand the research technology as well as to perform security analysis on the technology together with the rest of the PayPal research team. Intern enjoys the opportunity to create new intellectual property such as novel security architecture, design, protocol and algorithm, code and develop research prototype as well as participate in performance testing and research pilot in a team environment. With an emphasis on applied research, intern will also learn the various payments and financial services use cases and requirements to apply the research technology. 

What we are looking for:
•	Grad/Postgrad/PhD in Computer Science, Information Security, Information Systems, Engineering or related degree.
•	Experience in Cryptograpy, Network Security, Quantum Computing is required.
•	Experience in using Go/C/C++ coding language will be preferred. 
•	Ability to work well within a team environment and an interest in deepening knowledge of information security principles
•	Demonstrated abilities to comprehend, discuss and apply concepts and theories within both overall Information Technology and Information Security / Governance fields.
•	Strong analytical skills along with necessary communication skills necessary to document the processes and actions taken to complete each assignment.

title: Mobile & Cloud Computing Security & Privacy
description:
With the ubiquity of mobile phones today, the security and privacy of mobile apps is a critical area. Cloud Computing also plays an important role providing back-end storage and compute services to mobile apps. In this internship, students can choose from a number of possible topics: Mobile Malware Analysis, Penetration Testing for Mobile Apps, Privacy Analysis for Mobile Apps, Security Analysis of the Android platform and its subsystems, Security Analysis of the iOS platform to enable analysis and debugging on jailbroken devices, and Evaluating the Security of Cloud Computing Technologies.	

Depending on the topic selected, interns may learn about one or more of the following:
• Mobile security (Android and/or iOS)
• Mobile malware and app reverse engineering and analysis workflows
• Mobile app testing and penetration testing techniques, e.g., fuzz testing
• Mobile security and vulnerabilities
• Android internals and Android security architecture
• Analysis of mobile app binaries (e.g., Dalvik/Java VM bytecode, ARM ELF binary code)
• iOS security and analysis of iOS apps, e.g. develop an iOS app testing framework
• Security of Cloud Computing components, e.g. virtualization and device emulation.

• CGPA of 3.5 and above (University students) / 3.0 and above (Polytechnic students)

[Preferred Requirements (at least one of the following)]
• Knowledge of assembly/binary and Dalvik/Java VM bytecode
• Knowledge of Android/iOS mobile application development and Android image building
• Familiarity with using open-source tools (e.g., compiling, installing, modifying)
• Comfortable with using iOS and macOS
• Knowledge of iOS jail breaking
• Knowledge of at least one of the following: HyperV, Vmware, or Xen

title: Mystical 5G Core and Network Security
description:
The 5G mobile network introduces major changes not only to the subscriber’s mobile experience but also to the core network supporting the mobile architecture. In particular, equipment manufacturers leverage on virtualization technologies such as Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Software Defined Network (SDN) to achieve a scalable and flexible network management to deal with short-service life cycles.  	

The goal of this project is to explore selected open-source virtualization software and tools used in 5G Core Network and study their security. Examples include Open vSwitch (OVS), Open Network Operating System (ONOS), Openstack, Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM), Kubernetes and Open Networking Automation Platform (ONAP). Depending on the choice, the student may also investigate the limitation of specific network encryption used.

Depending on the project chosen, the student may perform threat assessments through network traffic analysis, vulnerability research, code audit and/or reverse engineering. Through this project, the student will gain a better appreciation of virtualization and networking technologies and how to assess its security. 

[Minimal Pre-requisites]
• Singaporeans only
• CGPA of 3.5 and above (University students)
• Not a recipient of a scholarship with a specified bond obligation
• Able to work and perform research independently
• Natural curiosity in how things work under the hood
• Passion in cyber security or networking
• Experience in Linux environment
• Proficient in C or Python
• Have taken university class or equivalent experience: Operating Systems, Computer Networking

[Preferred Pre-requisites: at least one of the following]
• Basic knowledge of assembly (x86, x64) and reverse engineering
• Basic knowledge of hypervisors (eg. Xen/Kvm/Hyper-V)

title: Security Engineering for Smart Vehicle Platforms
description:
The autonomy and automotive domain promises to be a major engine of growth for big technology companies, as witnessed by the recent proposed Nvidia-ARM deal (regardless of whether the deal actually goes through). There are many embedded processors in the modern vehicle, with millions of lines of software, and they are being combined with AI, vision and autonomy systems to produce smarter, highly connected platforms. With greater connectivity and software content, the vehicles come under increasing cybersecurity threats.
In this project, we want to consider the cybersecurity problems in this space, and develop secure devices to address some of the security problems identified. 

The learning objectives are: to learn to analyse cybersecurity issues systematically, develop a simple functional prototype encapsulating key security concepts, and utilising new methodologies, tools and hardware targets. For example, some possible functionalities identified for study could be: gateway, over-the-air update, chain-of-trust, etc.

title: Static Code Analysis for Security Bug Finding
description:
Bug finding R&D includes analyzing software to gain deep understanding of the code and to find defects. To cope with large and complex code bases, analysts use automated tools to aid in efficient code navigation, to extract useful semantics, and to find deep bugs.
In this project we develop static tools for improving the code audit or bug finding process. This will involve evaluating, customizing, or integrating existing solutions, or creating new ones.

An intern can choose from one of the following tracks: develop a source code navigator to facilitate security code audit, develop type inference techniques to aid in Javascript security analysis, develop fast and accurate techniques to analyze large and complex software software (eg browsers), or develop automated tools to detect novel logic bugs.

Learning objectives: students have the opportunities to learn how to audit code, understand how bugs originate and manifest, and develop practical and creative tools useful to analysts.

description:

title: Web Browser Security
description:
In recent years, the web has become the de facto means of interacting with computing applications over the Internet, and the web browser is now a major interface on which applications run. As such, the security of web browsers is critical. Are these important programs secure? Are there problems in them that could lead to security issues? Students will learn about the software architecture of Web Browsers, and go in-depth into one or more of their specific features, such as JavaScript engines, Process Sandboxing and Inter-Process Communication (IPC), and how problems in such features can lead to security bugs.	

Students will learn about one or more of the following tools and techniques used to analyze the security of Web Browsers. They will then build on these tools to develop improved methods for analyzing the security of Web Browsers. These include: 
• HTML and JavaScript,
• Software testing methods,
• Software fuzzing tools for JavaScript (such as LangFuzz, DIE, FuzziL, CodeAlchemist)
• Source-code analysis tools
• Programming Language / type-theoretic techniques

[Minimal Requirements]
• Singaporeans only
• CGPA of 3.5 and above (University students) 
• Not a recipient of a scholarship with a specified bond obligation
• Able to work and perform research independently

• Familiar with HTML and JavaScript
• Knowledge of one or more of the following will be advantageous: Software Fuzzing, Functional Programming (e.g. Ocaml, Haskell), Programming Languages and Type Theory, assembly languages / binary analysis)

title: Wintel stack - How deep does the rabbit hole go?
description:
Wintel refers to a system running a modern Microsoft Windows operating system on a modern x86 compatible CPU, manufactured by either Intel or AMD.  Every year, this stack is refreshed by new innovations and offerings from Microsoft, Intel and other PC hardware subsystem vendors.

We are interested in new or enhanced hardware and software features especially those related to security and protection of a system.  We want to study the internals of these features in depth and also to assess their impacts to cyber security i.e. whether the feature can be utilised to raise the security baseline of a system and how to configure; whether the feature can be exploited by attackers for insidious purposes.


Windows 10 features include antivirus, hardware-based virtualization and exploit mitigation technologies etc.  Students can refer to ""Stay protected with Windows Security"" @ https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/stay-protected-with-windows-security-2ae0363d-0ada-c064-8b56-6a39afb6a963 for introduction and list of Windows security features.

PC hardware subsystems include memory access mechanisms, modes of processors, microcontrollers for I/O and management, and their assoicated firmware etc.  Students can refer to ""Hardware-Enabled Security Powered by Intel Technology"" @
https://www.intel.sg/content/www/xa/en/security/hardware/hardware-security-overview.html for introduction and list of hardware-based security features.

The student can pick one (or more) of the software or hardware feature as study subject(s) and embark on these objectives:
- Go deep to understand the internals of the selected feature i.e. how does it work?
- Assess its impact to cyber security of a system i.e. whether the feature can be utilised to raise the security baseline of a sytem and how to configure; whether the feature can be exploited b attackers for insidious purposes.

Learning objectives:
- Reverse-engineering techniques
- Evaluation of security concepts and solutions
- How things tick under the hood

• Singaporeans only
• CGPA of 3.5 and above (University students) / 3.0 and above (Polytechnic students)
• Not a recipient of a scholarship with a specified bond obligation
• Able to work and perform research independently
• Natural curiosity in how things work under the hood
• Passion in cyber security or network protocols

Preferred but not mandatory:
• C, C++ programming knowledge in Windows
• Python programming knowledge
• Knowledge of operating systems internals and ASM
• Interested in exploring low level stuff (i.e. chipset registers, datasheets, etc) and tinkering with hardware (i.e. PCI cards, FPGA, etc) for the PC hardware subsystems track
• Comfortable in learning new CPU architectures and instruction sets such as ARCompact  for the PC hardware subsystems track

title: Robust Long-Term Autonomy for Unmanned Systems in Dynamic and Unstructured Environments
description:
Unmanned systems are expected to operate robustly for long durations in dynamic and unstructured environments. Such environments may include difficult terrain, cluttered and highly dynamic settings, and dusty and rainy conditions. The project will focus on developing real-time techniques to improve the level of robustness and the operating duration of unmanned systems in dynamic and unstructured environments.

The project objective is to develop and implement algorithms from one of the following areas:
1) Localisation: Sensor-based odometry, SLAM, map-based localisation, decentralised collaborative SLAM
2) Perception: Environment mapping, moving object tracking and trajectory prediction, semantic mapping
3) Motion Planning & Controls: Path/trajectory planning, path/trajectory tracking
4) Behaviours: Learning of behaviours for an unmanned system to achieve a given task
5) Teaming: decentralised coordination between multiple unmanned systems to achieve a given task, learning of coordinated behaviours for multiple unmanned systems
6) Mission Planning: Task allocation and scheduling
Localisation and perception algorithms may be implemented using a combination of the following sensors: cameras, LiDARs, and radars. Deep learning techniques may be explored as well. All algorithms have to be implemented in C++/CUDA/TensorRT and run in real-time.

The intern will familiarise himself/herself with state-of-the-art algorithms in the chosen area. Subsequently, he/she will develop and implement an algorithm for an assigned problem. He/she will demonstrate the algorithm to work in real-time, and either in simulation or on an actual unmanned platform.

title: Radar Systems
description:
Unlike optical sensors, radars are capable of all weather, day and night operations. This capability makes them useful for time critical applications such as aircraft surveillance over a congested airspace and even radar imaging of natural disasters as they unfold from space. 

Due to advancements in radio frequency electronics and improvements in computational capabilities, scientists and engineers are finding new use cases for radars. For example, miniaturized radar sensors are increasing used as sense-and-avoid sensors for autonomous cars. Man-portable radar sensors are being developed to protect military installations from human and even drones intrusion. Today, we can even use our cellphone or Wi-Fi signals as a radar signal through clever signal processing.

Students will have the opportunity to be guided by our radar team to explore novel applications of radar. After discussion with our radar team, the student can select and customise one of the following topics: (i) develop and test a ""passive"" radar that exploits signals of opportunity (such as cellphone and Wi-Fi) for target detection, (ii) develop and test radars for sense-and-avoid or detecting targets in urban areas, (iii) exploring novel radar concepts such as producing optical-like images using radar or operating multiple radars in synchrony to obtain 3D images.

Students will be familiarized with the radar theory including classical radar signal processing chain , radar wave propagation, detection theory and localization of targets.
Depending on the project, students will also be exposed to radar hardware and circuitry.  Finally, students will be able to gain a better  understanding of digital signal processing in the field of radar work.

Internship Allowance (CPF exempted): $2000 to $2500

title: Satellites
description:
Satellites are increasingly commoditized with cheaper access to space. Many recent developments in small satellites, collapsible antenna and high-resolution payloads can bring future technological breakthrough in commercial and military applications. 

Such satellite contains multiple systems and students will have the opportunity of working on a subsystem project or study under the guidance of our satellite team. These  may include work on orbit control systems, communications, antenna systems and others.

Students will be exposed to different satellite subsystems depending on the project offered.  They will learn to code simulations in order to understand orbital controls and mission planning. Communications and antenna systems on the satellite will also provide students with exposure to digital signal processing and EM propagation.

title: Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst (Intern)
description:
Summary of Role 

V-Key is one of the world’s leading deep-tech companies in mobile cyber-security. Our patented technology V-OS has been deployed by top banks, mobile payment providers, and governments to secure software solutions and protect more than 100 million users globally.  

We are rapidly expanding into new markets and new customer segments. Apart from securing digital transactions for everyone, we are also enabling new generation technology by providing the cyber-security infrastructure for banking, government and smart homes, among many others.  

At V-Key, we are building towards a future where technology users can enjoy unprecedented security and convenience.  

We are looking for a QA Analyst (Intern), as part of the QA Team. Your primary focus will be to solicit and analyse requirements for the company’s suite of mobile security products, comprising of mobile and web applications, their supporting framework, SDK, toolchains and web services. You will also be responsible for designing test plans, scenarios, test scenarios review, automation scripts to conduct software testing on the products, to ensure high quality standards. 

The successful candidate will also be involved in the company’s plan to automate testing, to take on active role in defining, developing and implementing the automated testing platform. 

Duties and Responsibilities

- Study and construct use cases and workflow related to the requirements 
- Baseline the requirements, use cases and workflow and produce requirements specifications for follow-up development 
- Design and document test procedures, plans, scenarios, cases and scripts, based on the products’ requirements and technical specifications 
- Own, execute and manage the testing activities of product releases throughout the product development lifecycle, covering functional tests, scenario tests, and end-to-end tests on the products 
- Ensure testing of each product release meets the products’ requirements, completes on time, and adheres to the test plans and QA standards defined by the company

title: Learning-based image/video enhancements
description:
Image/Video data captured in practice are often far from perfect – sensor noise, lens aberrations, insufficient lighting, shadows and environmental vibrations etc. can result in them being over/underexposed, grainy and blur. This studentship will develop novel techniques using machine learning to remove and even enhance such images/videos, using novel approaches that require less supervision and annotated data (low-shot learning). The results will then be compared to standard state-of-the-art enhancement techniques.	

Students will learn about image/video processing problems and machine learning techniques in Python coding environment.They will work directly with different types of cameras in order to extract, process and manipulate their raw sensor values. They will design, experiment and analyse results from typical machine learning approaches, as well as novel ones; ultimately gaining confidence in applying such techniques in a wide variety of problems.

title: Imagery Capture Device Identification
description:
An important component of digital media forensics is confirming the source of an image by the specific capture device (make, model and even IMEI) that captured it. In this project, we will investigate a variety of traditional and machine learning (ML) techniques focusing on identifying images from smartphone images captured from various devices as well as from a variety of social media sources (e.g. Twitter, FB, IG, Flickr) 

Unlike traditional image processing and computer vision problems, image device identification seek to extract forensic fingerprints that positively identify the device regardless of the image content/scene or environment. This remains a challenging task as robust forensic features that go beyond the pixel intensities and layouts are often: 1) weak, 2) corrupted through social media compressions and 3) tampered and/or missing.

In the first phase of this project, the student will perform a literature survey of the traditional and ML techniques common for extracting forensics fingerprints necessary to enable device identification. At the same time, the student will work on extending current device identification datasets for the specific case of smartphones, including sources from social media as well. 

 In the second part of this project, from the literature survey, the student will apply two selected techniques – traditional and ML-based – over the expanded dataset and perform a first analysis of their performance and shortcomings. Given these findings, the student will work on integrating robust feature extraction techniques meant to find weak signatures in images and apply them on the final selected approach. A project report detailing the approach, results and recommendations would be expected from the student.

Internship Allowance (CPF exempted): $2000 to $2500

title: MIMO Radar Beamforming
description:
Multiple-Input-Multiple-Output (MIMO) signal processing is a technology that has the potential to transform radar technology by improving the coverage, data rate and/or signal quality. MIMO radars function by simultaneously radiating orthogonal signals, and processing the multiple returned signals independently.

The student will work through the mathematical model and signal representation of the MIMO system, as well as perform simulations to validate the mathematical model. The student will also quantify the performance and recommend system design trade-offs and considerations.

The student will be exposed to the following: 
(1) Understand the building block of communication / radar systems.
(2) Learn about mathematical modelling of radar signals and validation of model through simulation.
(3) Learn about signal processing techniques such as Fourier Transform, Auto-Correlation, Cross-Correlation and Array Processing.
(4) Develop an appreciation of system engineering.

Internship Allowance (CPF exempted): $2000 to $2500

title: Machine Learning for Radar Motion Recognition
description:
Conventionally, radar system design was driven by applications such as detection, localization and identification of rigid targets such as vehicles and aircrafts. However, radar is also increasingly used for tracking and recognizing complex, dynamic, deforming shapes and fine motions by improving the spatial and temporal resolution to a fine degree. This can further be augmented by machine learning to enable automatic motion recognition. An early adopter and driver of such technology is Google's Soli radar that is used in Google Pixel 4.

The student  will operate a radar system to collect signatures of basic motions in order to build a training data base and perform classification of the motions.


The student will be exposed to the following: 
(1) Understand the building blocks of communication & radar systems.
(2)  Learn about mathematical modelling of radar signals and validation of model through simulation.
(3) Learn about radar signal representation in multiple dimensions.
(4) Apply machine learning techniques to develop classification algorithms.

Internship Allowance (CPF exempted): $2000 to $2500

title: Real-time Compensation for Radar Image Formation
description:
Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) is a form of moving radar that is used to create images of scenes or objects. The ability to efficiently process the electromagnetic (EM) radar waves into an image is dependent on flight profile and scene geometry.

The student will investigate the use of real-time information to adjust the radar signal parameters so as to reduce the computational load of processing the radar signals into an image.

The student will be exposed to the following: 
(1) Understand the signal model of an imaging radar system.
(2)  Learn about real-time control and processing.
(3) Appreciate the application of mathematical signal representation in physical systems.

title: Machine Learning for Radar Signal Processing
description:
Drone incursions into airports and sensitive places like military bases and nuclear power plants will remain a persistent problem for years to come. Many drone detection systems use radar as one of the primary sensors. However, a radar sensitive enough to detect a drone will be able to detect other small objects like birds, moving vegetation, etc. If there are too many false positives from such ‘nuisance’ objects, operator fatigue will set in and real drone targets may be missed.

In this internship, students will explore the use of machine learning to better detect and classify drones. Students will then apply their techniques on simulated data, and real data collected from the field. 

Students will be familiarized with the radar theory including classical radar signal processing chain , radar wave propagation, detection theory and localization of targets. Students will get to see the benefits that machine learning can bring to the radar domain, and explore the various machine learning techniques.

title: mmW Radar for Imaging Drones
description:
The use of millimetre wave technology is increasing in our modern world. We see it used in radar systems, e.g. automotive radars, and also in the next generation mobile communication system - 5G. 

For radar system, the very large bandwidth available in the millimetre wave band allows the creation of very high-resolution images of targets for identification purposes, with the potential to replace cameras. Radar can be used to see through rain, fog and dust, and hence has advantages over cameras in these situations. 

In this internship, we are interested in the use of millimetre wave radar technology for the identification of drones.  Students will have the chance to work with the hardware and software required to realise this and see for themselves the advantages of this technology

Students will be familiarized with the radar theory including classical radar signal processing chain , radar wave propagation, detection theory and localization of targets.
Depending on the project, students will also be exposed to millimetre wave radar hardware and circuitry.  Finally, students will have the chance to work with radar signal processing, and learn about radar image formation.

title: IoT Engineer Intern
description:
A big component of Resync's solution is real-time control enabled through on-ground device and IoT gateway. Since this device communicates to multiple gateways, cloud, and other energy assets. It utilizes encrypted data collection and transmission, further security protocols are to be built in on the device and on the cloud architecture. The project will entail working on developing and optimizing the hardware and firmware of the Resync device. You will work with mentors on developing and improving the product, by writing the firmware, exploring various communication protocols such as Modbus, LoRA, Zigbee etc.

The apprentice will work closely with firmware and backend team to
- identify areas of enhancing cyber security and network protocol
- improve and develop firmware for various device level integration
- design and optimize hardware development

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Resync is an AI-driven energy cloud for distributed energy assets such as solar, energy storage, electric vehicles, smart buildings etc. We optimize these assets using a combination of real-time control and machine learning algorithms.

All the insights into the energy data we collect at Resync are provided in a meaningful way to the users through the platform, both web and app-based. These are continuously improved both from the frontend, backend to handle as the demand grows and user feedback. A good chunk of new development would be focused on improving the user engagement and experience as the next generation platform would be fully customizable by the users and can provide direct control of their devices from the click of a single button.

title: AI Scientist (Intern) - Face Recognition in Autonomous and Interactive Robot Development
description:
Job Description:

As an AI Scientist (intern), you will be tasked to:

- Work with a team of scientists to design and develop a patrol robot for the security industry, where skills and knowledge on navigation, mapping, localization, control, computer vision, speech recognition and understanding will be involved

- Conduct research, analyse and evaluate robotic technology, systems and prototypes to create new robotic systems or system capabilities

- Work on software and hardware design, GUI design, client and server as well as cloud-related development for the project

- Identify key enablers and risk areas of proposed algorithmic solutions

- Research and stay current on the state-of-art AI and computer vision

Internship Scope

In the Internship, student is required to analyse the existing problems of robot development and achieve better performance for the robot development.

The project scope includes:

1. ROS based navigation, mapping, localisation and control

2. Video analysis functions including human attribute, car plate number and objects

3. Hardware assembly, including IPC, camera, power, microphone, speaker, etc

Skills developed through this internship:

Robot, Image processing, hardware

Job Requirement:

- Prior knowledge and skills in the use of computer language such as in C/C++/Python/ Java / ROS/ Ubuntu and Open CV

- Strong foundation in signal processing and mathematics

- Familiar with the use of Caffe/Tensorflow/Pytorch platform

title: H1 Engineering Internship
description:
About the team: 

The Engineering & Development Team helps build Southeast Asia’s leading everyday super app to provide transportation, logistics and financial services to millions across the region.

There’s never a dull moment working in our Engineering & Development Team. You’ll experience a shipping culture that uses the state of the art web technologies and you’ll grow in a work environment where fellow Grabbers are passionate about knowledge-sharing and code review. Get access to our fascinating data set to solve real world problems and discover great purpose in your work. This is a great opportunity for you to learn software engineering practices for coding at scale.

Requirements: 

You should be a full-time student majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Information Technology/Science, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance or related fields seeking a matriculated internship

You should be enrolled in a Singapore university, or Singaporean/ Singapore PR studying abroad

You should be able to commit full-time for a minimum of 20 weeks.

You should have a working knowledge in programming tools and languages such as Golang, Javascript, React, Redux, Flutter, Swift, Kotlin, Dart, Python, Java & Hadoop

You should have a strong ability to structure data and write algorithms

You should have strong communication skills and attention to detail

Having a Positive attitude and can-do spirit are critical

You should have excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, with a willingness to learn, but also to challenge the status quo

You should be a team player who is motivated to work in a fast-paced environment

Having previous experience in Engineering or other related fields may be an advantage

We require our interns in Singapore to be covered under the Employment Act (EA) and Work Injury Compensation (WICA) act. As such, our internship opportunities are limited to students of any nationality studying in Singapore, and Singaporean/PR studying in any location.

title: Engineering Intern / Frontend Engineer / Backend/Fullstack Engineer
description:
Who we are

Workstream (www.workstream.is) transforms the way deskless workers work, starting from automating automation, SMS communication, and machine learning. Our clients include Jamba Juice, McDonald's, Westin, Marriott, Uber, Subway, Dunkin', Panera Bread, Coupa Cafe, Sightglass Coffee, Equator Coffee, and more.

We are a team from Stanford, MIT, Google, Y Combinator, Harvard, Cornell, Yelp, Qualtrics, Glassdoor, WeChat, and more and are backed by investors including Peter Thiel's Founders Fund, Charles River Ventures, Basis Set Ventures, CEO Zoom, CEO DoorDash, Peterson Ventures, Heartland Ventures, Jay Z, Joe Montana, James Harden, Chairman of Louis Vuitton, and more. 
 
Global at our core, we are headquartered in San Francisco and have presence in the US, Europe, China, and Singapore from day one.
 
Culture is very important to us and we encourage you too.their hiring and onboarding workflows. We help companies to streamline the hiring process with workflow.

Engineering Intern

Position overview
We are looking for Workstream Engineering Interns to work directly with the Engineering team. Depending on your focus areas, Ideally, you are passionate, detail-oriented, an excellent communicator, independent thinker and incredibly intelligent.

The Nitty-gritty Details
• Company: Workstream
• Website: https://www.workstream.is
• Location: Remote (Ideally based in Palo Alto or Singapore, but open to all locations)
• Position: Engineering Intern
• Position type: Full-time (Part-time possible)
• Reporting to: CTO
• Duration: 6 months (min) to 1 year
• Start: Q4 2020

Opportunities to Progress in Career

Workstream is a Palo Alto based, rapidly growing startup, funded by well known institutional and angel investors including Basis Set Ventures, Peter Thiel, CEO Zoom, CEO DoorDash, Peterson Ventures, Heartland Ventures, Jay Z, Joe Montana, James Harden, Chairman of Louis Vuitton, and more. We are a small team of ~40 full timers + a few part timers, from Y Combinator, MIT, Google, Harvard, Qualtrics, Wharton, Stanford, Yelp, Glassdoor, Cornell, and more, with a strong passion to make hiring easier and faster. We hope you will bring the same energy and share with the team.

We are looking for someone that can grow with our team over time. You will get plenty of exposure to the leadership team (think weekly), reporting directly to one of the founders or team leads.
You will succeed if you have a startup mentality of “getting sh*t done”, and you will grow as the company scales. If you are looking for a relaxed 9-5, please back away slowly. If you are insanely bright, hard working, humble, and looking to build a career on the ground floor of an exciting and fast-growing software-as-a-service (SaaS) business, this is for you.

Responsibilities

We are looking for 2 roles: Frontend Engineer / Fullstack Backend Engineer
We are looking to hire 4 - 6 pax for a period of 12 months preferably.

Frontend Engineer
Requirements:
Proficient in JavaScript.
Direct experiences on ReactJS, Redux. Nice to have experiences in dva, Ant Design, and related tools.
Understand the principles of web development.
Solid programming skills. Familiar with data structures and algorithms.
Good communication skills in English. Nice to know Chinese. 

Nice to have:
Experiences in Ruby on Rails.
Familiar with AWS.
Familiar with dev-ops.

disciplined, and curious.
Fluent with Google Sheets and (to a lesser extent) Excel.
Ability to work autonomously in a dynamic environment.
You are an excellent written and verbal communicator.
You have fantastic problem-solving abilities, analytical horsepower, an attention to detail, and a willingness to do whatever it takes to get things done.
Self-directed learner who requires little oversight.

Nice to have:
You have worked remotely before or are based around Singapore/Palo Alto.
Backend/Fullstack Engineer
Requirements
Proficient in Ruby and Rails.
Proficient in JavaScript.
Understand the principles in principles of web development.
Solid programming foundation.
Good communication skills in English. Nice to know Chinese. 


Nice to have

Knowledge of ReactJS, Redux, and related tools.
Experiences of AWS. 
Experiences of dev-ops.
Knowledge of Machine Learning/Deep Learning.

Skill sets and requirements
You are a hustler, scrappy, hungry and motivated.
You are a great networker, who is able to build trust, connect with people fast.
You are a proven and experienced sales person, business development lead, or have forged strong partnerships before.
You are humble, hungry

What we offer
 
An opportunity to be an early employee at a high-growth SaaS company and work directly with the founding team;
Full-time employees are offered comprehensive medical benefits;
A globally-distributed team who deeply cares about each other and shares ideas;
A believe that productivity is measured by output and not facetime;
Flexible, schedule with a “use it how you need it” vacation policy - we don’t believe in capping or earning hours. We trust our team to get the job done and rest/recharge as they see fit.
Help drive the culture of Workstream as we grow!
Check out our company values here! Culture fit is a must-have for us, and hopefully, these will resonate with you! https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHaeKG3IUy_1kE0y8FRnM8PPoEdMS0gmNIsSP3dG-3A/edit

title: Cloud and container security vulnerabilities assessment
description:
Project Scope / Objectives:
At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurements and make a difference in the world. You can join our mission to make a real difference through rapid solution development, turning measurement science IP into killer apps, on a hardware/OS agnostic, modern C++ foundation, delivered into an always-on, everywhere available, app store ecosystem. 

Being part of the software development team, you will work in an AGILE team to turn innovative ideas into robust software and solve complex design and implementation problems. You will also investigate new technologies and applications and apply modern software engineering practices such as design reviews, code review, unit testing and usability testing. 

Keysight's Product Security Team is responsible for secure development methodology and mechanisms for all of Keysight Technologies products and services. 

Project Scope:
•	Evaluate potential container vulnerability scanning tools as part of security evaluation of container security.
•	Implement/develop tools to automate container vulnerability assessment
•	Evaluate and implement potential cloud security assessment tools/procedures

Technical Skills:
•	Interested in programming using Python, C/C++ or C#, scripting
•	Interested in cloud and container security
applicationInstructions: Please submit your application to hui-yin.tan@keysight.com

title: In-Circuit Test System MKS Toolkit Removal Project
description:
At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurements and make a difference in the world. You can join our mission to make a real difference through rapid solution development, turning measurement science IP into killer apps, on a hardware/OS agnostic, modern C++ foundation, delivered into an always-on, everywhere available, app store ecosystem. 

Being part of the software development team, you will work in an AGILE team to turn innovative ideas into robust software and solve complex design and implementation problems. You will also investigate new technologies and applications and apply modern software engineering practices such as design reviews, code review, unit testing and usability testing.

Keysight’s In-Circuit Test (ICT) System is a leading board test solution for electronics manufacturers to tackle a wide range of PCBA test access and coverage issue for todays’ complex printed circuit assemblies. The entire ICT software building process is automated, and the result is published in a daily basis.

In this project, you will be exploring the possibility of removing MKS Toolkit from the ICT software. You will need to understand the fundamental of MKS Toolkit and how they can be replaced by Windows APIs. You will also need to test the software to make sure that the functionalities are intact after replacing the APIs. The technical documentation for mapping the MKS Toolkit and Windows APIs is also required for the project.

While working on this project, candidate will get to know the fundamental of the OS layer APIs and how ICT software utilize those APIs and how to do software unit testing. 

Technical Skills:
Must have some knowledge in C++ programming and Windows APIs.
applicationInstructions: Please submit your application to hui-yin.tan@keysight.com

title: Cloud-Based In circuit Test
description:
At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurements and make a difference in the world. You can join our mission to make a real difference through rapid solution development, turning measurement science IP into killer apps, on a hardware/OS agnostic, modern C++ foundation, delivered into an always-on, everywhere available, app store ecosystem. 

Being part of the software development team, you will work in an AGILE team to turn innovative ideas into robust software and solve complex design and implementation problems. You will also investigate new technologies and applications and apply modern software engineering practices such as design reviews, code review, unit testing and usability testing. 

In this project, you will be using cloud technologies to investigate and do a proof of concept on the possibility of migrating a legacy In circuit Test Development Application onto the cloud. In particular, AWS cloud provider. We aim to start with a simple “lift and shift” model of the current application on to the cloud and identify the various modules that will break and how we can address those with microservice architecture

title: Dynamic Parser
description:
Big Data requires transforming and loading data from many different inputs.  In this project we will create and build on parsing engines that ingest data from electronics manufacturing circuit testing equipment.

The project involves high performance single/multi-threading design catering for memory efficiency and speed as it parses millions of files and gigabytes of data.  The parser ingests structured format log files and transforms them into standard JSON/CSV output for the next layer to process.

Being part of the software development team, you will need to see the big picture first, be resourceful, and able to attend to the details. 

You need to perform research and development on core dynamic parsing data based on the requirement & configuration and able to generate JSON, XML, Flowfile or any.  The parser should be able to support any input file(s).

Integrate into existing data processing systems and test on the functionality and usability

You will also learn to apply modern software engineering practices such as design reviews, code review, unit testing, and more.

Technical Skills:
Knowledge in any programming language such as Java, Scala, C#/C++, or JavaScript

title: Development of Multimedia Self-Educational Kit
description:
At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. 
 
Keysight’s In-Circuit Test Systems are leading board test solutions applied by electronics manufacturers to ensure all Printed Circuit Board assemblies, be it intricate or complex, are shipped with confidence that they function as expected. All reputable manufacturer will have our test system available on their production floor. 
 
More features are constantly being packed into electronics products manufactured today, yet, they are also rapidly shrinking in size. The result is limited space available for placing test points on the PCB, leading to poor test quality. Boundary scan test methods are becoming ubiquitous in the manufacturing test process because they circumvent the issues from the lack of testpoints.
 
As we continue to innovate on new test techniques with intuitive features, we are also constantly applying modern methods of ensuring that our customers make the most of our test systems and apply the test features effectively. This project is to build a set of interactive multimedia self-training tool that can be viewed on-demand by the customer for them to easily understand how to use the test systems. This application or tool is intended to be installed with the system or accessed on-line. 
 
The candidate will be trained to understand the test technologies, methods and applications of the in-circuit test system in order to efficiently convey the same to the audience. Test techniques from simple resistor and capacitor tests to complex digital function tests including boundary scan tests and Silicon Nails tests will be converted into interesting and exciting visual aids describing the tips and shortcuts that the test system interface provides. The candidate will walk away with a better knowledge of the leading in-circuit test system in the industry and how to effectively and efficiently describe the features and benefits through video. 
 
Technical Skills:
Electronic Engineering or Computer Science background 
The candidate would require experience in presentation development using Microsoft Powerpoint and video editing and production.
applicationInstructions: Please submit your application to hui-yin.tan@keysight.com

title: Driving of Product Publicity through Social Media Campaigns
description:
At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. 
 
Keysight’s Products are leading in test solutions applied by research and development of electronic product manufacturers to ensure their products, be it intricate or complex, are designed, developed and shipped with confidence that they function as expected at their customer’s site. Our equipment can be found throughout the manufacturers’ sites in the labs, the innovation centers, repair centers, as well as on manufacturing floors. 
 
As companies continue to innovate on new technologies and new products, we continue to innovate on new test technologies and techniques to meet these new product and technologies. Keysight’s products cover all aspects of new product testing. From driving stable and configurable input power, to general measurement of component and power parameters, to precision driving and measuring of minute voltages and current leakages and to conducting fast and consistent in-circuit test in manufacturing, we have the right instruments for our customers. 
 
This is a multi-faceted project that drives our product publicity through new publicity channels such as social media channels, complementing and enhancing our existing publicity channels with innovative content to increase our product and technology awareness to our customers. 
 
The candidate will be trained to understand the test equipment, technologies and applications of our products in order to efficiently convey the same to the audience through the different channels. Content in text or video media will be updated, repurposed and republicized by the candidate to highlight Keysight’s constant innovations and advancements to our customers. The candidate defines and drives the publicity campaigns through selected social media channels to maximize customer awareness. Measures of success is determined through metrics like click-through rates using search engine analytics. The candidate will walk away with a better understanding of Keysight’s products, features and benefits as well as experience driving publicity of our products through social media channels.

Electronic Engineering or Computer Science background 
The candidate should have interest in technical writing, with knowledge of social media channels.

title: Creating a UI Toolbox for SFP/Operator UI
description:
At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurements and make a difference in the world. You can join our mission to make a real difference through rapid solution development, turning measurement science IP into killer apps, on a hardware/OS agnostic, modern C++ foundation, delivered into an always-on, everywhere available, app store ecosystem.  
  
This project will call to the use of an Open Sourced application started by Keysight, called OpenTAP for fast and easy development and execution of automated tests.. OpenTAP is built with simplicity, scalability and speed in mind, and is based on an extendable architecture that leverages .NET Core. OpenTAP offers a range of sequencing functionality and infrastructure that makes it possible for engineers to quickly develop plugins tailored for their automation needs – plugins that can be shared with the OpenTAP community through the OpenTAP package repository . 
 
In this project, Intern will specifically be focused on two areas: 
•	Instrument Soft Front Panels (UI of Real measurement instruments) 
•	Operator Interfaces. These are fairly light weight UIs that would live on top of the OpenTAP sequencing engine (Operator UI) or an OpenTAP Test Step/Instrument Plugin (Soft Front Panel) Ideally this would be done in an easy to use, cross platform technology (Blazor, HTML5, Avalonia, etc) 

Within Keysight, we want to help engineers create professional looking UIs outside of UI Experts. Ideally, we could have some type of focused toolbox allowing for a drag and drop “no-code” UI creation.

Technical Skills: 
Interested in software testing, GUI creation and test automation
Experience with C#, WPF and .NET Core.

Your main responsibility during this internship is as follow:
1. Assist in the planning, execution and management of integration projects

5. Assist end-users on bug fixes

title: Industrial Engineering / Engineering Support Intern
description:
Responsible for: 
-	Support IE to search for a new platform for Productivity tracking.
-	Support ES to develop new software for calibration tools tracking system.
-	Support ES to develop new application software for consumable tracking. 
-	Support ES to improve endorsement process. 

Learning Outcomes: 
-	Training on Power BI
-	Training on Endorsement
-	Understand how ES consumable tracking system.
-	Ability to generate Power BI report

Requirements: 
-	Currently pursuing a Degree in Information Technology
-	Knowledge in Develop web application, include distributed application. 
-	Knowledge of using MS Excel / PowerPoint
-	Eager to learn.
-	Good and pleasant interpersonal skills.
-	Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.

Project - Automated Calibration Systems

Topic: 
Workflow Process Improvement

Problem scenario:
Currently how tools/jigs/equipment are being tracked for maintenance/verification/calibration/loan is extremely manual and subjected to human error.
A few such errors are mis-keyed information, lapse of entry and misplaced if equipment.
Only recently have we relied on a system (windows task scheduler) to dish our reminders for calibration due dates, however this is not a long term solution. (Tracking the location of the equipment are still very manual)

Problem example: (identify the areas that human errors will occur)
A jig is required to undergo maintenance after every 2 months. A reminder is sent out via “windows task scheduler”. 
Engineering Support (ES) team is notified after searching for the jig, it is sent for maintenance. 
Now it is updated manually in SharePoint the next due date for the jig’s maintenance.

Questions:
1.	How do we approach to try and fully automate this entire process?
2.	Systems to set in place to prevent human error without adding additional workload?
3.	Report generation for audits and future tracking?
