title: Web Intern (Frontend)
description:
NetVirta is a fast-growing, venture-backed, software start-up in the emerging field of 3D scanning, computer vision & graphics. Founded by two MIT graduates, and located in the heart of Boston, we offer a precision 3D body scanning mobile app and technology platform that enables brands to seamlessly offer their customers a personalized shopping experience, either through suggesting the best fitting apparel/footwear, or offering custom-fit products.  

Imagine being able to scan your foot and knowing which shoe fits you best, or scan your body and order a custom fit suit/dress. We work with companies across a wide variety of industries and applications NetVirta’s mission is to help brands and retailers usher in the next generation of customization and personalization during the buying experience.  

We are now looking for Web Interns to join our growing technology team in the Singapore office for an internship experience!   

What’s in it for you as our intern?  
- Create Angular components 
- Understanding and extending opinionated frameworks 
- Automated Testing for Angular components 
- Continuous integration for Angular components 

What you get to try out? 
- Angular library for new feature/component 
- Automated testing suite  

Required Skills & Experience:
- Frontend Programming using Angular 
- Python Programming 

Within NetVirta, there is a high emphasis on code re-usability and maintainability. If you’re looking for an exciting career to develop game-changing 3D technologies to power the next-generation eCommerce platform, join us!

description:
What we do:

Teralytics is on a mission to change how the world moves. 
By partnering with mobile network operators, Teralytics aims to get the most accurate indicator of people’s movement – their mobile devices. Due to its complexity and scale, mobile network data has been nearly impossible to understand or utilize. That’s why we’ve pioneered a way to translate it into actionable insights which can be used to build cities with everyone’s mobility in consideration, and support clients’ day to day decisions using historic, real-time and predicted mobility patterns. 

What you will do:

title: Deep Learning on Retinal Images
description:
Every day around the world people go blind for not having access to an eye specialist. We build AI powered, portable retinal cameras that every medical practitioner can afford and use. Our technology brings eye screening to primary care, a paradigm shift needed to end preventable blindness.

Remidio, our parent company, is a fast-growing medical device startup designing smartphone-based low-cost retinal cameras. We train deep neural networks detecting retinal complications in the captured images, which we deploy on the camera itself.

We have gathered a database of about half a million retinal images and are continuously working with leading ophthalmologists. In this project, you will work on a screening solution starting from literature review to customer deployment. You will design a Deep Learning-based algorithm to detect a specific eye condition, working closely with the VP of AI as well as medical consultants.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Aerial robotics intern
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:

Polybee is building autonomous drone solutions for pollination in indoor greenhouse farming. We have developed a novel patent-pending method of pollination with drones called Aerodynamically Controlled Pollination. This is a bio-inspired approach; the turbulent wake of drones is optimizes to vibrate the flowers at just right frequencies, much like the bumblebees when they buzz-pollinate. With this method, we can pollinate tomatoes and strawberries: the biggest crops in the greenhouse sector.

In this project, you will be involved in automation of drones in greenhouses, and liaise with our computer vision and software development teams. You will build and test an autonomous drone for flight in close proximity of crops. This will involve working on the following sub-systems:

1. State estimation:
You will be exploring different strategies for indoor pose estimation such as V-SLAM. This will also involve tuning Kalman state estimator for optimal performance. 

2. Perception of the greenhouse environment
You will work closely with the computer vision team to integrate a perception pipeline for collision avoidance and flower detection. The perception sensors could either be onboard or placed at regular intervals within the indoor space. 

3. Motion planning for efficient pollination
This involves running simulations on ROS to determine optimal motion planning strategies and algorithms. This will be the last stage in the development to maximize the number of flowers pollinated per unit time. You will be involved in iterating novel deep reinforcement learning based control strategies.

Launched 2014 in Singapore, we have grown rapidly to become one of Southeast Asia's largest and fastest-growing express logistics companies. Since our inception, we’ve delivered to 100 million different customers across the region with added predictability, flexibility and convenience. Join us in our mission to connect shippers and shoppers across Southeast Asia to a world of new possibilities. 

More about us: 
- We process 250 million API requests and 3TB of data every day.
- We deliver more than 1.5 million parcels every day.
- 100% network coverage with 1000+ hubs and stations in 6 SEA markets (Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines), reaching 500 million consumers.

We are looking for world-class talent to join our crack team of engineers, product managers and designers. We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do. title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Today, work is designed to get things done. In the future, OnLoop envisions a world where work is designed to help individuals and teams get better (while getting things done). We're on a mission to build a less biased and more productive world through the deliberate day to day development of teams. We are looking for a passionate Junior Software Engineer to join us for a full time internship.
Reach out to Monisha, our Chief Of Staff at monisha@onloop.io with your resume if you're interested and keen to know more.

Who Are We?
OnLoop is a multi-platform app for teams that builds the habit of reflection, feedback and learning to help everyone develop superpowers (and overcome blindspots). Through personalised, data-driven learning and cutting-edge, AI-powered analysis, OnLoop aims to build a less biased and more productive workplace culture. Founded in April 2020, we raised a $2m seed round by November—all within six months of writing the first line of code.

The Problem we are Solving
Given the lack of purpose-built technology and the numerous tools developed with an HR-first mindset, managers like our founders have struggled to bring out the best in their people. Think of a world prior to Zoom, Slack and Microsoft Teams. For managers developing their teams, that is the world today. Not great.
The intention exists, the time doesn’t. We’ve been there. The shift to a distributed workplace has only made the pain significantly more acute. We are taking the very best in habit forming and productivity tooling to apply it to an age old problem: feedback and learning loops.

Who are Our Customers?
OnLoop is a bottoms-up SaaS company and we aim to solve the end user pain, i.e. managers and org leaders of high performing and development focused teams around the world across industries like tech, retail, healthcare, consulting, etc in various stages of growth; start-ups or MNCs. Our pilots range across companies like Snap, H&M, Uber and Google.

Our World Class Team
Our engineering org is Singapore HQ-ed with a team that is distributed across Toronto, New York, London, Mexico City and Manila. As our founders rose through the ranks at Uber and Google among other places, you can expect a Western start-up culture with a highly diverse team across race and gender. Even with our current team of twenty-six as of June 2021, sixteen are women--extremely rare for a tech start- up in Singapore! 

There are no official work hours, no fixed leave policy. We bring our whole selves to work, we are mission and team first, we work hard, and we care about the impact we make. We are launching pilots every day. We have cash in the bank, very happy enterprise customers and are heads down in build mode.

Come join a global, highly mission-driven team to bring our vision to life! Learn more about the team here: https://onloop.io/team

title: Artificial Intelligence Optimization Intern
description:
Internship Introduction:
If you’re looking for an internship where you sit in the front row, get your hands dirty and do work that creates real impact, look no further! Join Workforce Optimizer and gain the hands-on experience of working on high-value projects and consulting closely with clients as a trusted advisor to help solve real-world problems.


Company Introduction:
Complex workforce scheduling and rising labour costs have given rise to the age of automation. Started as an FYP at NUS School of Computing, our flagship product WorkforceOptimizer is a workforce management solution that incorporates cutting-edge research and innovation in optimization and machine learning to help our clients automate their administrative work. Our mission at Workforce Optimizer is to relieve the administrative burden of resource planning from healthcare professionals so that they can focus on delivering the high-quality healthcare that we all expect to enjoy in Singapore hospitals. When we deliver effective solutions to our clients, we allow them to better focus on what they are trained to do: preserving and saving lives.
Over the past decade, WorkforceOptimizer has transformed into a dominant market leader in the manpower optimization space in Singapore. Most of the 60,000 employees that we serve are concentrated in the healthcare industry in Singapore.

Department Introduction:
As an AI & Optimization Intern, you will be part of our AI & Optimization team, who are entrusted with developing optimization techniques and machine learning algorithms for resource management solutions.

Project Description:
You will start your internship with company briefings and team introduction. You will then undergo a refresher course on resource optimization and rostering, followed by product training to get you up to date with our WorkforceOptimizer software. Once set up, you’ll be ready to support the various teams by working on real projects.


Responsibilities:
• Roster Generation – Generate rosters by leveraging existing optimization solvers, including the forecasting, scheduling and optimization algorithms
• Project Support – Collaborate with the project team, including Project Managers, Consultants and Product Team, if needed, to solve a variety of problems related to optimization algorithms. The tasks include but are not limited to: 
- Gathering requirements - Support in analysis of clients' pain points, problem statements and requirements related to Optimization 
- Solutioning - Support the creation of solution designs based on client’s business requirements using our flagship product - WorkforceOptimizer
- Customization - Work with client and WorkforceOptimizer technology teams to configure and personalize WorkforceOptimizer’s product suite to align with our clients' business requirements
- Education & Training - Educate end-users on best practices 
- Testing & Review - Support testing and deployment activities to obtain clients' feedback (e.g. user-acceptance testing)

Requirements:
• Background from Computing (Algorithm & Theory specialization preferable), Operations Research, Industrial Systems Engineering or Applied Mathematics
• Possesses knowledge of, or is familiar with mathematical optimization using Operations Research, and Constraint Programing
• Highly motivated, able and willing to learn new things


Benefits:
• Working alongside some of the best talents in optimization (we even have two Doctors in the house!)
• Opportunity to deepen your technical understanding on optimization by working extensively with our cutting-edge product
• Experience collaborative cross-functional work experience
• Having first-hand account of a real-life application of computing knowledge

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description: Primarily responsible for the application development of the ecommerce trading platform and exchange application suite, including the system architectural framework design and implementation, code development, unit testing and system integration, support regression testing, and providing post production support.

Detailed activities include:
● Perform clarifications on functional and system requirement specifications, translate into DevOps based scope of epics and stories, then carry out development in scrum and sprint modes; provide periodic and timely progress update via dashboard.
● Design and implement system and data architectural framework, including front-end, back-end, and full-stack, and also perform on-going assessment and improvement.
● Produce and maintain documentation of overall solution, including for both system architecture and code level, as well as software release notes.
● Adopt application development best practice including modular design and usage of configuration tables in place of variable input hardcoding.
● Develop harness for performing of automated unit testing, and also unit test cases with comprehensive functional coverage. Also support test engineers on regression testing, including System Integration, System Functional, User Acceptance testing, as well as Load and Performance testing.
● Provide post production support to service desk on reported functional issues, including troubleshooting and defect resolution.
● Provide support to Product Managers on overall product development roadmap definition.

title: PLR Reliability Electro-Migration Mechanism Modelling
description:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION

For Integration Circuits (IC), one of the reliability failure mechanism is Electro-Migration (EM). This project is to study the physics and failure mechanism of EM in IC, perform package level EM test through the effect of different bias stress and temperature on aluminum metal lines as well as Tungsten Vias Interconnect. Final analysis includes EM test model build up.



ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Student will be taught device reliability degradation mechanism at wafer-level and package ICs, perform EM test to make analysis for different parameters to derive a lifetime model.



LEARNING OUTCOMES

Student will be able to understand, analyse and model EM effect on IC reliability performance lifetime.

title: Computer Vision Intern
description:
F-drones is a Singapore-based start-up with a vision for a world where maritime logistics is more efficient and sustainable. We develop and operate proprietary aerial delivery drones, which can ultimately deliver 100kg loads over 100km, to ships and offshore platforms. We are proud to be the first in the world to commence 24x7 commercial drone delivery operations. 

Our patent pending drone is a unique concept designed to lift 100kg payloads over 100km. It takes-off vertically, the entire airframe rotates to fly like a fixed-wing plane and rotates back to land vertically on moving targets. With no moving parts, it is something that the world has never seen at scale! 

Role 
This position is for systems integration, development and testing of multiple UAV designs we are working  on.  The  role  involves  working  on  integration  challenges  with  OEM  components  and  testing  various  component  options.  You  are  required  to  identify  right  vendors,  liaise with them and  assist  in  outsourcing  design  related  requirements.  You  will  participate  in  defining  and  validating  Standard  Operating  Procedures  (SoP),  UAV  maintenance  manuals,  and  operation methodologies.  This  role  also  involves  assisting  in  documentation  pertaining  to  regulatory  requirements and operations, and in the assembly & testing of proprietary UAVs. 
 
We are developing world-class computer vision systems for Beyond the Visual Line of Sight Navigation (BVLOS) of drones along with the ability to achieve centimeter-level landing accuracies on moving surfaces. The drones will also be able to avoid obstacles and unsafe landing locations, and be equipped with seamless fusion of GPS, VIO and other sensor-based navigation to provide the best overall mission accuracy. 
 
- Work on capturing images and scene information from an on-board stereo camera on a drone
- Post-process the data gathered to train the robotic system (do 3D reconstructions, generate point clouds, extract depth information)
- Test and evaluate current state-of-the-art methods used for scene segmentation
- Make use of Machine learning/AI/Deep learning techniques to optimise our algorithm for vision-based landing system
- Create and update technical documentation, analyze results and provide conclusive reports
 
 
Your profile 
- Currently pursuing Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Robotics
- Experience working on Vision systems/LiDAR, Image Processing, SLAM, Multi-sensor fusion, Reinforcement/Regression/Unsupervised learning
- Strong background in sensing, localization, behavior, and path-planning for probabilistic robotics (including computer vision, vision-based localization and mapping, robot perception, robot behavior, machine learning for mobile robots, and autonomous/aerial vehicle development)
- 2+ years programming experience in C++, Python, ROS, Linux
- Experience with CV/ML libraries and tools like OpenCV, Tensorflow etc.
- Software development experience using version control platforms like Git
- Experience in the entire product development lifecycle, and able to prioritise and meet deadlines
- You preach and put into practice the importance of maintainability, relentless testing and enjoy implementing best practices
- Team player who can also be independent, prioritize work and thrives in a fast-paced dynamic environment
 
What do you get 
- Get unparalleled learning opportunities in a fast-growing deep tech startup 
- Learn about the development and commercialisation cycles of large-scale drones
- Work hard, play hard
- Fun and dynamic culture

title: Project Officer
description:
About Cambridge CARES:
The Cambridge Centre for Advanced Research and Education (CARES) was established in 2013 as the University of Cambridge’s first research centre outside the UK. It brings together researchers from the University of Cambridge, Nanyang Technological University and National University of Singapore to work on problems relevant to Singapore and the world at large.

About internship job description:
Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) have the potential to increase efficiency of energy provision and industrial production, and hence possess great emissions reduction potential. This potential increases further when CPS are combined with Artificial Intelligence (AI). The World Avatar project intends to support this by representing every aspect of the real world in a digital "avatar" world. This is being realised through a comprehensive virtualisation of entities as well as connectivity to real-time data such that the digital world remains up to date and that analyses based on the data remain self-consistent. Through an ontological representation of data in a knowledge-graph in combination with an eco-system of autonomously operating AI agents, interoperability and automation in complex decarbonisation process can be achieved. In particular, we are interested in developing energy and grid models to investigate the transformation of global energy systems with CPS.
The individual will work with an interdisciplinary and multi-national team, comprised of researchers from around the world. The individual will also learn how to: 
1. Acquire and process data; 
2. Develop ontology for the acquired data; 
3. Instantiate semantic representations of the acquired data. 

Internship competencies and requirements:
• Willingness to acquire software skills and knowledge about Semantic Web technology and knowledge graph. 
• Experience with or willingness to learn general-purpose programming languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, C/C++. Training will be provided for those without programming background.

title: Digital Twin_NPAMT
description:
The site goals are to “Improve the yield efficiency campaign over campaign”, to “improve cost of goods”, and to “make Jurong site the best New Product Introduction (NPI) site in the manufacturing supply chain”.

As a drive in this direction and to assist the site achieve these goals, a low-cost, safe and qualified Digital Twin approach would be pursued. A Digital Twin in brief is a simulated representation of physical plant assets and underlying chemical/physical processes within them (i.e. chemical reactions, separation processes, heat transfer, process equipment, instrumentation and controls). It understands, troubleshoots, predicts and optimizes performance to achieve improved business outcomes.

Project scope

For this project, key product processes will be chosen as a test-bed to build a digital twin, and the aim would be for the model to closely resemble the real unit on site. The model would be reconciled with the plant data to closely mimic the actual operating unit operation on site, literally acting as a live (or offline) Twin. The twin model will be validated with plant data (static and dynamic data), optimized and examined for process control studies to minimize variability in the outputs (Critical Quality Attributes or CQAs).
Learning outcome

The Twin if successful can also support as a key validation tool to facilitate safe, low-cost testing of change orders and help run unit/plant close to optimal solutions. The twin model if desired can be tasked to connect with live plant data and used for monitoring and quality adherence tasks. The long-term objective would be to use the twin model that can be used for OPEX, CAPEX and Maintenance initiatives. 
The student will learn about Pharma Primary Manufacturing and the introduction of novel, advanced technologies to satisfy business value drivers. The student will acquire knowledge on the interconnectivity across operational, engineering and quality functions to deliver the new technology solution for improving the reliability of equipment for plant operation. The student will be immersed in the site activities and understand how compliance to the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) is critical to the site.
The student will be able to apply his/her knowledge of engineering, data/computer sciences and analytics and learn

title: Full Stack Developer Intern (Machine Learning)
description:
SAP is a global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact. SAP AI Business Services Singapore is an innovation arm of SAP. The group significantly contributes to SAP's product portfolio and extends its leading position in the market by identifying and shaping emerging IT trends and generating breakthrough technologies through AI.

SAP AI Business Services combine the creativity and agility of a start-up with the backbone of a world market leader in business software. The focus of the team is to embed and develop Machine Learning solutions into business enterprise solutions. In collaboration with leading universities, partners, customers, and SAP product groups, SAP Research drives the development of promising ideas and prototypes into market-ready software for maximum customer value.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
You will work as a student intern in fast-paced research projects and apply software engineering principles and concepts to help create new and innovative research prototypes. You would be designing and analyzing software architectures and implement software prototypes. This internship gives you the unique opportunity to work with a multifaceted team to build enterprise systems for large scale commercial use. Your work in this internship will directly impact the millions of people currently using SAP solutions. The duration of the internship is 3-6 months full-time.

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
•	You are currently studying for an information technology degree in: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, or Information Systems
•	You have excellent communication skills: oral, written, and in presentations
•	You have hands-on software development skills, such as:
	Programming: Python, JAVA
	Database: SQL-based databases (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL)
•	Background in basic machine learning techniques is a plus

title: Security Analyst Intern
description: Project Description / Internship Job Description: Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more relevant than ever before in our lives. Our employees' revolutionary ideas impact everything imaginable - from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, smart cars, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means you’ll take creative ideas from the drawing board to powerful solutions that have real world impact. You’ll interface with Cisco leaders, partner with experienced mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You’ll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you’ll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be inspired. Team Description The Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) reduces the risk of loss as a result of security incidents for Cisco-owned businesses. CSIRT regularly engages in proactive threat assessment, mitigation planning, incident detection and response, incident trending with analysis, and security architecture. Cisco Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) is looking to hire an intern for the position of Cybersecurity SOC Analyst with interest and exposure in one or more of the following fields: • Network administration • System administration (Windows or Unix) • IT security with a focus on computer Operating systems, log analysis, malicious code/exploits, anti-virus, etc. • Web application and script development What You’ll Do ● As an intern, you will shadow our SOC analysts to learn on the job, to help sustain and improve usage of security tools to help deliver CSIRT's security monitoring and incident response services. CSIRT deploys and support network IDS, proxy-based malware filtering solutions, host intrusion prevention tools, log management and analysis, device syslog processing, and network traffic inspection tools. CSIRT develops custom integration tools for interfacing with Cisco infrastructure, security tools, and for conducting security investigations. ● Based on the business need, your skillset, and your preference, you will be involved in one or more of the following activities: ● Work to setup and tune monitoring plays involving multiple security monitoring products and data feeds ● Work to develop and tune documented process for incident and alert handling. Manage schedule to ensure operational effectiveness & on-time delivery of all work consistent with documented requirements ● Escalate to CSIRT investigators and external support teams to assist in analysis and event resolution. Document cases, procedures, analysis, and investigations accurately and thoroughly (including best-practice documentation). Inform higher-level priorities, improvements and problem resolutions to improve effectiveness of Cisco CSIRT & InfoSec. Constructively challenge and improve existing tools, processes and procedures. Assist CSIRT with continued enhancement of Cisco's security tools. Assume additional responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications ● Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or master's degree in IT / CS / MIS / Information Security or equivalent operational experience and be familiar with Windows exploits, malware and malicious code trends, Splunk software. ● Demonstrate good customer service, communications, and troubleshooting skills. You are able and willing to follow process and demonstrate past examples, including case handling. ● Willing to work slightly off-hours including rotational on-call, conduct security event analysis, provide coordination and primary response to security incidents ● Demonstrate interest and knowledge of security trends, especially hacking technologies including trojans, viruses, and worms ● Demonstrate knowledge of TCP/IP and application in securing systems, investigating security incidents About Cisco The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.

title: Intern Quant Researcher
description:
Job Description

Squarepoint is a global investment management firm that utilizes a diversified portfolio of systematic and quantitative strategies across financial markets that seeks to achieve high quality, uncorrelated returns for our clients. We have deep expertise in trading, technology and operations and attribute our success to rigorous scientific research. As a technology and datadriven firm, we design and build our own cutting-edge systems, from high performance trading platforms to large scale data analysis and compute farms. With main investment offices in New York, London and Singapore, we emphasize true, global collaboration by aligning our investment, technology and operations teams functionally around the world.

Overview of Quant Researcher Intern Position:
• Research and implement strategies within the firm’s automated trading framework.
• Analyze large data sets using advanced statistical methods to identify trading opportunities.
• Develop a strong understanding of market structure of various exchanges and asset classes.
Typical Day of Quant Researcher:
• Primary focus throughout the day is on researching and implementing trading ideas.

Skill Set Required For Position:
• Quantitative background - includes degrees in Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Financial Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science and Physics.
• Programming proficiency with at least one major programming or scripting language (e.g. C++, Java, Python).
• Strong communication skills and ability to work well with colleagues across multiple regions.
• Ability to work well under pressure.

title: Algorithm Research Intern
description:
Responsibilities

•	Conduct one or more research topics, including but not limited to 1) 3D vision (3D object detection, 3D tracking, point cloud segmentation, point cloud completion, point cloud registration, 3D shape analysis, 3D reconstruction) and 2) virtual humans (human mesh recovery via human parametric models such as SMPL, human pose estimation, garment reconstruction, motion generation) etc.
•	Engage in the innovation and implementation of algorithms and maintain our leading position of algorithm in academia and industry; Conduct research, implementation and comparison on the latest algorithms.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
•	Bachelor candidate or above in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, and related technical filed or equivalent.
•	Experience in Computer Vision, Machine Learning Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Data mining or Artificial Intelligence related.
•	Programming experience in one or more of the following: C/C++, python; Experience with Caffe/Tensorflow/Pytorch and related Deep Learning frameworks.
•	Innovative and passionate about technology; Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills; Self-challenging and able to adapt to a fast-paced environment; Good communication skills; Ability to work independently.

Preferred Qualifications

•	Strong research ability to conduct research on the innovative design of algorithms as well as implementation.

•	Experience in competitions including ACM-ICPC, SC-SCC and so on; Experience in Machine Learning/Computer Vision related competitions, including ImageNet, Kaggle and well-known competitions at home & abroad.

title: EMBEDDED SYSTEMS INTERNSHIP
description:
Company Description

Advantir Innovations is a global food tech company headquartered in Singapore, their flagship product is Swirl.GO (www.swirlgo.com) , the "Nespresso" of desserts. Advantir is an institutionally backed company with a mission is to create the perfect dessert experience on every countertop. Over the past 2 years, Advantir has achieved the following accolades

•	Successfully raised > US$1M from institutional funds
•	Most Tech Driven Company @ Ideasinc 2018, 
•	Champion of Foodtech Category for IPHatch Day 2018 
•	Top 20 finalist in the Korea Grand Startup Challenge 2019 held in Korea. 
•	2019 TTA Accelerator Top 10 (Taiwan) 
•	Space-F X Weworks Labs Foodtech Accelerator 2019 (Thailand) 

Job Description

We are looking for an embedded systems / electronics engineer to join our young and ambitious team. He/she will test and implement electronics and firmware systems to support the product development lifecycle of our products. New hires will be joining a company at an inflection point where there is a good mix of design, R&D as well as manufacturing level projects. 
The engineer will work with the product lead & other technical leaders to ensure the successful design, validation, implementation of electronic and firmware systems.

A “can do” attitude, inquisitive thirst for knowledge and passion for building new products will be important for success in this role. 
Job duties include:
•	Design and implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment
•	Design, develop, code, test and debug system software
•	Prototyping with Arduino or other microcontrollers
•	Analyze and enhance efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources
•	Support software QA and optimize I/O performance
•	Provide post production support
•	Interface with hardware design and development

Requirements

•	Experience in embedded systems or electronics engineering
•	Candidature towards / Attained Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in electronics engineering / aerospace engineering
•	Competence in Python and C

title: Software Developer Internship
description:
[Introduction to TeamSpirit]
TeamSpirit is a publicly listed fast-growing software-as-a-service (SaaS) company offering a wide range of workforce management solutions. We are an award-winning Saas provider and a valued Salesforce AppExchange Partner since 2010.

TeamSpirit specializes in an integrated approach combining multiple business functions with technology, artificial intelligence and data. At TeamSpirit, we strive to serve more medium-sized and large enterprises with our premium software solutions.

At the moment we are serving more than 300,000 corporate users in nearly 1,500 companies. We have offices in Tokyo and Singapore with a truly diverse international team. TeamSpirit actively helps employees with their experience, career continuity and growth while embodying the core values of the TeamSpirit. Company offers a variety of growth options for the career path of engineers.

Our members contribution isn't dictated by their title, their past experience or the volume of their voices. Their impact comes down to their willingness to work hard to make a difference in our customers’ live and to step outside of their comfort zone.

[Why TeamSpirit Internship & What Will You Learn & Achieve With During Your Internship]
# You will get a chance to work and learn from highly motivated and skilled developers within a Scrum team as a member.
# You will be able to take ownership of a part of the real-life production feature and make meaningful contributions.

title: Software Engineer Internship
description:
Company Description:
Airsquire believes that managing what should have been built against what was actually built should be effortless during construction. Our mission is to build the simplest construction time capsule in the world. Our vision is to let construction traverse space and time. 

We have two product lines. AirGo is a 360° virtual “google street view” of construction sites that help project teams cost-effectively visualise and manage progress. AirSync is an A.I. assistant to help BIM modellers automatically compare their 3D models against point clouds scans for as-built BIM geometric verification. 

We were founded in 2017 and have since established trusted client partnerships with top AEC firms in Asia and Europe. We are also invested by top B2B SaaS Venture Capital firm HenQ and accelerator Rockstart. Our key result is to achieve category leadership in a fast growing market of construction productivity that is recognized by McKinsey and Deloitte with a $1.6 trillion opportunity worldwide.

We have a diverse and talented international team that believes in a shared mission and single set of principles. We believe purpose is more important than history as a guiding light both professionally and personally. We value grit and growth mindset that keeps us humble, experimental, and open-minded. We apply focus and speed to navigate and break new grounds.

Internship Job Description:
You will have a significant influence on our overall strategy by helping to define our product features, design system architecture, and spearhead the best practices for quality. You will work alongside with product management, research, design, and engineering to define and build the essential lovable product. You will be responsible for creating reliable, scalable, and high performance products.  

Responsibilities:
~ Participate in the complete software engineering cycle
~ Engage in technical architecture design 
~ Write clean, testable, effective, well-documented code
~ Full Stack development with a focus on front-end and mobile and/or Computer Vision A.I. algorithm development

~ Experience in Full-stack development with a variety of languages and technologies in both backend and frontend including but not limited to Typescript, Node.js, ReactJS, MongoDB, Redis, Docker, Kubernetes etc
~ Experience with UI frameworks and libraries(Ant design, Bootstrap, Ionic etc)

~ Bonus: has experience in Computer Vision A.I. techniques

title: AI Engineer
description:
uParcel is the largest Singapore home-grown same-day delivery platform with 15,000 registered delivery agents and over 5000 clients, offering 24/7 courier services to customers in Singapore.
Operating on a decentralised distributed model, the company delivers packages point to point without consolidating them at warehouses. Instead, the uParcel AI system matches delivery bookings to their network of crowdsourced drivers in real time, providing fast and flexible delivery options for the growing ecommerce sector. You will get to learn AI/ML optimization, AWS well architecture, full stack app development  

We are rapidly expanding our team and will be offering full time positions to outstanding members whom have completed their internship with uParcel.


Job Scope
Your job scope will include but not limited to
1. Develop, create, and modify general computer applications software or specialized utility programs. 
2. Analyze user needs and develop software solutions. 
3. Design software or customize software for client use with the aim of optimizing operational efficiency. 
4. May analyze and design databases within an application area, working individually or coordinating database development as part of a team. 
5. Correct errors by making appropriate changes and rechecking the program to ensure that the desired results are produced.
6. Conduct trial runs of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired information and that the instructions are correct.
7. Write, analyze, review, and rewrite programs, using workflow chart and diagram, and applying knowledge of computer capabilities, subject matter, and symbolic logic.
8. Consult with managerial, engineering, and technical personnel to clarify program intent, identify problems, and suggest changes.
9. Perform systems analysis and programming tasks to maintain and control the use of computer systems software as a systems programmer.
10. Compile and write documentation of program development

description:

TeamSpirit is a publicly listed fast-growing software-as-a-service (SaaS) company offering a wide range of workforce management solutions. We are an award-winning Saas provider and a valued Salesforce AppExchange Partner since 2010.

TeamSpirit specializes in an integrated approach combining multiple business functions with technology, artificial intelligence and data. At TeamSpirit, we strive to serve more medium-sized and large enterprises with our premium software solutions.

At the moment we are serving more than 300,000 corporate users in nearly 1,500 companies. We have offices in Tokyo and Singapore with a truly diverse international team. TeamSpirit actively helps employees with their experience, career continuity and growth while embodying the core values of the TeamSpirit. title: Intern (Jan 2022) - Information Technology (HR Information System)
description:
About our group:
The Seagate HR Systems Team develops and implements information system plans that meet our HR automation, data and digital records requirements. Using a cloud based HR system, we provide an integrated technology platform with simple self-service and reporting capability.  We manage our global HR management system and perform system configuration.  We work closely with HR product and Service Centers and act as technical liaison between HR, our internal IT teams and HR systems vendors.  

About the role - you will:
- Execute system configuration changes and participate in all aspects of system requirements gathering, testing and production deployment 
- Manage, support and direct all phases of a HR System program/ project or direct integration/interface from inception to completion 
- Provided administrative, configuration, testing and production deployment support to all team members 
- Be able to provide HR systems maintenance and support with minimum supervision 
- Apply technical knowledge of HR cloud base management systems 

About you:
- Well versed in IT, Computer Science or other Engineering majors 
- Self-motivated, independent and a team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both oral and written 
- Collaborate well with both internal and external stakeholders 
- Good knowledge of general IT principles related to development changes, testing cycles and deployment strategies 
- Effective Project Management skills to drive HR and IT related configuration changes, interface changes and HR transformation projects 
- Acquired Project Management and MS Office skills 

Location:
The Shugart site (named after Seagate’s founder, Al Shugart) is a research and design center. Easily accessible from the One-North MRT Station, many employees choose to take mass-transportation to work. Ample free on-site parking is also available. Being a purpose built building; The Shugart has excellent employee recreational facilities. Take an active break at our badminton courts, table tennis tables, in-house gym and recreation rooms. Our yoga and zumba classes are very popular. We also offer classes and interest groups in photography, gardening and foreign languages, and have various on-site celebrations, and community volunteer opportunities.

title: Learning and Application of Integrated Work System (IWS) – Generalist
description:
Intern under this Project would have a better understanding on IWS System and its application to Manufacturing Industry. IWS is an extensive set of capabilities and asset that creates differentiated results compared to traditional operational improvement programs learnt in Textbooks.

By the end of internship, Intern would be able to apply Daily Management System (DMS) and appreciate its capability to review production performance and area of opportunities in the Factory.
These DMS includes; 
              Incident Elimination DMS -  use to address work safety related issue
              Defect Handling DMS – use to resume equipment to base condition and achieve high equipment efficiency
`             Center Line DMS – use to standardize equipment set point in order to achieve good product quality and equipment efficiency
              Clean Inspect & Lubrication DMS – use to perform equipment cleaning and find defect that will cause losses to production efficiency and quality
Breakdown Elimination DMS – use to analyses component failure and CAPA to eliminate recurrence of break down
Maintenance Preventive & Scheduling DMS –  use to develop preventive maintenance task based on DMS outcome, to achieve cost reduction.

title: Software Development Engineer(Intern)
description:
We're a Singapore based software consulting firm trying to find exceptionally smart people with strong development skills and an avid interest in web development. You should be able to learn quickly and work independently - we'll help you as best as we can, but you must be tenacious and resourceful enough to figure out things you don't know how to do. 


Openings

- Front-end (Javascript) developers
- Web developers


Requirements

- Solid programming ability in at least one language
- Clear and precise written communication. A large part of our team works remotely and it's vital that you are able to document ideas, progress and problems with clarity so everyone can work asynchronously.
- You must be happy to work independently (remote welcome) and be able to structure timelines, take ownership and responsibility and communicate clearly.

Any experience in the one or more of the following is a definite plus:

- Worked on non-trivial Javascript applications
- VueJS experience
- Development experience in C# or Python

If you've built something in the past, do let us know. Github and/or StackOverflow profiles are welcome.

You'll get to work in a fast-paced environment, with a great team of full-stack engineers who have a lot of experience in building large software applications from scratch.

-----
About Us

The Software Practice is a technology development firm that builds software for clients and its own business. Our core strength is in developing large and complex web and mobile applications by architecting and implementing robust, scalable and performant software.
We started our firm working with entrepreneurs who brought expertise in specific industry verticals but required a technical team that could help them realise their product ideas. We partnered with them as their product teams helping them build their MVP, talk to customers and refine the product, raise money, and even hire their in-house tech teams while remaining as consultants. 
  
Now, our work spans across both public and private sectors where we've done several CTO-for-hire and product-team-for-hire gigs for entrepreneurs and enterprises looking to move fast. Our clients range from small start-ups looking to build and launch their product from scratch, to large enterprises (e.g. Government Agencies in Singapore such as DSTA, NEA, A*STAR and PUB) requiring innovative solutions in critical business workflows. Our enterprise clientele includes some of the largest SE Asian banks, Fortune 500 IT firms and one of Asia’s largest airports. 

Our culture is results-driven that values execution and creativity. You'll get a lot of ownership over your deliverables, and we trust you to ship high quality products on time. You will be part of a high performing cross functional team where you get to witness the direct impact of your work - seeing applications go live and seeing real-world usage.

description:

As a software & test engineer in production engineering department, you need to understand the test automation needs for engineering or production parts characterization, and provide full programming support to enable test automation or semi-automation. You will also be assigned to hands on the engineering test, compile & analyze the data with coaching to understand the electrical and optical behaviors of DLS laser products.

- Support test data analysis and issue troubleshooting on a project basis.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Characterizing quantum emitters and nanophotonic devices
description:
We are studying various quantum emitters (e.g. nanodiamonds, 2D materials), and how they can be integrated with nanophotonic device components (e.g. wavguide-coupled photodetectors).

Available project areas:

- Building, assembling, and optimising various setup components, e.g. confocal microscope, temperature control, optical fibers.

- Integrated software control, with automation routines for efficient data-taking. Programming experience, esp python, is highly desired.

- Characterizing quantum emitters and nanophotonic devices to investigate their electrical and optical properties.

Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE)

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Quantum nanosensing with diamond NV centers on AFM platform
description:
This project will be integrated with our ongoing research efforts to integrate suitably-designed diamond nanoprobes with an atomic force microscope (AFM). Nitrogen-vacancy (NV) centres in these diamond nanoprobes can be utilized in high-precision quantum sensing, especially of magnetic fields. We aim to realize a quantum nanosensing platform with nanoscale resolution and high sensitivity

description:
System Analyst (intern), Chilli Api Catering Pte Ltd
Chilli Api Catering Pte Ltd provides Halal catering services for both corporate offices and private functions. We are established in the catering industry for our authentic and palatable Peranakan cuisines. No doubt Peranakan food is our specialty, we also feature a fusion of international dishes on our menus to provide our clients with more freedom in terms of choices, tastes and preferences.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Chilli Api Catering Pte Ltd is looking for a System Analyst (intern) who is passionate about managing and running multiple projects. Specific responsibilities of the System Analyst’s role include:
•	Able to code in Python for new and existing internal projects
•	Project manage multiple projects to go live. This includes gathering requirements, firming up the process, testing of systems, and liaising with vendors on system issues.
•	Work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to understand business process and system process requirements and implement them in line with strategic direction
•	Assist in supporting organization’s technology products such as phone, email, and basic web application system e.g. upload images to website.
•	Work closely with functional users in computer troubleshooting and answering IT questions. 
•	Perform any ad hoc duties assigned from time to time.
•	Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
•	Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
•	Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
•	Performing requirements analysis.
•	Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
•	Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
•	Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
•	Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
•	Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff.
•	Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency.
•	Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
•	Performing user acceptance testing.
•	Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
•	Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
•	Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
•	Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
•	Managing competing resources and priorities.
•	Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.

REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE
•	Working with vendor to maintain network, hardware and software
•	Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
•	A bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Business or related field

title: Intern, Software Developer (Back-End)
description:
About the Unit
There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.

In 2017, Yara created a new digital development unit to build solutions for smallholder farming communities. Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.



Responsibilities
Work within a product team with a product manager, designers, and developers to create solutions and apps focused on our different customers’ needs 
Participate in the full lifecycle of a product, from early stage rapid prototyping through to full market release and continuous improvement after initial launch 
Develop front-end components of responsive web applications with emphasis in mobile applications
Write clean, testable, scalable and maintainable code that complies with web standards and best practices  

Required Profile
Good fundamentals and working knowledge in building simple micro-services backends using Nodejs.
Excited to learn about Cloud-based services; bonus points for deploying/hosting backend services on AWS, Azure or GCP.
Enjoy working in a quick prototypes/MVPs of mobile and web applications, agile environment. 
Basic understanding of concepts such as service-oriented architecture, single page applications and micro-services is an advantage.
Excellent written and oral communication in English. 
Passionate for learning new technology and a ambition to add value to self and company.


Additional information
We encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply and are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances.

Why us?

Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.
agencyAddress: 2 Alexandra Rd, #06-03 Delta House, Singapore, 159919, SINGAPORE

description:

Responsibilities

Assist with maintaining various reporting and ETL process required to build insights using appropriate tools with documentation adequate for other team's perusal

Assist the data analyst in documentation of the findings, pipelines and information architecture

Required Profile

Basic/Intermediate level of proficiency with Python or SQL and related toolsets and databases

Knowledge of core statistical techniques

Must be detail-oriented in order to comfortably execute data-stitching and data-cleaning efforts

Desire to explore a mix of data analytics, marketing, product management, and consequently reinforce one’s business acumen

Interest in customer lifecycle marketing (awareness, consideration, conversion, word of mouth, loyalty, etc.) for B2B/B2C/C2C business models

Interest in mobile app and web analytics tool, tag management system, attribution modelling, etc.

Interest in learning about AWS products and ecosystems, and data architecture set-ups

Aligned with our principles: agile, customer-centric, lean, service-oriented architecture, self-organization, transparency.

Duration of internship: 3-6 months (6 months preferable)

 

Additional information

We encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply and are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances.

Why us?

Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.

Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.

Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.

Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.

Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.

Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Automation of Metasurface Phase Measurement
description:
Metasurface is composed of nanoscale antenna which can modulate the phases of incident light in subwavelength scale, it promises a great potential in development of novel micro and nanoscale photonic devices. In order to characterize the phase modulation property of device, a fast and precise measurement of the phase value of the device is crucial. In this project, we will upgrade an existing Linnik interferometer based measurface phase measurement setup to be fully automated through software programming and hardware implementation to enable the measurement be done in a fast and precise way.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Neural Networks and Machine Learning using Optics
description:
With the end of Moore’s law approaching, researchers are looking for new technologies that will allow computing systems to continue to improve in terms of performance and energy efficiency. In particular, optical technologies have attracted interest as having significant potential.

In this project, we will study state-of-the-art neural network (NN) architectures and benchmark their optical implementation against electronics. We aim to critically evaluate the performance limits of optical NNs and to discover novel and performant NN architectures that are custom designed for optics in mind.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] From nano-to-macro scale design of optical metasurfaces
description:
Metasurfaces exploit light-matter interactions at the nanoscale to create devices with complex functionalities and ultra-small form factors. The design of these systems requires precise engineering of their nanoscale basic building blocks (so called nanoantennas) and their macroscopic arrangements. Full wave simulations, suited for nanostructure design, cannot be used on the macro scale due to limited computational power. Thus, new tools to bridge the gap between the nano- and the macroscale are necessary. This project aims at developing such tools and implement them on Python.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Machine learning optimization of nanophotonic structures
description:
The majority nanophotonic designs follow from physical intuition. This, usually, translates into a limited choice of geometrical shapes when designing these system. Recently, an alternative design approach has emerged, using artificial intelligence (AI)-assisted methodologies. It has been shown that more complex geometries obtained using this approach allow for significant improvement of device efficiencies. The goal of this project is to use machine learning and AI techniques to design novel photonic devices with enhanced efficiencies, in particular in the field of optical metasurfaces.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Fast multi-user quantum key distribution network
description:
Quantum communication could be made global with a small footprint. There are 2 major fundamental limitations. Firstly, current QKD systems are restricted to point-to-point designs. Secondly, there is a low throughputs achievable by current QKD systems. This proposal aims to liberate these constraints with a new QKD network protocol, using only a single (untrusted) quantum server for key exchange. The project will deliver a QKD network technology (TRL 6-7) that is scalable, cost-effective, and fast. A complete quantum network demonstration over NUS fibre network is the final deliverable.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Machine learning for robot tactile perception
description:
Humans' skin has evolved to be able to detect different objects and identify their properties. However, current touch (tactile) sensors in the robots are not studied well and there is still uncertainty about how the tactile data shall be represented to achieve similar results as humans. In this project, we investigate on machine learning approaches in tactile perceptual representations in carrying out different tasks.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Tactile-guide robot motion planning/control
description:
When a robot manipulator is to handle an object located in a dense/cluttered environment, the visual info may not be sufficient to guide its motions. In such case, a tactile sensor, providing the additional information from the physical interaction between the manipulator and the environment, can help the manipulator to pass through the dense environment and approach the target object. In this project, we aim to explore the motion planning frameworks and algorithms based on tactile sensor feedback for a robot manipulator so that its end-effector can reach an object through a dense environment.

description:
Robotic technology for manufacturing is rapidly changing. Robots are becoming safer and progressing towards the digital space, which will drive innovation for developing more collaborative processes for the industry. ARTC robotics group is developing innovative capabilities in robotic processes such as vision-guided robotic pick-and-place, mobile manipulation, collaborative assembly, component handling & logistics. This project will focus on developing grasp planning algorithms for handling novel objects using AI technologies such as reinforcement learning

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Motion planning for optimized robot trajectories
description:
Optimal motion planning is a classical problem in robotics and remains an active research topic. Following recent trends of flexible manufacturing, robot trajectories can no longer be fine-tuned offline, and must be computed on-the-fly based inputs from various sensors, e.g. 2D and 3D cameras. In case of collaborative or mobile robots, the system must also be able to react to changes in the environment. In this project, we aim to develop algorithms for computing optimal, collision-free trajectories for the robot based on sensor inputs.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Collaborative Sensing for Context-aware Navigation
description:
This project investigates context-aware navigation in a human rich environment, using a collaborative multi-robot approach. We combine the sensory readings from multiple robots, and examine the utility of the expanded sensor horizon for people detection and trajectory analysis.
The goal is to allow a robot to navigate in a more socially compliant manner.
The sub-tasks include: (1) collaborative localization; (2) sensor fusion; (3) implement in ROS (cost-map) (4) simulation in Gazebo

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Capacitive Imaging for non-destructive testing in industries
description:
In a high-volume food and beverage production environment, non-destructive and real-time inspection of various stages of food production from raw material processing to product assembly in real-time at high speed is a challenge. Specifically, contamination, powder caking, seal integrity, package integrity and product quality assessment are some issues, which are currently addressed using human inspection and/or destructive, expensive and offline screening methodologies. This is addressed utilizing a novel non-destructive method based on capacitance.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Inferring left behind commuters in MRT using ticketing data
description:
This project will involve analysing farecard data to infer the boarding patterns of commuters in metro systems, especially in congested conditions where commuters experience unable to board (UTB) events. Quantifying UTBs is helpful to measure the level of service provided and develop strategies to mitigate such events. As UTBs are not directly evident from farecard data, some data analytics and processing is required. In past work, we have shown that commuters can be reliably assigned to trains in the network. As an extension, UTB numbers can then be inferred from this result.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Development of agile locomotion system for legged robots
description:
This project aims to develop an agile locomotion system based on legged robots. It will mainly focus on the implementation of algorithms involving simulation and real robot setup, legged locomotion, localization and navigation. Optimization based methods will be explored to achieve legged locomotion considering motion stability and smoothness. System integration is also critical and will be carefully concerned due to the strick payload and battery power constraints of legged robots who are expected to be light and agile.

•	Show Commitment to deliver project on time and on budget
•	Work collaboratively with Team to achieve shared goals
•	Prioritize Task to maximize resource and efficiency

Programme Outline
Orientation Phase (2 months)
•	Understand Process flow, Process Principles, Potential improvement via digital transformation

Operational Phase (2 – 4 months)
•	Project 1
o	Develop Web-based Dashboard for ST/LT Usage for usage within local context
o	Work closely with relevant departments for "Real-time" information overview and "On demand" data
o	Perform Digitalization PoC to improve processes
o	AI Modelling and Deviation Detection Application Development
•	Project 2
o	Work closely with Related Production member to understand relevant equipment and its current Machine Condition Monitoring (Vibration)
o	Setup Vibration Time waveform data collection system and perform related data analytics
o	Co-Relational study on Time waveform analysis and Equipment Gear Rotation angle.
o	AI Modelling and Deviation Detection Application Development

Review Phase (1 – 2 months)
•	Project presentation
•	Performance review

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Automatic Parsing of Instructional Videos
description:
The objective of this project is to develop an effective and efficient framework for automatic parsing of instructional videos. The student will be exposed to deep learning techniques for temporal action localization and visual grounding in instructional videos. Given a set of instructional videos with transcripts, the student is expected to facilitate the development and implementation of a software prototype that can automatically detect, localize and recognize spatiotemporal actions (i.e., temporal boundaries and action class of each detected action, and bounding boxes of relevant objects).

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Intuitive telemanipulation assisted by constraint awareness
description:
This project will develop techniques for using robotic perception of task constraints to improve the ease of use and flexibility in telemanipulation under human-robot shared autonomy. Additionally, the project aims to design effective vibration patterns on handheld controllers based on contact force measured by the robot for feedback to the user, allowing the user to be aware of the contact conditions in the robot's environment.

title: Security Analyst
description:
The Security & Privacy Competence Centre in Continental provides security solutions across departments and researches on new cyber-security technologies in automotive security analysis. We leverage on our security expertise to provide the following security services: design, build and protect automotive systems, including applications, data, and assets. The intern will work with us to defend threat attacks and improve the security analysis process. The intern will have hands-on on: 
•	Developing tools(such as fuzzing) to find and analyze security weaknesses in software 
•	Integrating security requirements into software development processes
•	Maintain and develop the analysis platform, including frontend and backend

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Intelligent Learning Connections among Terminals at SG port
description:
This project aims to understand connections among terminals and anchorages if possible at SG port, such as traveling duration and network with intelligent learning. It will benefit better predicting of the use of terminals for the favor of terminal management, a better estimation of ETA (estimate time of arrival) to each terminal for the favor of shipping companies and consignees and terminals, and better predicting the use of anchorage, pilot, bunkering barge, tug and other port facilities for the favor of other port stakeholders and port management.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Large-scale indoor mapping using mobile vision and lidar
description:
The goal of this project is to map and understand large indoor spaces, including building interiors and construction sites. The primary goal is to build a digital twin to obtain both the 3D structure of the indoor space, and identifying common functional components such as walls and floor, doors, furniture, decorations and various fittings. A portable lidar and multi-camera system has been developed, and the project seek talent to work on various aspects such as data collection, algorithm development and benchmarking, and AI model training.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Graph Analytics of Clinical Health Data
description:
The project aims to design and implement a graph database for clinical health data. Data variables will be modelled as nodes in a graph and the relationships between the data variables will be modelled as links between the nodes. Using pattern matching, the graph will be queried to extract and analyse the structure of the data, thereby gaining insights into the connections, patterns and trends between multimodal time-series datasets.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Semi-supervised Deep Learning for Rare Disease Detection
description:
Most existing deep learning-based methods for the diagnosis and screening in the medical imaging applications are supervised method, where large amount of labelled data are required to obtain a robust prediction model. To address this issue and in line with the clinical need, in this project, the student will investigate efficient semi-supervised deep learning method that can operate on the limited labelled data setting for rare disease detection. The method will be evaluated on the publicly available datasets with data modality of chest radiographs and computed tomography etc.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Physics-informed Machine Learning for Progression Prediction
description:
To estimate the trend of progression with healthcare data is still a challenging problem. The conventional data-driven methodologies may result in predictions with physic inconsistency and the learned model could lack generalizability as well.

This project will explore the physics/domain knowledge pertaining to the healthcare problems and aims to integrate physics/domain knowledge into the machine learning process for the progression prediction, for improved modelling performance (accuracy, physical consistency, etc.)

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Video Question Answering for Task-oriented Collaboration
description:
Video Question Answering (QA) is a challenging task, whereby given a video and a text question about the video, the answer is to be inferred from the visual elements of the video and/or general knowledge. Despite the progress in video QA, existing video QA systems can yet provide sufficient support for real-world task-oriented collaborations. This project seeks to investigate video question answering for task-oriented collaboration, addressing several tasks such as multi-modality understanding, visual relation modelling, compositional video QA models and knowledge-based video QA systems.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Intelligent System for Similarity Search on Medical Images
description:
Existing methods for disease diagnosis in medical imaging applications generally involve manually examining the images, e.g., chest radiograph (CXR), by the radiologists. However, such a manual process is labor-intensive and the efficiency and accuracy of diagnosis can be greatly improved if the relevant past cases could be provided. The goal of this project is to develop a novel deep learning method for similarity search for previous data. Such capability could be further applied for comprehensive and differential diagnosis in the clinical settings.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Efficient Deep Learning on Encrypted Data
description:
Homomorphic Encryption (HE) enables AI workloads in the encrypted domain, where a client encrypts data and sends to server, where inference is performed, and an encrypted result is returned to the client, which in turn decrypted to obtain the prediction results. However, significant challenges remain – running deep learning inference on HE encrypted data is extremely slow, often taking hours to process a single image. The objective of this project is to design efficient deep learning algorithms tailored for HE, in order to accelerate deep learning inference speed on encrypted data.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Study on the meta-features of the dataset in the ML pipeline
description:
A traditional ML pipeline requires a sequence of processes from feature selection till the model validation to evaluate the performance of the pipeline or the individual process. Even though there have been studies to automate some processes, the evaluation of the pipeline still requires the end-to-end pipeline which will consume a significant amount of time an resources. This process will consume a significant amount of time and resource.

In this work we aim to estimate the performance of the pipeline using meta-feature of the dataset. This will significantly cut down time and resources needed

Automated machine learning (AutoML) looks into the automation of applying machine learning algorithms to real-world problems. It could cover some parts (or the whole) of machine learning pipeline from the raw dataset to the deployable model.

The aim of the project is to develop functional components of an AI platform with AutoML features, such as automations in data pre-processing, feature engineering, algorithm selection, hyper-parameter optimisation, and life-long learning.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Study on Incremental Machine Learning
description:
"Deep neural network training assumes that all the data is available and all the classes are known a priory. Incremental learning studies the situation where older data is no longer available and there is a possibility of presence of new classes in the new training data.

Current work focus on having exemplars from previous tasks, using regularization or proposing new loss functions. In this work we want to explore if utilizing different fields of machine learning such as reinforcement learning/game theory etc. will help in coming up with robust models suitable for incremental learning."

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Deep Learning for Localization in Medical Image
description:
Accurate landmark localization is critical for the diagnosis and management of many diseases. Frequently, in the medical context, it might not be feasible to obtain a large number of labelled images due to limited resources and time, the localization accuracy was not adequate, and it was easily affected by noise. In this project, the students will develop deep learning techniques for localization of landmark points and detection of abnormal region from medical images.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Mining Actinomycetes genomes for antibiotic discovery
description:
This project deals with bioinformatic mining of antibiotic biosynthetic gene clusters (BGCs) from Actinomycetes, a group of bacteria that are widely present in soil and aquatic ecosystems. Our group at IMCB is actively sequencing the genomes of several hundred Actinomycetes strains. These sequences are assembled and mined using established genomic pipelines. We will use the insights from these analyses to develop a computational method to prioritize BGCs with potential antibiotic activity. Furthermore, the results generated here will be experimentally validated by our collaborators at SIFBI.

title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Development of AI Method for Biological Pathway Discovery
description:
Rational biological engineering design requires detailed understanding of underlying pathways. In this project, for a selected cell type, the student will develop a computational heuristic algorithm that will compare the sequences of co-regulated genes and rank them according to their sequence similarity. The resultant data will be mapped to the metabolic pathways available on public databases. For those highly ranked unknown genes, the model is expected to predict an artificial co-regulated networks for further experimental exploration.
