title: [A*STAR Research Internship Award] Metasurface Hologram Based Near Eye 3D Display
description:
With the fast progress of Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) technology, there is strong demand for near eye display technology which allows viewer to view the full depth cues of 3D object without eye fatigue and discomfort. Metasurface is composed of subwavelength scale nano antenna which can manipulate the properties of light in nanoscale. Metasurface hologram promises a large viewing angle and high diffraction efficiency and real 3D. In this project, a near eye display which uses a metasurface based computer generated hologram as a 3D image source will be built up and tested.

title: Driving Sustainable Energy with Data Science Intern
description:
Job Responsibilities
Sembcorp is a leading integrated energy player with large production capacities in Singapore, India, UK, China and various other countries worldwide.  Sustainability isn’t just a buzzword, but a strategy for us. Our vision is to create value through increased power for the communities we work with, while reducing overall carbon footprint.

We achieve this through digital products. Our global Data-Science team is looking for capable interns to assist in the development of our product portfolio. It is highly preferable that you have understanding of current scientific literature as you will work on cutting-edge techniques such as optimization, forecasting, SVM / kNN, Random Forest, Neural Networks alongside leading data-scientists and data engineers.

You will have the experience of working through Data Science Process Lifecycle in a fast-paced data-rich environment. This could mean:
1.   Data Ingestion and Exploration
·         Identifying data sufficiency and data cleansing
·         Preparing data for data modelling
2.   Data Engineering and Pipeline Development
·         Work on analytics platform components to support data collection, exploratory, and integration from various sources being data API, RDBMS, or big data platform.
·         Build data pipelines to ingest real-time data, batch data. Create monitoring and alert modules to ensure pipelines are operating under desired SLA’s.
·         Perform data sizing and infrastructure load test to assess performance and scalability requirements for data pipelines
·         Develop Web apps built on Django, Flask etc. to serve as a dashboard for analysis of key business KPI’s
3.   Analytics Model Experimentation, Development and Testing
·         Identify suitable models and algorithms for analyzing the data
·         Run initial results on testing data and identify optimal transformations and algorithms suitable for the data
·         Optimize the models or algorithms for the data sets using hyper-parameter tuning & specialized modelling settings.
·         Prepare modelling codes & artifacts as per production environment standards.
4.   Deployment to Production for Actual Use
·         Follow CI/CD process using Azure DevOps for the deployment of applications and pipelines
·         Make the data science scripts production ready for deployment in various target environments
·         Test and validate deployed models and data sources
·         Leverage a wide range of Cloud services like Azure functions, Batch accounts, DataBricks, Data Factory and other resources to productionize use cases
5.       Engage with the broader business team and senior leaders to help define requirements and present results

Job Requirements
A.      Programming abilities - Python, SQL, R, Javascript, Angular, Node.js
B.      Data Manipulation - Apache Spark, Panda Dataframes, Notebooks, Databricks
C.      Databases – MySQL, Mongo DB, good knowledge of ETL, database schema
D.      Good knowledge of data visualization tools or use them with ease
E.       (preferred) Statistics, time series analysis, data modelling
F.       (preferred) Development experience - data exploration and pipeline development, analytics/machine learning models development, full stack web app development
G.      (preferred) Technology stack knowledge - Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google
H.      (preferred) Good background / understanding from business operations with exposure to data analytics skillsets
I.         Ability to learn independently and quickly to pick up new knowledge required to understand the problem related to the project.
J.        Confidence and presentation skills to present solutions to stakeholders on a regular basis.
K.       Positive attitude and team player

title: Indoor Location Based Service (Bluetooth)
description:
Bluetooth technology has been prevalent in consumer electronic devices such as smartphones, PC and home appliances. In addition to the conventional functionality of data transfer, Bluetooth technology also provides the capability for indoor positioning applications, such as Angle-of-Arrival (AoA) and ranging (or distance estimation) etc. We have conducted a comprehensive evaluation and analysis of Bluetooth AoA technique, thanks to the great effort of our past interns. In this project, we will focus on the performance evaluation of the ranging technique of Bluetooth. The intern has the opportunity not only to learn the fundamental principle of distance estimation but also to understand how it is implemented in commercial devices. The basic job of the intern is to assist R&D engineers in evaluating and analyzing the performance of distance estimation under both simulated and real-world conditions. In addition, the intern can also explore the research aspect and improve the accuracy of distance estimation algorithm.
(The office is located at The Metropolis near Buona Vista MRT station.)

Requirements: 
•	Relevant coursework: Digital signal processing, Wireless communication theory, and/or Electromagnetic wave theory. 
•	Programming skills: Python / Matlab.
•	Experience with electronic test equipment is a plus.
agencyAddress: 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 #07-08 The Signature, SINGAPORE, 486066, SINGAPORE
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application. and send it to: zhou.weijing@huawei.com

title: Smart Healthcare Sensing
description:
Smart healthcare is a hot research topic, which includes remote breath and heartbeat detections, cuff-less blood pressure monitoring, and non-invasive blood glucose monitoring, and etc. As smart wearable and smart home devices becoming more and more popular, implementing smart healthcare techniques on those devices has attracted tremendous industry interests. In this project, we will explore the feasibility of integrating the cutting-edge smart healthcare techniques with current smart wearable and smart home devices. We will also apply deep learning and neural network-based AI techniques to further enhance the system performance.

The job scope includes:
•	Review literature on related techniques, 
•	Construct RF-based, (may also include optical-based or acoustic-based) testbeds,
•	Conduct measurements and tests,
•	Perform simulations on Python and MATLAB platforms

 (The office is located at The Metropolis near Buona Vista MRT station.)


Requirements:
•	Relevant coursework: electromagnetic wave theory and/or digital signal processing, (neural network theory and human biological knowledge is a plus).
•	Programming skills: MATLAB, Python, (Tensorflow/Pythorch/MindSpore is a plus).
•	Others: interest in healthcare, strong literature reviewing skills, experience with electronic test equipment is a plus.
agencyAddress: 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 #07-08 The Signature, SINGAPORE, 486066, SINGAPORE
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application and send to: zhou.weijing@huawei.com

title: UWB Technology for Precise Indoor positioning
description:
Ultra-wideband (UWB) technology has been mostly used in industrial, warehouse, shopping mall and also comes to smartphone for spatial awareness. Ultra-wideband (UWB) based positioning systems can deliver extremely precise and fast positioning information. In this project, we design and develop IR-UWB baseband for indoor positioning applications including ranging, AoA and also data transmission. The intern has the opportunity to learn the fundamental principle of UWB based signal transmission, ranging and AoA technology and also to understand how these features are implemented in commercial devices. The basic job of the intern is to assist R&D engineers in evaluating and analysing the performance of ranging, AoA and data detection under various application scenarios. In addition, the intern can also explore the advanced algorithm to improve the performance and efficiency of AoA and/or ranging implementation.
(The office is located at The Metropolis near Buona Vista MRT station.)

Requirements: 
•	Relevant coursework: Digital signal processing, Wireless communication theory, and/or Electromagnetic wave theory. 
•	Programming skills: Python / Matlab / C++.
agencyAddress: 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 #07-08 The Signature, SINGAPORE, 486066, SINGAPORE
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application and send to: zhou.weijing@huawei.com

title: Wifi Sensing
description:
Wifi sensing technology uses the existing Wifi infrastructure to detect changes in motion. For example, human activities such as walking, sitting, falling or even specific hand gestures can be recognized by analysing Wifi signals over time. The intern would assist in computer simulation, experiment testing and data analysis for performance evaluation of motion detection/recognition algorithm. The job allows the intern to learn basic principles of Wifi signal processing and software implementation of AI/deep learning methods along the way. 
(The office is located at The Metropolis near Buona Vista MRT station.)

Requirements: 
•	Relevant coursework: Digital signal processing, Wireless communication theory, and/or Electromagnetic wave theory. 
•	Programming skills: Python / Matlab / C++.

title: System Architecture Intern
description:
Huawei LINX Architecture Research Lab aspires to transform the world through deep and interdisciplinary research in future computing architecture. The architecture team at Singapore Research Centre is recruiting interns to join the ongoing work of research and development on next-generation architectures and relevant tools.

Currently, there are vacancies for interns who will be working on computer architecture, domain-specific accelerators and architectural simulators.

Requirements
- Bachelor, Master or PhD students on Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics, with interests in research topics on computer architecture and relevant system tools. 
- Master or PhD students are expected to have taken OS, computer architecture and relevant courses.
- Understanding of concepts of computer architecture including processor, cache, memory system, NoC and accelerators.
- Coding skills of one or more programming languages such as C/C++, Perl, Shell, Java and Python on Linux platform.

title: Privacy-Preserving Matchmaking
description:
With the explosive growth of smartphones, mobile applications, and online social networks, the way people interact with each other has been revolutionized. More and more people make new friends online via social network applications such as Tinder, Facebook. Typically, these companies collect user’s particulars (hobby, education, job, etc.) and find the best matches for the user. However, it may not be a good idea to delegate such highly sensitive personal information to these companies, as data breaches due to poor data management or external hackers are reported in news from time to time. The increasing public awareness of privacy and information rights has encouraged the research community to pay more and more attention to privacy-enhancing technologies.

The intern will assist SCRIPTS research fellows in the research and development of privacy-preserving matchmaking protocols.
agencyName: Strategic Centre for Research in Privacy-Preserving Technologies & Systems
agencyAddress: 50 Nanyang Drive, Level 4 BorderX Block, Research Techno Pla, 637553, Singapore
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Data Synthesis with Differential Privacy Protection
description:
Businesses need to share data to encourage more connections and collaboration between various parties in order to promote innovation and improve the customers’ consumption and service experience. Privacy continues to be the most important aspect of data sharing as an increasing number of consumers are growing concerned about their privacy and the security of their personal information. 

This project aims to explore the effective solution to generate synthetic data for sharing with differential privacy protection. Specifically, we utilize some statistical-based method or GAN network to train a generative model which can be used to sample some synthetic data, which is not associated with a particular identity. Some noise needs to be added to the generative model training process to enhance privacy, while ensuring the data utility. The tasks of the project include:

1.Design the data synthesis algorithm that captures the structure and the dependency of the original dataset. 
2.Explore efficient differential privacy solutions to perturb the statistics while without sacrificing the utility too much. 
3.Implement the private data synthesis algorithm that generating the synthetic data to analyze the effectiveness of the proposed solution.

title: Design Methodologies for Mapping Large Applications on to Modern FPGAs
description:
The growing adoption of FPGAs has empowered designers to map increasingly large applications on to FPGAs. Despite the significant improvements in FPGA Computer-Aided Design (CAD) tools (e.g., Quartus Prime, Xilinx Vivado), mapping large applications on to modern FPGAs still involves considerable amount of design expertise and effort. Moreover, the mapping process often consumes hours of compilation time and yet produces mapping solutions with degraded quality. 

As a solution, researchers in NTU have developed tools to map large applications onto modern multi-million gate FPGAs, efficiently and effectively. Their current effort focuses on integrating these tools into commercial CAD flow. Candidates who are interested in joining this timely effort, are welcome to apply. Selected candidates will obtain hands on experience in state-of-the-art design methodologies for FPGA based application development, simulation, and verification.
agencyAddress: 61 Nanyang Drive, #ABN-01b-14, Academic Building North, 637335, SINGAPORE

• Familiarity with Linux Environments

Skills developed through this internship:	
• Expertise in FPGA based design.
• Experience with Machine Learning Techniques for FPGA based design.
• Exposure for research-oriented work and data analysis

title: Hardware-assisted Malware Detection
description:
Malware applications are a major threat to computing systems today. Software-based malware detection techniques rely on large malware signature database that needs to be constantly updated. As such, they are ineffective in detecting new malware or specially crafted malicious exploits that bypass the detection. In addition, stringent computation and storage capacity in typical embedded systems makes software detection techniques unappealing due to their large overhead. To overcome the drawbacks of software-based detection, researchers in NTU have developed malware detection techniques using a special type of processor registers called Hardware Performance Counters (HPCs). 
The goal in this project is to develop lightweight hardware assisted malware detection for embedded autonomous vehicle systems. The candidate is expected to exploit HPCs, which are available in most of the modern processors (e.g., ARM), to monitor the application execution on the embedded system and detect the presence of malicious behavior. The candidate will also implement statistical and machine learning techniques to detect the malicious behavior in the embedded system.

title: Data Science Intern
description:
DATA SCIENCE INTERN (JAN - MAY 2022)
Are you passionate about metrics and quantitative analytics? Are you eager to uncover insights from large datasets to challenge the status quo? Are you somebody who just cannot wait to deploy the relevant tools and techniques for this endeavour?

Then we may have just the opportunity you are looking for!

Zyllem is a fast-growing software company based in Singapore. Our software connects the fragmented logistics network by allowing enterprises to build and manage their entire distribution network that includes partnerships and own assets in one platform.  We are supported by key VCs and have acquired key strategic customers across SEA including the largest retailer in Singapore, the largest health distributor in SEA, and the largest cold-chain in Singapore.
As a start-up company shaking things up in the technology industry, we are always looking into ways to innovate. This is an awesome opportunity for someone who can think on their feet, participate in brainstorming sessions, share knowledge and ideas -- all while having fun with a team of like-minded people from all around the world.

What you’ll be working on:
 Mini project to extract useful insights from our large datasets, for forecasting, business intelligence and predictive analytics.
 Creating abstract plots to aid visualization.
 Streamlining ‘key-features’ for data-pipelines for facilitating machine learning purposes.
 Assist in creating prototype predictive models for driving service improvements.

Your ‘should haves’ a.k.a. what makes an ideal candidate:
 Great with data pre-processing tools using Python.
 Acquainted with visualizing tools such as matplotlib, tableau, etc.
 Eager to experience the ‘start-up culture’.
 Interest or knowledge in supply chain and logistics.

Here’s a bit about us:
Zyllemites are good, smart people with a great sense of humour. We enjoy hanging out with each other on Friday over drinks. We speak many languages and respect all cultures. We take our work seriously, but ourselves not too much. Professionalism and integrity are work ethics we strive for.

title: Rain removal
description:
This project aims to study the rain removal technique by using machine intelligence techniques. It not only helps humans better perceive the information presented in the images/videos but also makes machines to better fulfill their missions in rain weather/conditions. 
The research intern is required to finishing the following tasks:
1. Algorithm implementation: the intern needs to implement some classical rain removal algorithms and run existing deep learning approaches, integrate them to form a unified training/testing platform, and perform quantitative and qualitative evaluations.
2. Data understanding: the intern needs to understand the evaluation metrics and evaluate the outcomes of the algorithms.
3. The required knowledge and skill for this project can be summarized as follows: (a) MatLab; (b) Python & Pytorch. (c) MS Excel.

description:

title: Person Re-Identification
description:
Person re-identification (or person re-id for short) is defined as the problem of matching images of people across disjoint camera views in a multi-camera system. It is useful for several public security applications, such as an intelligent camera surveillance system. In a typical real-world application, one single or a watchlist of a handful of known people is provided as the target set for searching through a large volume of video surveillance footage where the people on the watchlist are likely to re-appear. To further reduce the search scope among candidate cameras, an Intra-camera tracking algorithm capable of knowing where the person is heading is needed.  However, in some special events (e.g., sports events) and locations (e.g., central business district), most pedestrians may wear similar clothes such as sports uniforms and business suits. Re-identifying a person from a large crowd with similar clothing is a challenging problem.  Another challenging problem is to re-identify the same person at different times in different attire.

In this project, the applicant will use a game engine to generate people wearing similar clothing such as police and army uniforms.  The applicant will be working on deploying some of our deep learning techniques on PyTorch or Tensorflow and the development of a web demo for demonstration.  Experience in programming using Python will be necessary, and prior knowledge of PyTorch and Tensorflow would be advantageous.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About Archisen:
Archisen is an agriculture technology-focused startup. We design, develop and operate systems and solutions to grow ultra-fresh, ultra-local produce in urban cities. Our team specializes in indoor agricultural growing systems, where vegetables can be grown optimally through careful control of growing conditions. We democratise urban farming and food access via IoT, automation and data analytics. You may find out more about us at www.archisen.com. 

Overview:
This is an opportunity to be part of a unique software development team. We have a solid technology roadmap and a team of exceptional individuals. You will be given the opportunity to experiment while applying knowledge and skills taught in school in our lab and farms, while working directly with the managers, founders and collaborators.

Responsibilities:
•	Assist in the development of websites/mobile applications
•	Design page wireframes/layouts and custom graphics, formatting content, quality assurance testing, translating wireframes to web-apps to be used by our own staff
•	Improve current IoT infrastructure for our indoor farm 
•	Work with external collaborators to integrate modules into our web-apps
•	Develop APIs for IoT components to interact with 

Requirements:
•	Able to work in a team environment 
•	Demonstrate good communications skills
•	Demonstrate skills in software design & development
•	Comfortable with Unix command line (eg Linux)
•	Have some experience in NodeJS, MySQL, MongoDB, HTML
•	Have working knowledge of JQuery, Bootstrap

Additional Requirements:
•	Working knowledge in Angular or React
•	Knowledge of Python, NoSQL, Git and Amazon Web Services S3, EC2
•	Basic Photoshop/ GIMP photo manipulation skills
•	Basic knowledge of Machine/Deep Learning (Tensorflow, Keras, etc)
•	Basic knowledge of Embedded Systems Programming
•	Basic knowledge of Networking (Port Forwarding, Static IPs, etc)
•	Basic understanding of Version Control, Git is preferred

Benefits:
•	Mentorship opportunity under an interdisciplinary team of crop scientists, engineers & business development executives
•	Exposure to the indoor, high-tech farming landscape
•	Experience development of APIs from start to finish

title: Cloud Security (Automation) Engineer Intern
description:
Job Description:
The Envision Digital Cyber Security organization is growing rapidly to help guide the company through its own global hyper growth phase. This growth is fueled by customer demand for our innovative cloud-based software and embedded product lines. As a Cloud Security Automation Intern, your curiosity will allow you to thrive in addressing real world problems via automation. You will focus on security for all components of our systems, including Edge devices, networking equipment and server infrastructure, with an emphasis on threats from all sources. You will also:
•	Work with your mentor to assess areas of Cyber Security that can be made more efficient, scalable and repeatable via automation.
•	Work with the Cloud Infrastructure and Platform teams to help with initiatives and develop and build security utilities and tools that will enable Envision Digital to operate more securely
•	Learn how an AIoT Cloud operates and offer fresh new ideas on how to improve Security.
•	Build automation scripts for the deployment of cloud infrastructure (Infrastructure as Code) and security (Security as Code).
•	Help build Incident Response playbooks to address wide variety of issues that may arise.
•	Engage with Security Architects to offer innovative ideas on how to improve the Security of Envision Digital Edge (embedded) hardware and software.
•	Develop innovative means of measuring Envision Digital Security capabilities and their effectiveness.
•	Develop, maintain, and promote standards with the rest of the Cyber Security team through workshops, office hours, knowledge shares and brown-bags

Required Qualifications:
•	Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Computer Engineering or in a STEM major (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math) in progress. 
•	Basic understanding of CI/CD and automation principles.
•	Knowledge of Devops tools (Chef, Git, Jenkins) a plus.
•	Basic understanding of virtual infrastructure and containerization technologies
•	Experience designing and implementing security controls in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure and alike.
•	Partner with product owners in requirement gathering and vetting 
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially experience with executive-level communications
•	Willingness to learn and contribute.

description:
Simon-Kucher & Partners is currently looking for an Associate Consultant who is based in Singapore. The ideal candidate will have above-average student performance in university, prior internship experience in consulting and/or commercial spaces, and will be flexible and willing to learn.  

What makes us special: 
•	International exposure in a growing consulting company with a global footprint
•	Flat company hierarchy, helpful, enthusiastic colleagues and a great team spirit
•	Extensive training and learning programs as well as constant feedback

We offer you the chance to:
•	Support Singapore and international strategic projects

title: Autonomous Pathfinding
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

Currently, drones cannot decide independently without operators providing minimally an end point. To challenge this assumption, this project seeks to train a model that will help drones to navigate unexplored environments. In this project, the student will  explore possible methodologies for path planning, and develop an algorithm to be processed onboard the drone to bring it through a series of obstacles to an end point. The path planning program will be required to interface with the flight control computer, in order to facilitate fully autonomous missions in various scenarios. 

At the end of the internship, the student will be familiar with Robotic Operating System (ROS) using C++/Python language, as well as PX4 autopilot software.

The student will do the internship with DSTA Air Systems Programme Centre.

Deliverables: C++/Python/Java program that allows machines to make navigation decisions based on images.
agencyAddress: Defence Technology Tower A / 1 Depot Road, Defence Technology Tower A, SINGAPORE, 109679, SINGAPORE

applicationRequirements: Interest in AI, Robotics and Programming

title: Augmented/Virtual Reality for Training and Learning
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.
 
With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

Virtual Reality (VR) delivers a computer-generated virtual environment that is presented to the users to create an immersive experience resembling the real environment. Augmented Reality (AR) makes use of the real environment and overlays information and virtual objects onto it to create an interactive digital experience blended with the real world. Both technologies offer huge potential and exciting opportunities to develop applications to be used for education and training.

In this project, the student will be tasked to (1) Design, develop and deploy VR and/or AR applications to be incorporated into existing simulation systems; (2) Develop prototypes using VR and/or AR technology to explore new possibilities for training. The student will have opportunities to learn and develop VR and AR software, increase knowledge and competency in areas of 3D modelling, software development and system integration. He/she will also be exposed to the latest hardware like HTC Vive Pro and Microsoft HoloLens as part of the work.

The student will be doing the internship with DSTA Simulation & Training Systems Hub.

title: Adaptive Training and Gamification for Simulators
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.
 
With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:


Simulators are used to assess trainee performance during their regular training, by the instructors. Given the vast amount of cognitive tasks that instructors are faced with, incorporating the use of data analytics and visualisation to capture and measure real-time trainee performance allows for immediate analysis and remediation. This feedback loop could also be automated to enable scenario/curriculum adaptation to optimise training for the trainees. Gamification elements are also introduced to improve the overall training experience and give the trainees motivation for improvements.

This project aims to enable the instructors to evaluate the trainee’s performance more objectively during training sessions. The student will examine the adaptation of current training scenarios to shorten training time and enable trainees to attain higher levels of competencies. He/she will also recommend suitable gamification techniques that can be deployed in simulators. 

Depending on the background of the student, he/she will study and carry out development work in the respective aspects which will expose him/her to cognitive work analysis and the application of visual, auditory, cognitive and psychomotor workload in training system design. The student would also gain exposure to the process of conceptualising, designing, developing, integrating and realising engineering ideas and prototypes. 

The student will be doing the internship with DSTA Simulation & Training Systems Hub.

Deliverables: (1)Application prototype leveraging on gamification; (2) Presentation and report on their work

title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) for Stance Detection of Text
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.
 
With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

The ability to computationally analyse and recognise central themes on Open Source data could yield insights about the sentiments of the population, especially on divisive issues and/or difference of opinions.The use of NLP and other analytics tools would then allow us to identify such issues, analyse the virality of these issues, and the impact on its audience.
 
In this project, the student will do a survey of existing methods and technologies for detecting stances in open source text data. This would involve an exploration of approaches for natural language inference to predict stances on possible social issues or fault-lines, utilising state-of-the-art NLP models like BERT, GPT-2, ELMO, GROVER. The student will present his/her ideas and results using appropriate data visualisation techniques.

The student will do the internship with DSTA Information Programme Centre.

Deliverables: Final report and technology demonstrator

title: Multilingual Natural Language Processing (NLP) for Multi Document Understanding
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.
 
With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

Open Source Data contains a huge volume of valuable knowledge from which we can extract insights from. For example, news feeds allow us to understand what is happening across the globe. Very often, the information is in the form of unstructured text, in multiple languages and spread across multiple documents.
 
Consequently, the ability to filter, group, summarise and extract knowledge from these troves of data is necessary to help analysts quickly sense and understand the dataset. 
 
The student will survey existing multilingual NLP methods and techniques on text summarisation and information retrieval on large open data sets and explore state-of-the-art approaches. This will include the use of deep learning transformers in NLP, text representation techniques, classifiers for filtering and clustering techniques. The student will also need to present their ideas and results using appropriate data visualisation techniques. 

The student will do the internship with DSTA Information Programme Centre.

Deliverables:Final report and technology demonstrator

title: Radar Performance Analysis and Prediction
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.
 
With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

For a specific radar system, its performance depends on several factors including target radar cross section (RCS) and maneuver profiles – the same target presents different RCS values  depending on its aspects relative to the radar.

An earlier tool was developed to serve radar  mission planning and deployment site selection based on line-of-sight and terrain considerations.

This project aims to expand on the earlier tool to analyse and predict radar performance based on different target profiles. This tool will facilitate radar OT&E activities and enhance its utility in radar  mission planning and set-up. In this project, the student will learn about data analytics.

The student will do the internship with DSTA System Management Programme Centre. 

Deliverables: Software application to collate and synthesise different data sets, derive statistics and visualisation to predict radar performance.

description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.

title: Experiments in Robustness of Computer Vision Models
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore.

We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments. To achieve our mission, DSTA performs a variety of roles ranging from acquisition and procurement to cybersecurity and software development.
 
With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

In recent times, Adversarial AI researchers have developed novel ways of injecting pixel-level perturbations to images, thereby fooling state-of-the-art deep learning models in the field of Computer Vision. There is a need to ensure that these models are not only highly accurate, but also robust against adversaries.

This project will look into building experiments that can aid in attempting to measure how robust a Computer Vision model is, and also provide the understanding of how existing methods like adversarial retraining can improve robustness of these models.

There are 2 parts to this project which the student will be doing:
1. Perform adversarial retraining, which involves generation of adversarial examples and re-pipe them into a training pipeline for the model. Conduct testing to measure accuracy and robustness before and after retraining. Assess robustness of different adversarial example generation methods.
2. Develop a robustness measurement method, called empirical robustness. It involves building an efficient python program that ensembles adversarial generation methods and provide a priority-based system in quantifying how vulnerable a model is.

At the end of the internship, students will learn how to build pipelines for adversarial retraining,  understand methods used to generate adversarial examples, and what it means to improve robustness of a deep learning model.

The student will be doing the internship with DSTA CyberSecurity Programme Centre.

Deliverables: Present experimental outcomes and insights, as well as a submit a report on research findings as part of knowledge management.

applicationRequirements: Experience in Python programming. Prior knowledge in Python and deep learning frameworks, such as Keras, Tensorflow, and Pytorch will be beneficial.

title: FEOL device HCI & NBTI stress characterization and data analytics automation enhancement on MOSFET transistor
description:
Project Objective / Purpose

Hands on experience semiconductor MOSFET reliability testing flow such as devices stress characterization and data analysis while exploiting the automation macro programming.


Project Description      

Student will gain knowledge about semiconductor MOSFET transistor device basic operation and how to characterize the device, understanding the reliability model build, inclusive of designing the stress condition matrix and analysis of the stress results, in order to assess the reliability performance of the device. 
Through the data analysis process, student will be given the opportunity to explore the coding and automate the data analytics process. Starting from simplify the data preprocessing and data extraction, characterization curves generation, the automated data analytics able to enhance the team members high-quality and speed of analytics.  e.g. using Microsoft Visual Basic Excel Macro and Python programming language.

Project Outcome

Understanding of reliability performance for MOSFET transistors in advance technology. 

To publish FEOL device tests’ stress characterization technical report (with respect to transistor length / transistor width / temperature / Vds / Vgs / Vbs biasing dependency) to spice modeling team. 

To develop macro or software program for data analysis automation.

title: Intern, Design System
description:
Specific Project Summary
Design system helps product teams deliver high-quality work with speed and at scale by building tools, processes, and services that drive collaboration across and beyond the organization.

Full Job Description

About the Team
There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities. At Yara, the Smallholders Digital Team is part of the Crop and Digital Solutions Unit. 

About Crop and Digital Solutions

Yara aims to be the crop nutrition company for the future and is leading the development of sustainable agriculture and digital tools to contribute to solving global agricultural challenges. We have a worldwide presence with sales teams in ~150 countries and around 17,000 employees. Yara Farming Solutions, will lead the transformation towards more sustainable and efficient food production, by innovating our offerings and the way we work. Crop and Digital Solutions is responsible developing and scaling new “on-farm” digital and integrated tools and solutions for an efficient and transparent food system.

Responsibilities

Work with developers to minimize the use of technical instructions
Write and revise technical documentation
Analyze technical design and communicate with designers and developers
Identify user needs for the documentation
Use visuals to improve readability
Gather and implement feedback
Required profile

Passionate about user interface design and design systems
Is currently studying a related field to human-centered design or computer science
Ability to contribute individually, and participate in cross-functional teams
Learning mindset
Skills

Strong writing skills
Ability to explain technical ideas to a non-technical audience in a simple and intuitive way

Good communication skills
Teamwork-oriented approach, openness to provide and accept feedback and adapt to change with a 'fail fast' mentality
Good understanding of front-end frameworks and JavaScript ecosystem and the technical terminologies
Understanding of human-computer interaction and user experience design concepts
Basic understanding of tools and technologies such as GitHib, Storybook, Bit.dev


Additional information
We strive to reflect the diversity in society and encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply. We are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances
​​​​​​​

Why us?

Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.

title: Development of a High-Power DC-DC Converter for Aircraft Energy Storage System
description:
Electrification in the aerospace industry has been going on with the major research and development focusing on more electric aircraft (MEA), hybrid-electric and full-electric propulsions. The MEA concept basically conceives the idea of replacing most of the aircraft secondary systems with electrical systems, offering many potential benefits for the next-generation aircrafts. On modern aircrafts, main engine starter/generators are being used instead of the conventional pneumatic system before starting the main engines. The generators are coupled to power converters that will deliver the electrical power into a common dc bus. An energy storage system (ESS) is required to support the dc bus during peak power demand or during an emergency condition. Therefore, the power converters and ESS play very important roles in the MEA. This project is part of development of an ESS and will focus on building a robust circuit model and control system of a high-power dc-dc converter that governs the power flow from a high-voltage battery to the dc bus or vice versa. The overall model and control system will then be simulated in a real-time platform (hardware-in-the-loop or HIL) to verify the developed control algorithm. Therefore, the student will need to 
1.	learn and understand the available tools required for power converter modelling and HIL verification
2.	follow a model-based design (MBD) approach to generate the necessary code for control algorithm. 
3.	verify the generated control algorithm in the HIL platform
4.	support a more complex software verification in the HIL platform along with the generated control algorithm

applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Development of an Embedded Software for Aircraft Energy Storage System Based on Model Based Design
description:
Electrification in the aerospace industry has been going on with the major research and development focusing on more electric aircraft (MEA), hybrid-electric and full-electric propulsions. The MEA concept basically conceives the idea of replacing most of the aircraft secondary systems with electrical systems, offering many potential benefits for the next-generation aircrafts. On modern aircrafts, main engine starter/generators are being used instead of the conventional pneumatic system before starting the main engines. The generators are coupled to power converters that will deliver the electrical power into a common dc bus. An energy storage system (ESS) is required to support the dc bus during peak power demand or during an emergency condition. Therefore, the power converters and ESS play very important roles in the MEA. This project is part of development of an ESS and will focus on developing a certifiable controller software component for a high-power dc-dc converter that governs the power flow from a high-voltage battery to the dc bus or vice versa. The controller software component needs to follow the DO-178C (Software Considerations in Airborne Systems and Equipment Certification). Therefore, the student will need to 
1.	learn and understand the available tools required for software development for power converter control system
2.	follow a model-based design (MBD) approach to generate the necessary codes for control algorithm 
3.	follow the guidelines in the DO-178C and ensure the traceability between the requirements and the developed software components
4.	support software verification in a Hardware-in-the-Loop platform

title: Automotive Radar Point Cloud Segmentation and Detection with Deep Learning
description: Automotive radar is emerging as one key sensor to enable the high level autonomous driving nowadays. In order to retrieve the information from radar output, i.e., point cloud, advanced perception function such as segmentation and detection will be applied. Although they have been major techniques in the computer vision domain, segmentation and detection in automotive radar face new challenges due to  the sparsity and irregularity of the point cloud. This project focuses on implementation and design improved deep learning based algorithms for automotive radar applications. This study will be based on both open dataset and our own dataset.
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Super-resolution Direction of Arrival Estimation using Deep Learning
description: In this project, the problem of super-resolution direction of arrival (DOA) will be studied for automotive radar.  There are many existing super-resolution algorithms developed for array processing. However, most of these methods requires large number of snapshots and high computational complexity. In automotive radar applications, there is only single snapshot available and the radar sensor requires efficient computation for real time implementation. In this regards, algorithms with better performance than conventional super-resolution methods are of great interest to the community of automotive radar. This study will focus on improved super-resolution algorithms by exploiting the advantage of Deep Learning. This study will be based on both simulation and real data collected from the product of the company.
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Development of Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system for Microgrid Application
description: Microgrid is a localized network which can disconnect from the traditional grid and has the capability to operate autonomously. For such applications, supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) becomes an essential part of the microgrid automation and operation. The SCADA system should be able to monitor the network configuration such as the number of connected/disconnected generators, inverters, loads, circuit-breakers, contactors, etc.  In addition, SCADA system should be able to display the key parameters of microgrid such as voltage, current, frequency, and active/reactive power flow at different nodes. It should also include the annunciations whenever the safe operating limits are violated. At the discretion of the microgrid operator, SCADA system is expected to be the interface where the operating setpoints and commands can be provided to the microgrid components. The work includes the development of the SCADA software platform with above-mentioned features for 45kW microgrid test-bed at Electrical Power Systems Integration Lab at NTU (EPSIL@N) and also for the Rolls-Royce REIDS microgrid setup at the Semakau Island. This system will be developed using the commercial PLCs and controllers such as B&R automation or NI-LabView or the combination of both. The developed SCADA system aims to validate the control algorithms, start-up/shut-down procedures and test various operating conditions and contingencies.

applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Development of Communication Framework for Microgrid Applications
description: Microgrid is a localized network which can disconnect from the traditional grid and have the capability to operate autonomously. It consists of the distributed energy sources which collectively regulate the network voltage/frequency while sharing the power demand. The communication and coordination framework for microgrid applications is of utmost importance for multiple reasons. Firstly, the microgrid distributed energy resources (DERs) should also be able to ride-through faults and ensure seamless transition from grid-connected to the islanded mode of operation. Such stringent operating conditions require communication between the controllers of the distributed energy sources. Secondly, communication framework will also play an important role in development of the network protection because the bi-directional power flow in the microgrids necessitates effective coordination among the protection relays. The work includes the development of the communication framework for the 45kW microgrid test-bed at Electrical Power Systems Integration Lab at NTU (EPSIL@N). The developed framework will be based on ModBus TCP and will be validated with the commercial controllers which are B&R automation and NI-LabView.

description:

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Every role at Apple is crafted around our intention to leave the world better than we found it. Our values and our actions tell the world who we are. When you join a company like Apple, these same values fuel your drive to change things for the better — to enrich lives!

title: Auto building model in simulink environment for Micro grid application
description:
A micro-grid is a group of sources forming a small-scale power grid that can operate autonomously or in connection with macro-grid. With the depletion of conventional sources along with increase of environmental concerns, renewable energy systems are gaining importance. Also with the increased interests in decentralized power systems, micro-grids are becoming increasing relevant. A micro-grid power system includes diesel generator, renewable sources like photovoltaic and wind turbine generator, energy storages, loads connected in AC or DC bus with power management system.  
A tool that can evaluate various micro-grid system configurations along with assisting in system operation is required. The work proposed here is to build a GUI to capture various inputs like load profile, electricity market price, solar irradiance etc.  In addition, mathematical based models of PV, wind generator needs to be developed. A program in MATLAB language to auto build the power system model based on the inputs in GUI needs to be developed.

title: Data Scientist x Human Centred Data Science
description:
The Role

As a Data Scientist at Synthesis you’ll develop models and analytical frameworks designed for the sharpest insights and marketing professionals in the world, helping them prioritise the issues that matter most to their business and spot where the next big change will come from. We aggregate information from open data sources, advocating for the power of data to solve problems for business and for society as a whole, which means you will be running end-to-end analysis guiding the process from data gathering and cleaning through to processing, modelling and visualisation.

You’ll become an expert in layering datasets to build a complete picture of people’s behaviour, working with search, social, advertising & ecommerce datastreams to name just a few. Ours is a spirit of continuous experimentation and plussing: you’ll always be pushing your ideas in collaboration with a team of experienced data scientists around you. We work in tight-knit project teams, meaning you’ll work side by side with cultural strategists to interpret meaning in the data patterns we see and present your work to our client partners, so you see first-hand the impact your work has.

Requirements
- You have a solid understanding of statistical analysis and hands-on experience with one or more of the following programming languages: Java, Python or R.
- You have experience in building data visualizations using off the shelf software or packages with R, Python, Gephi, Tableau etc. Familiarity with quick prototyping techniques for data viz work is an advantage.
- You are comfortable working with large, complex, unstructured datasets, with a focus on text and image-processing. Natural language processing skills, including topic modelling and semantic parsing, especially for Asian languages and short texts, will be an advantage.
- You’re able to communicate your analysis in simple, non-technical terms and relish the prospect of working alongside a team of strategy consultants to move from analysis to implication for business.
- You enjoy iteratively developing your ideas, drawing on the value of the diverse experience and perspectives of those around you. You recognise the value of having an array of approaches at your disposal rather than focusing solely on one methodology or model.

This role would suit someone who...
- Has experience working with data, and coding experience in R/Python
- Comfortable with uncertainty, open ended challenges and enjoys creatively finding solutions to data science problems
- Enjoys working in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment

Why Synthesis?

We do Human Centred Data Science. It’s a way of understanding data better by understanding the people and context shaping it. . It prioritises behaviour and context to unravel why people do what they do, at scale.  By blending data science with human and market intelligence we help our clients spot early signals of change and predict implications for business.

Partnering with the world’s most successful brands in fashion, beauty, content and travel, we’re building specialised solutions to solve problems of planning for the future. Rooted in culture, tested in data science, we spot and anticipate changes and connections in culture to inspire action and help brands grow with a new wave of audiences. After three years of iteratively developing and perfecting these models, we are preparing to launch a series of products over the next 5 years.  

We will be at the forefront of a shift towards leveraging open data to develop rich, honest, human insight. In an industry that has for too long relied on ‘question-response’ approach to understanding changes in behaviour, we prioritise layering behavioural, performative, search and sales data to highlight the discrepancies between what people say they do and what they actually do. We see a $20 billion industry that has failed to innovate for too long and we are just getting started.

•	Experience in ARM/IMG/Tensilica Processor Familiarity, Silicon Debug and/or Functional/Direct Test Verification
•	Familiar with assertion based verification (SVA) & System Verilog language
•	Experience in Processor verification, FPGA verification and/or Formal verification
•	Experience with Synopsys ICC (preferred) or Cadence or Magma tools from netlists to GDS is a must
•	Experience in graphics processor implementation/power reduction flows and methodology from RTL to GDS (including synthesis, floor-planning, placement, CTS, routing, timing optimization, physical verification) is a plus
•	Knowledge of high-speed/low power IP and custom circuit design is a plus
•	Experience with power noise and reliability tools such as Redhawk and Voltus
•	Good communication and scripting skills

title: Internship, Software Developer (Back-end)
description:
About the Unit
There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.

In 2017, Yara created a new digital development unit to build solutions for smallholder farming communities. Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.

Responsibilities
Work within a product team with a product manager, designers, and developers to create solutions and apps focused on our different customers’ needs 
Participate in the full lifecycle of a product, from early-stage rapid prototyping through to full market release and continuous improvement after the initial launch 
Take responsibility for the development of backend components.
Write clean, testable, scalable, and maintainable code that complies with web standards and best practices  

Required Profile
Good fundamentals and working knowledge in building simple micro-services backends using Nodejs, ExpressJs.
Good fundamentals and working knowledge in design relational databases using Postgres, MySQL.
Excited to learn about Cloud-based services; bonus points for deploying/hosting backend services on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Enjoy working in quick prototypes/MVPs of mobile and web applications, agile environment. 
Basic understanding of concepts such as service-oriented architecture, single-page applications, and micro-services is an advantage.
Excellent written and oral communication in English. 
Passionate for learning new technology and an ambition to add value to self and company.

Additional information
We encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply and are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances.

Why us?
Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.

title: Cyber Range of Critical Infrastructure for Cybersecurity Experiment
description:
Industrial control systems (ICS) are critical for the essential services of our modern society. The use of information and communication technologies (ICT) in ICS makes it more intelligent hence provides efficient, seamless, and automated operation. 

This increased reliance on ICT brings security challenges that need to be addressed. In recent years, we have witnessed a number of cyber attacks against our critical (national) infrastructure, such as cyber attack against Ukraine power plant attack in 2015, Florida water plant attack in 2021, and, very recently, Colonial pipeline attack using ransomware in the US.

In order to evaluate the impact of cyber attacks as well as to design/evaluate cybersecurity solutions to counter such emerging threat, cyber range, a high-fidelity virtual testbed for cyber attack experiments, is of high demand. This project works on development of cyber range emulating smart power grid system, which is one of the most important smart nation infrastructures, by using simulators and virtualization technologies, and further conduct cyber attack experiments. The project will involve, but not limited to, some of the following tasks:
- Implementation of virtual ICS device (such as programmable logic controllers) 
- Implementation of virtualized, cyber and physical system infrastructure
- Implementation tools to configure and experiment various cyber attack scenarios

Desired Skillset/Experience
-	Good programming skills in C++ or Python
-	Good understanding in computer network
-	Experience in virtual machine/network technologies
-	Experience in cybersecurity / pen-testing tools (e.g., Nmap, Metasploit)

title: Machine Learning and Data Mining for Automated Policy Generation
description:
The increased dependence on Information and Communication Technologies in the Industrial Control Systems (ICS) has led to an increase in attack surface. To mitigate the harmful impact of cyberattacks, ADSC researchers have developed a Security Policy Engine to enforce certain rules related to provenance verification of messages, context-aware validation and runtime verification of commands and their trusted execution. These policies are to be enforced in ICS via additional bump-in-the-wire appliances or as a software running on the existing ICS devices. 
In the current state of our Security Policy Engine, whether to impose a certain policy and its implementation details are to be decided upon careful consideration of the cyber risks and operating requirements of the ICS. However, manual selection of policies is time-consuming, prone to human error and does not scale well with the complexity of ICS. This project will build a practical framework to automate the process of generating the rules of the Security Policy Engine. The framework will use operational data and network traces to automatically produce a set of rules and optimize the verification/validation parameters to find the optimum balance between security and performance. To demonstrate feasibility, the developed framework will be tested in a state-of-the-art smart grid testbed.

The successful candidate will assist the team on:
-	Research activities and discussions on data mining and machine learning techniques.
-	Developing solutions to automate policy generation for ICS.
-	Make presentations on the personal progress.

description:
Industrial control systems (ICS) are critical for the essential services of our modern society. The use of information and communication technologies (ICT) in ICS makes it more intelligent hence provides efficient, seamless, and automated operation. title: Development of a Message Prediction Mechanism for Smart Grid
description:
Industrial control systems (ICS) are critical for the essential services of our modern society. The use of information and communication technologies (ICT) in ICS makes it more intelligent hence provides efficient, seamless, and automated operation. For instance, in smart power grids, an interconnected network of intelligent sensors, energy generation, storage, and load devices can collect and exchange data to maintain
grid-wide situational awareness and to balance demand/response. This increased reliance on ICT brings security challenges that need to be addressed. In Trustworthy and Secure Cyber-Plexus (TSCP) project, we identify and solve research problems related to cybersecurity of critical infrastructure, with high scientific and economic impact. Our work scope also includes the implementation and commercialization of the solutions we invent.

Attacks against industrial control systems (ICS) often exploit the insufficiency of authentication mechanisms in ICS. Verifying whether the received messages are intact and issued by legitimate sources can prevent false data injection by illegitimate devices. However, the key challenge is to introduce message authentication with minimal delay (e,g., some commands in smart grids need to be delivered within 2 milliseconds, ruling out public-key based cryptography) and communication overhead in a variety of ICS communication settings including
multi-cast. In this project, we exploit the predictability of ICS messages to develop a novel multicast message authentication scheme.

In this internship project, the successful candidate will develop techniques to predict future messages using both traditional statistical approaches as well as machine learning techniques. 

The tasks will include,
-	Exploration of machine learning techniques/technologies to predict possible ICS messages and their relative probabilities.
-	Implementation of the techniques and their integration to enhance the efficiency of our authentication protocols by incorporating accurate prediction mechanisms into our
  product.

title: FPGA Implementation of a Novel Digital Signature Scheme
description:
Industrial control systems (ICS) are critical for the essential services of our modern society. The use of information and communication technologies (ICT) in ICS makes it more intelligent hence provides efficient, seamless, and automated operation. For instance, in smart power grids, an interconnected network of intelligent sensors, energy generation, storage, and load devices can collect and exchange data to maintain
grid-wide situational awareness and to balance demand/response. This increased reliance on ICT brings security challenges that need to be addressed. In Trustworthy and Secure Cyber-Plexus (TSCP) project, we identify and solve research problems related to cybersecurity of critical infrastructure, with high scientific and economic impact. Our work scope also includes the implementation and commercialization of the solutions we invent.

An increasing number of ICS, including those used for electric substation automation and high-frequency trading, rely on low-latency (e.g., less than 2 ms), high-throughput (e.g., thousands of messages per
second), and secure exchange of data. It is a tall order to employ digital signatures for such traffic, especially under the computing power limitation of prevailing hardware.
Mainstream solutions either use precomputation techniques to reduce the delay of generating digital signatures or employ symmetric key cryptography such as MAC instead. The former's throughput suffers from high computation overhead before the message is given and its verification delay after the message is given is still long, while the latter lacks important security features such as non-repudiation, impersonation-resistance among a group. In this project we develop a digital signature scheme which, unlike existing solutions, leverages small message size to achieve lower
end-to-end delay and higher message rate.

In this project, the successful candidate will develop software for network security and resilience solutions, invented by ADSC researchers. 

The tasks will include,
- Implementation of digital signature schemes developed in-house as well as designing embedded systems with Zynq Systems on Chips. Zynq has an ARM-based processor with the hardware programmability of an FPGA. This task will consist of,
    - Implementation of a novel authenticated data structure,
    - Implementation of various traversal algorithms on the data structures,
    - Implementation of hash chaining based cryptography.
- Implementation of state-of-the-art cryptographic algorithms/protocols.

title: Software Implementation of Cryptographic Protocols for Secure, Collaborative Storage
description:
Singapore is undertaking the modernization of power grid systems towards “Grid 2.0”. One of the main pillars of Grid 2.0 is the integration of diversified entities of energy generation and storage, known as distributed energy resources (DERs), such as batteries and renewable generators (e.g., solar, wind) that are either at utility scale or consumer level. Furthermore, we are now witnessing strong trends towards deregulation and decentralization in energy markets and renewable energy penetration in other parts of the globe, including the US, China, and Europe.
The distributed, multi-organizational nature of the DER and flexible consumer infrastructures pose a number of security challenges to ensure reliable and trustworthy power grid operation. In this project, we will approach the Grid 2.0 security challenges in Singapore from three angles; secure energy transactions, secure decentralized storage for collaboration, and secure end-to-end communication for resource monitoring and control. Our solution will be a crucial steppingstone towards securing the future’s Grid, hence facilitating renewable penetration for decarbonization, decentralization, and deregulation not only for Singapore’s smart nation but also for expansion to overseas markets.

The successful candidate will assist the team in:
-	Research activities and discussions on provable data possession and secure collaborative storage.
-	Developing solutions to provide Completeness, Correctness, and Freshness guarantees on stored data in collaborative applications.
-	Make presentations on the personal progress.
