title: Intern in Lab of AI in Genomics
description:
Project 1: Genome sequencing assembling is one of the most essential tasks in genomics. High accuracy sequences help us find relevant information about the sequenced organism (i.e., human or virus) which is especially important for clinical use. This project will focus on one, important sub-task of genome sequencing, named basecalling. As the DNA strand passes through the nanopore, a few nucleobases create a characteristic current disruption in the pore. A sequencing device continuously measures electrical current and stores it for sequence decoding. The process of sequence decoding from the measured current is called basecalling. The focus of this project will be on developing high accuracy basecaller using deep learning methods. The student will get to know the practical approaches to data preparation and deep learning (such as attention networks and transformers). The solution will be implemented using Python and PyTorch library. The student will be encouraged to publish his application on GitHub as an open-source project.
Required:
- Motivation
- Willingness to learn by doing
- Basic programming skills
- Prior knowledge in biology is not required
Preferable skills (not required):
- Python
- Basic knowledge in probability and statistics, linear algebra and information theory
- Knowledge of PyTorch or another DL framework
- Basic knowledge in the machine and deep learning methods

Project 2: Modification of DNA nucleotides is an important way to control the function of the genome through the regulation of gene expression. DNA modifications contribute to diseases such as cancer where it is used as a biomarker, and it has been found to have influence on aging, demonstrating the value of epigenomics data to understand the profile of each individual patient.
The goal of this project would be to develop deep learning models for the detection of the modification from sequencing data. Initial models would be based on convolutional neural networks. Still, at later stages of the project, other approaches would be tried out as well – such as attention models that recently made a breakthrough in the field of natural language processing and proved to be more successful in language tasks then recurrent neural networks.
Required:
- Motivation
- Willingness to learn by doing
- Basic programming skills
- Prior knowledge in biology is not required
Preferable skills (not required):
- Python
- Basic knowledge in probability and statistics, linear algebra and information theory
- Knowledge of PyTorch or another DL framework
- Basic knowledge in the machine and deep learning methods

Project 3: Genome assembly cannot be feasible without algorithms and methods integrated into tools called de novo assemblers which reconstruct genomes from short sequenced DNA fragments in a manner similar to puzzle solving. The “power horse” of de novo assembly are algorithms on strings and graphs. The majority of de novo assemblers were designed on smaller genomes and work well on larger eukaryotic organisms, but most of them create haploid representations of the genome regardless of the ploidy (they collapse information from their parents). The separation of genetic material from each parent results in knowledge of the complete genotype – all variant forms of all genes. Therefore, different methods should be applied in the assembly process to achieve better reconstructions. The main goal of this thesis is to adapt Raven, a de novo assembler for long erroneous sequencing data, for diploid organisms sequenced. Raven is a tool produced by our group and now is one of the most popular de novo assemblers.
Required:
- Motivation
- Willingness to learn by doing
- Intermediate C/C++ skills
- Knowledge of algorithms and data structures
- Prior knowledge in biology is not required
Preferable skills (not required):
- Software engineering skills
- Parallel programing

Project 4: Genome assembly is procedure for reconstructing genomes from short sequenced DNA fragments in a manner similar to puzzle solving. The majority of de novo assemblers were designed on smaller genomes and work well on larger eukaryotic organisms, but most of them create haploid representations of the genome regardless of the ploidy (they collapse information from their parents). The separation of genetic material from each parent results in knowledge of the complete genotype – all variant forms of all genes. Therefore, different methods should be applied in the assembly process to achieve better reconstructions.
A student will work on various deep learning models based on convolutional neural networks or attention mechanism. The project will start with an approach similar to those used in Google’s Deep Variant model.
Required:
- Motivation
- Willingness to learn by doing
- Basic programming skills
- Prior knowledge in biology is not required
Preferable skills (not required):
- Python
- Basic knowledge in probability and statistics, linear algebra and information theory
- Knowledge of PyTorch or another DL framework
- Basic knowledge in the machine and deep learning methods

Project 5: AI vaccine design process can be seen as selecting good fragments of the virus proteins, then constructing them together into a final vaccine. A fragment with multiple merits can be selected as a subunit of the final vaccine.
Proteins may be viewed as sequences of amino acid residues. However they can also be considered as graphs with its residues as nodes, with two nodes sharing an edge if their residues are spatially close.

A student will work on various deep learning models based on sequences (ie. attention mechanism) and graphs (graph neural network) for detection of fragments of proteins suitable to be a subunit of a vaccine.
Required:
- Motivation
- Willingness to learn by doing
- Basic programming skills
- Prior knowledge in biology is not required
Preferable skills (not required):
- Python
- Basic knowledge in probability and statistics, linear algebra and information theory
- Knowledge of PyTorch or another DL framework
- Basic knowledge in the machine and deep learning methods

title: Algorithmic Engineering Intern (m/f/d)
description:
Hyperganic's mission is to radically accelerate innovation in design and engineering of physical products to help solve humanity's biggest challenges. Powered by artificial intelligence, the company’s software platform creates parts, structures and entire machines that enable mass production in digital factories using industrial 3D printing. Hyperganic is working with leading companies in the U.S., Europe, Southeast Asia and China across diverse fields such as consumer goods, medical applications and aerospace.
In February 2021 Hyperganic announced the closing of $7.8m in funding backed by HV Capital (Zalando, Flixbus) and VSquared Ventures (Isar Aerospace, IQM), also joined by US-based Converge as well as Swarovski and Hermann Hauser Investments.

description:

2. Develop designs for a prototype smart nozzle with adaptive structures and embedded health monitoring systems for hydrodynamic cavitation abrasive finishing.
3. Study the flow behaviours of various prototype smart nozzles using a lab scale setup and develop a theoretical understanding of nozzle designs.
4. Study the effect of the surface finishing process parameters (i.e., roughness, material removal, etc) and erosion effects on smooth/milled surfaces by hydrodynamic cavitation abrasive finishing using various nozzle prototypes.

title: ManTech1.2: Analytical Study of Archard Wear during Vibratory Finishing Process
description: An analytical model on Archard Wear for vibratory finishing processes can help to produce wear results quickly. The Archard Wear volume is related by the 3 components: 1) wear coefficient, 2) normal force acting by the media on the workpiece, and 3) total sliding distance by the media on the workpiece. To fully develop the Archard Wear model these 3 components must be reasonably predicted by validating these values through sub-experiments. Finally, a full-scale vibratory finishing experiment will be conducted, where the volume of material removed will be validated with the developed Archard Wear Model.

title: ManTech1.2: Digitalization of Advanced Manufacturing Processes for Aerospace Applications

In-depth analysis of the sensor data is required to correlate the process outcome with machine. Finally, the sensor data will be correlated to the process and statistical process control limits will be established.

title: Technology Analyst Industrial Attachment (Developer)
description:
What we’re looking for (Key Requirements):
•	Undergraduate/Master’s student enrolled in a University
•	Outstanding academic achievement
•	Major in computer engineering, computer science, information systems or related area 
•	Must be able to apply for the Industrial Attachment as university credit OR take leave of absence from the university to complete the Industrial Attachment
•	Strong quantitative and analytical skills 
•	Effective verbal and written communication
•	Being comfortable with change and adjust to changing demands and requirements
•	Strong team player and client focused
•	Ability to work and prioritize issues with minimal supervision
•	Demonstrate energy and drive
•	Show a keen interest and passion in Computing and Technology
•	Strong programming foundation in OOP and knowledge of platforms such as UNIX, Windows, databases, Java, Python, C, C++, C#, .NET and other technologies 
Why Us?
Bank of America’s strategic vision is to deliver market-leading technology that drives our business forward and meets the needs of our clients. Our business-aligned technology teams develop and support the software platforms critical to that goal. These cover the full spectrum of our business including sales, trading and research applications, trade processing, risk management and portfolio management. 

In order to maintain our competitive edge and deliver the best solutions to our global client base, we continually invest in cutting-edge technology. This includes the development of programs and applications that allow you to work with the latest technologies and some of the most highly regarded technologists in the industry. The global nature of our business offers you the opportunity to work and interact with colleagues from around the world, supporting an expanding product range and high level of global demand.

Overview:

The Technology Analyst - Industrial Attachment is a 6 month regional program designed to provide interns with a unique opportunity to gain an extended exposure to life at the Bank and also make significant contributions to the Technology team in which they are placed. The Industrial Attachment begins with an orientation and induction to the firm. Industrial Attachment interns are given a true associate experience, as assignments mirror full-time responsibility and include goal-setting and a formal review process.

What you’ll do (Key Responsibilities):

•	Access to online e-portal learning covering compliance and foundation of banking topics
•	Structured and on-the-job training
•	Networking and social opportunities
•	Exposure to senior level management
•	Corporate Social Responsibility project
•	Involvement in Diversity and Inclusion training/events  
•	Consideration for full time employment upon graduation

Technology Opportunities:

The Technology Analyst - Industrial Attachment Program offers development roles in Global Banking and Markets Technology division. This line of business provides technology and operations solutions and support for the equities, electronic trading, rates and currencies, credit and structured products, commodities, sales and capital markets, and research businesses. 

Under this division are the following lines of business where you will potentially be assigned (depending on the business need)
•	Global Markets Operations Technology (GMOT) - Supports Global Markets Operations and Middle Office, plus external partners. Acts as the primary support for Global Markets Operations across Transaction Management, Confirmations, Settlements & Clearing, Corporate Actions, Payments, Operational Risk, P&L and Balance Sheet, and Reference Data. GMOT also provides support for Futures and Options, OTC Clearing, FXPB and GCAS Front Offices.
•	Global Equities Technology - Leads the three primary businesses, active in 140 markets around the world: Execution Services (high and low touch), Client Solutions (derivatives) and Asset Management Services (prime brokerage, security lending and swaps). In addition, this group also covers Global Sales, Research, Capital Markets and the GBAM Mercury® Portal.
•	Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities (FICC) Technology - Supports the Global Fixed Income, Currencies & Commodities (FICC) trading and sales franchise that operates out of 25 locations worldwide, covering clients in more than 150 countries. 
•	Global Transaction Services (GTS) Technology - Provides technology solutions and support for Global Transaction Services (GTS) business that offers Cash Management, Liquidity, Receivables, Trade Finance, Credit & Loans, FX, etc. as product offerings to our clients in the region and globally.

As an Industrial Attachment Analyst, you will be exposed to a broad range of technologies covering many diverse environments with the opportunity to work across all aspects of the software development lifecycle. You will be joining a development technology team that will challenge you to deliver and input solutions, creating or extending one of the many in-house software applications. These operate complex trading systems using languages such as Java, C++, .NET and Python to power and improve our business. In today’s market it is technology that turns trading strategy into a trading profit, putting us ahead of our competitors.

title: [CAD]Physical Verification CAD Intern I (Jan-May 2022)
description:
Summary:                         
Mediatek is a young and innovative company, always looking to create effective solutions to existing problems. We seek like-minded individuals to join us as interns, individuals with the spark to innovate, the motivation to learn and to perform and deliver as a team or individual.

Our team is focused and specialized in design checks to ensure electrical, logical and manufacturability of an IC chip, one of the most important backend signoff milestones for any chip design. We are seeking interns who will be part of a bigger team, working on in house design rule definition/coding for advanced and matured technology nodes, as well as scripting automation for design checks.


Requirements:
•	Pursuing a degree in Electrical/Electronics/Computer Science Engineering 
•	Must be an independent worker and  have a strong drive to learn and pick up new things
•	Able to communicate well and handle cross team collaboration
•	Be willing to explore unfamiliar territory and try to seek innovative solutions to existing or new problems
•	Able to demonstrate critical thinking when faced with difficult situations
•	Having IC layout experience and scripting knowledge is a plus but not a necessary skill.

Responsibilities:
When you join us, you’ll work alongside with experienced engineers who’ll mentor and guide you.
You will be involved in:
•	Learn design rule check coding
•	Execute design rule checks on chip design and regression structures
•	Study test regression structures for in house design rule 
•	Debug existing rule code versus regression structures
•	Learn In house design checks definition methodology
•	Basic scripting automation

Learning Outcomes:                               
Interns will be able to 
•	Be familiar with linux environment
•	Understand the uses of design rules to check the electrical and manufacturability of the chips
•	Understand and be exposed to the process of creating new design rules
o	from root cause analysis of issue, to experimental rule definition, to rule coding, to quality assurance in test regression structures
•	Hands on experience with layout tool (Synopsys: Laker etc.)
•	Hands on experience in design rule coding (Mentor Graphics: SVRF)
•	Hands on experience executing Design rule checks (Mentor Graphics: Calibre)
•	Hands on experience in scripting with tcl/python/csh 
•	Experience real dynamics in cross team collaboration

title: [CAD] Physical Verification Sign-off Intern (Jan-May 2022)
description:
Summary:                         
Mediatek is a young and innovative company, always looking to create effective solutions to existing problems. We seek like-minded individuals to join us as interns, individuals with the spark to innovate, the motivation to learn and to perform and deliver as a team or individual.

Our team is focused and specializes in design checks to ensure electrical, logical and manufacturability of an IC chip, one of the most important backend signoff milestones for any chip design. We are seeking interns who will be part of a bigger team, working on full chip design checks signoff for advanced and matured technology nodes, as well as scripting automation for design checks.
Interns will be given exposure to how a full chip is created, the physical rule checks that needs to be run and potential problems that could happen and how to resolve the problems.
They will get a taste of the dynamics between individual block owners and top and how the chip will all come together eventually. They will touch on program management, project risk assessment as well as project issue reporting.

Requirements:
•	Pursuing a degree in Electrical/Electronics/Computer Science Engineering 
•	Must be an independent worker and  have a strong drive to learn and pick up new things
•	Able to communicate well and handle cross team collaboration
•	Be willing to explore unfamiliar territory and try to seek innovative solutions to existing or new problems
•	Able to demonstrate critical thinking when faced with difficult situations
•	Having IC layout experience and scripting knowledge is a plus but not a necessary skill.


Responsibilities:
When you join us, you’ll work alongside with experienced engineers who’ll mentor and guide you.
You will be involved in:
•	Execute design rule checks on real chip design
•	Debug real issues related to design rule checks happening at full chip integration 
•	Do basic reporting on physical verification issues
•	Basic project management/project risk assessment reporting 
•	Basic scripting automation

Learning Outcomes:                               
You will be able to 
•	Be familiar with linux environment 
•	Deep knowledge of Physical Verification in chip tape-out operations
•	Understand and be exposed to the process of Full chip construction
o	from individual IPs (IO/Analog/digital), necessary physical structures (eg. Sealring, mask alignment marker, clamp cells), dummy generation etc.
•	Hands on experience with layout tool (Synopsys: Laker etc.)
•	Hands on experience executing Design rule checks (Mentor Graphics: Calibre)
•	Hands on debugging real chip issues related to physical verification
•	Experience some basic project management
•	Experience the bustle of backend closure of a real product tapeout
•	Hands on experience in scripting with tcl/python/csh 
•	Experience real dynamics in cross team collaboration

title: [CAD] Physical Verification CAD Intern II (Jan-May 2022)
description:
Summary: 
MediaTek‘s CAD team is responsible to ensure the design quality of the integrated circuit layout for our chips. We have unique career opportunities for student interested in applying their software and hardware skill towards verifying the chip design with cutting edge process technology.
We are looking for those with talent and ambitious to innovate the way we verify the electrical and logical functionality and manufacturability of layout design.

Students who are eager to get involve with industry most advance process technology are a perfect fit for our team.
As an intern with our CAD team, you will assist with ensuring MTK integrated circuit layout meet the process design rule. We will provide you with mentorship and the opportunity to collaborate with experience process development kit engineer, layout engineer, as well as work along with project team to tape out our SoC product.

Requirements:
•	Currently enrolled in your BSc/MSc from reputable university.
•	Strong programming skill and knowledge of Python.
•	Coursework related to integrated circuit design or semiconductor physic is a plus.
•	Excellent communication skills, self-motivated and well-organized.

Responsibilities:
With guidance, you will work within CAD team to code in-house rule using Calibre Standard Verification Rule Format (SVRF). You will collaborate with process development kit team for the test pattern to verify the newly developed code, and also write script using Python to automate the run and log file processing. 

You will also have a chance to integrate foundry rule release into MTK R&D environment, work with rule owner for test pattern development, rules specification and device definition and verification, or work with layout engineer to identify issue in their layout design.

Learning Outcomes:                               
•	Well-verse in using Calibre SVRF for rule coding. 
•	Understand how devices are formed in semiconductor context.
•	Expert in using Calibre for physical verification.
•	Familiar with using commercial layout design tool for QA pattern generation.
•	Understand the uses of physical verification flow (LVS, ERC) to check integrated circuit layout design.
•	Understand the various foundry rule deck for across process technology nodes.
•	Proficient in automation scripting using Python.
•	Layout design LVS/ERC debugging.

title: [CAD] CAD Software Engineer Intern (Jan-May 2022)
description:
Summary:
MediaTek leads the market in chipset technology for Smart TVs, Voice Assistant Devices (VAD), Android tablets, feature phones, Optical and Blu-ray DVD players, and we’re number two globally in mobile phones. You may not know it, but our chips and technology are already likely part of your everyday life. You will find us in 20 percent of homes globally and nearly 1 of every 3 mobile phones is powered.
As a CAD Software Engineer intern, you will be an active participant in the team responsible for ensuring our CAD flow & methodology is efficient, lean and reliable. You will be involved in developing automation to improve the efficiency and reliability of CAD flow. You have the opportunities to collaborate cross functionally with other teams to deliver on our goals. We will create an individual training plan to help you develop the specific skills and knowledge required for your role.
Microelectronic Engineering students with a strong interest and passion in coding will be a good fit but Computer Science students are also welcomed to apply.
Requirements:
•	You are pursuing a degree in Computer, Software or Engineering related studies
•	You have knowledge in one of the programming languages and are willing to increase skills in this area (Python, Perl, Tcl or Javascript)
•	You have a passion in coding and eager to learn
•	You enjoy collaborating with others to find innovative solutions
•	You think logically, willing to self-learn and research, and take a creative approach to problem solving
•	You have basic IC design knowledge (this is a plus but not mandatory)

Responsibilities:
•	Involve in various stages of the software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design and implementation, and deployment.
•	Develop, improve and maintain CAD flow & methodology for ensuring correct electrical and logical functionality and manufacturability.
•	Work closely with team members and develop solutions using Open Source Software technology.
•	Directly involved in our physical verification methodology efforts, collaborating right alongside our internal multi-functional teams to ensure that our products achieve best-in-class PPA (Power, Performance & Area) and time-to-market.
Learning Outcomes:
•	Understand best practices in software development
•	Real-life experience of working within a software team in a multinational company
•	Gain technical experience developing automated workflow
•	Enhance coding skills; get exposed to new tools and programming languages
•	Hands-on experience in Open Source Software technology, which include, but are not limited to: Python, Perl, Tcl, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, MongoDB and amongst others

description:

You will be working with a team of data scientists, data analysts, data engineers, and software engineers to develop data products for more intelligent operations and to solve real-life problems. description:

Business Transformation is a multi-disciplinary competency, gathering capabilities in transformation architecture, experience design, business design and transformation execution to problem-solve, design and deliver large scale, multi-year, multi-stakeholder transformation programs for our clients who operate in an environment where achieving and sustaining performance is more difficult than ever. As a Business Consulting professional, you will be focused on helping them grow and bring to live their strategy by helping them navigate disruption, putting humans@center, leverage technology@speed, and enable innovation@scale.

You’ll work in high-performing teams that drive growth and deliver exceptional client service, playing your part in building a better working world.

Transformation Execution

•	Agile Delivery – Identify and develop in a timely manner functional specification and manage project in an Agile process framework.
•	Complex Program Management – Lead large scale, multi-year, multi-function programs based on repeatable methodologies and tools.

Whether you’re in Transformation Architecture, Experience Ecosystem, Business Design, Transformation Execution, we will provide you with the right support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to shape your future.

title: Technology Consulting Intern, Cybersecurity
description:
Technology Consulting Intern | Cybersecurity, Singapore
Cyber threats, social media, massive data storage, privacy requirements and continuity of the business as usual require heavy information security measures. 

The opportunity: your next adventure awaits 
As a cybersecurity professional in EY Singapore, you will have the chance to work with an international connected team of specialists in serving our clients through providing independent assessments or implementation of cyber solutions that contributes toward their business resilience. 

Core Cybersecurity
You will work with your project team and the client to execute engagements which help the client to measure the effectiveness of its cybersecurity programs, assess the cybersecurity risk of a client; evaluate the maturity of a security program, test the effectiveness of cyber controls, assist the client in complying with the various cyber policies and regulations, and help implement new cyber control processes and tools to perform more effective cyber risk management. 

Operational Technology
The Operation Technology Team provides cybersecurity services to clients who run operational technology environments and/or critical information infrastructures. 

As an OT Cybersecurity Consultant, you will be part of an elite and dynamic team performing a myriad of cybersecurity services to help the clients identify any vulnerabilities or weaknesses, design and implement processes and solutions for the clients to better protect their systems, monitor and detect any cybersecurity attacks, respond to and recover from these attacks.

Attack and Penetration (A&P)
Our A&P services provide technical cyber assessments that aim to assist clients gain insight and context to their cyber threats and assessing, improving, and building security operations in order to mitigate these threats.

As an A&P team member, you will be responsible for performing web application/mobile penetration testing, network penetration testing, source code review and red team assessment. You will also be involved in conducting social engineering exercises and respond to incidents for clients suffering from security breach/cyberattack. 

Solution and Architecture
As a member of Solution and Architecture team, you will be involved in analyzing the client’s cybersecurity requirements, design a suitable solution, test that the solution is built to specifications, deploy the solution to the client’s live environment and continuously enhance and optimize the solution to improve the client’s cybersecurity posture. You can become the cybersecurity architect in the domain you choose.

Qualifications: 
•	Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent
•	Knowledge in programming, networks, operating systems and databases, COBIT framework, ISO/IEC 27000-series of standards would be an added advantage
•	Strong interest in the field of information security

•	Program delivery (program management, release management, benefits management)
•	Requirements definition
•	Solution architecture and design

Enterprise and Industry application implementation
•	Configuration and development
•	Systems development and integration
•	Testing
•	Security and controls
•	Process management and improvement
•	Operations/as-a-service service

Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC)
•	Our global GRC organization enables clients to leverage technology to successfully manage opportunities and reduce risk. This requires transforming the way the organization views and capitalizes on risk
•	Vendor and technology selection
•	GRC framework and technology strategy definition
•	GRC solution implementation (design, build, test, and deploy)
•	Risk and control management and operations 
EY Technology Consulting has exciting opportunities for highly motivated students to join our multi-disciplinary teams and gain valuable experience in various sectors and play a key role in ensuring high quality outputs and service to our clients. 

You will be part of the team in the execution of clients’ assignments in the areas of:
•	Enterprise & Industry Application Implementation 
•	Information management and business intelligence;
•	Technology operational effectiveness and business case development;
•	Implementation of Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC);
•	Program and project management; and
•	Information Technology Strategy & Transformation


Your key responsibilities 
•	Support the project activities focused on implementation of enterprise applications and GRC.
•	Effectively contribute in performance improvement projects, develop analysis, engage client teams and stakeholders, and deliver high-quality work products.  
•	Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes.
•	Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business, actively assess and present ways to best serve clients, with a focus to develop and maintain long-term client relationships and networks
•	Supporting the team in adapting plans and schedules based on evolving needs, conditions or issues that may arise and ensuring on-time, high-quality delivery in accordance with the stated project goals.

Qualifications:
•	Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information System or Engineering
•	Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, presentation, business writing and interest in further designing, developing and integrating business operations and technology
•	Able to research client inquiries and emerging issues

title: Technology Consulting Intern, Technology Transformation
description:
Technology Consulting Intern | Technology Transformation, Singapore

Technology is the business agenda. Customers’ expectations for access to technology products and services are rapidly increasing. User-centric, mobile, agile and data-driven capabilities are table stakes for every organization. Companies must consider foundational Technology Transformation to adapt and compete. Experience has shown us that a successful Technology Transformation rests upon four key elements: Technology Strategy, NextGen Technology Operations, Infrastructure and Service Resiliency, and Architecture.

•	Technology Strategy encompasses a full set of Consulting capabilities to help clients think through the strategic issues and fully align technology to their overall purpose and business objectives. 
•	NextGen Tech Ops help clients transform their technology delivery models to enable growth and competitive advantage, optimize costs, and mitigate risk. 
•	Infrastructure and Service Resiliency enables business outcomes by aligning to business criticality and priorities and leveraging end-to-end enhancements across IT infrastructure services and operations. 
•	Architecture provides comprehensive business and enterprise architecture services, with a focus on emerging technologies, that help our clients solve their business problems.

Your key responsibilities 
•	Engage with C-suite and shape client’s technology transformation agenda
•	Translate business requirements to software development, project team and clients.
•	Evaluate and select appropriate software or hardware and propose integration methods for client engagements
•	Define the required technical architecture specifications based on solution or client requirements.
•	Define technical standards together with the project manager or lead architect
•	Implement the agreed architecture and infrastructure environments; to ensure it meets the standards defined
•	Conduct various architecture operational and resiliency test as part of delivering the architecture

Qualifications: 
•	Pursuing a Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
•	Hands-on experience with software development or cloud/system administration
•	Knowledge of one or more coding languages (e.g. JavaScript, Java, C#)
•	Ability to research client inquiries and issues

title: Internship Job Title: Hardware Engineer
description:
WADS hardware team make use of CAD tool Altium software for schematic capture and PCB layout.
Currently each member is maintaining his own version of component library. Although team members do share data, duplicate component creations still occur and resources are wasted. It will be good to have a single standardize, common component library. In future, all updates will be done on this single library.

WADS has been working on turnkey projects. Each project will have a few cycles of prototype building. Extra manpower is required during prototype building, turn-on, test and troubleshooting.

Program Outline for the 20-week attachment

Week 1 – Orientation / familiar with Altium Software
Week 2 to 4 – Learn Altium Software and component creation / prototyping activities
Week 5 to 8 – Go through each of hardware team members’ libraries, analyze and take record / prototyping activities
Week 9 to 12 – Organize record entry and start merging libraries / prototyping activities
Week 12 to 17 – Merging libraries / prototyping activities
Week 18 – Merging libraries / prototyping activities
Week 19 – Touch up unified library / prototyping activities
Week 20 – Presentation of unified library / prototyping activities

title: Mixed Reality Solution on Hololens2
description:
Hiring Entity: ST Engineering Aerospace Ltd (Subsidiary of Singapore Technologies Engineering Ltd)

In developing a Mixed Reality (MR) solution for use on the Microsoft Hololens2 headset, you will be expected to:
1. Analyse client's requirements and intended use case.
2. Design and develop a Mixed Reality application with real-world physics and instinctual manipulation.
3. Brainstorm and clearly communicate ideas/ input to other members of a cross-functional team .
4. Conceptualise UI / UX design.
5. Research and optimise app performance and usablity.
6. Perform courseware testing to ensure accuracy and seamless user experience prior to delivering to users.

Prerequisites:

2. Completed coursework  in User Interface and User Experience Design  or Game Design equivalent (preferred).
3. Interest in developing solutions that address real-world needs.

1. Work closely with the leading Mixed Reality studio that is recognised as the first Microsoft Mixed Reality partner in Singapore.
2. Develop MR solutions that are used for actual training and operations.
3. Work in a cross-functional team to develop the application.
4. Acquire critical soft skills for project and client management.
5. Try out new technologies (hardware, software).

title: Automation of data cleaning, visualisation and analysis of user data
description:
Hiring Entity: ST Engineering Advanced Material Engineering Pte. Ltd. (Subsidiary of Singapore Technologies Engineering Ltd)

The COVID-19 pandemic has taken the world by storm with over 150 million confirmed cases worldwide and 3 million deaths as of May 2021. A biotelemetry platform to remotely monitor vital signs can not only aid in early detection of COVID-19, but also other illnesses and possible injuries of those being monitored. However, such a platform will inevitably deal with large amounts of data. As such, the process of cleaning, processing analysing and visualising the data play a key role in the success of the platform. In this project, the student will assist the engineers in operationalising and improving this process of data management.

This project would have three main parts namely:
1) To assist engineers to clean, process and send data to cloud
2) To assist engineers to write, edit and optimize data analysis scripts
3) To assist engineers in optimizing and executing data visualization models

Prerequisites:
- Strong fundamentals in data structures and algorithms
- Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language such as Python
- Experience in data cleaning, analysis and visualisation preferred

Learning Outcomes:
- Be a part of building a biotelemetry platform that can help in dealing with the COVID-19 pandemic
- Gain hands-on experience in applying data science theory and methods to real-life application
- Work in a small, cross-functional team in a fast-paced environment

title: Data Scientist (Weather) Intern
description:
Job Overview:
Envision Energy is a global leading smart energy management company. It owns the world's largest Energy IoT platform, EnOS™. Envision has regional offices across Asia, Europe, North and Latin America and has established global R&D and engineering centres in Denmark, Germany, Singapore and the United States. The Envision’s Global Digital Hub has been set up in Singapore in early 2018, partnering with Ascendas-Singbridge Group, Sunseap Group, the Solar Energy Research Institute of Singapore, and the Nanyang Technological University. The AI/IoT capacity developing in this Digital hub will be a key base for Envision’s business.

Due to Envision’s expanding business, we are seeking data scientists to help us develop weather forecast algorithms and further improve the forecast accuracy of wind, solar radiation, rainfall, lightning temperature and other attributes.

Responsibilities:
• Maintain and optimize existing weather forecast algorithms for various weather attributes, e.g. wind, rainfall, lightning, etc.
• Optimize, develop and adapt advanced computer vision and state-of-the-art deep learning techniques for weather parameter nowcasting, e.g. rainfall, wind, lightning, temperature etc.
• Provide technical support for business development team to successfully execute R&D projects and continue to grow our business.

Qualifications:
• Have passion about data and data science
• Degree in computer science, applied mathematics, electrical engineering or related technical discipline.
• Experience of designing and building advanced machine learning models to solve business problems, including but not limited to, typical regression tasks, image classification, object detection, etc.
• Strong scientific programming skills in Python.
• Practical experience with deep learning framework, including PyTorch, Tensorflow.
• Proficiency in coding in Linux environment and is able to write bash script.
• Experience collaborating within research teams to develop advanced research concepts, prototypes, and systems.
• Good communication, presentation skills and ability to collaborate and learn from others.

description:
About us
Envision Digital is focused on bringing technology solutions to the sustainability challenge. Its world-class AIoT technology helps governments and companies across the world accelerate progress toward a net zero future and improve their citizens’ quality of life. Having established itself as a leading solutions provider for intelligent renewable energy generation, consumption efficiency and smart flexible storage, it has extended its capabilities beyond energy to enable and optimize applications notably in smart cities, smart buildings and estates, smart infrastructures, e-mobility and smart plants.

title: Development of Next Generation Planning System
description:
Project Background
PSA Singapore handled 36.6 million TEUs in 2020 and is the World's Busiest Transhipment Hub. PSA Singapore container terminals will eventually be consolidated at a single location in Tuas, which will be the largest automated container terminal in the world that is designed for annual handling capacity of 65 million TEUs.

Tuas mega port will also be part of a greater ecosystem connecting various stakeholders in the logistics community, both digitally and physically to enable integrated intermodal supply chain solutions within Singapore & internationally with our overseas ports. 

Project Scope
As part of PSA’s automation & digital transformation journey, we aim to develop the Next Generation Planning System that provides state-of-the-art planning solutions to each key planning pillar of our port operations (Berth, Yard, Vessel & Resource), provides shared visibility and serves as a platform for cross domain collaboration. 

In this project,
- Candidate will be involved as we develop our Next Generation Planning System with improved UX to our users and our port business in conjunction with the intelligence and automation behind it. 
- Candidate will get to experience Extreme Programming (XP) practices like Pair Programming, be trained on TDD (Test Driven Development), Continuous Integration and more. 
- Candidate will also learn how Engineers work together with the Product Manager and Designer, operating as a lean team to bring our product forward in an Agile manner.

Special Knowledge / Skills Required:
Dedication to learning & working in a balanced agile team, passion for programming. Seeks to explore, to improve things and possess the ability to work and communicate well with others. 

Experience with the following technologies is preferred.
Angular, Java, Spring Boot

title: Project Delivery Specialist Intern (IoT)
description:
Job Description: 
The role requires the individual to work in a dynamic team guided by the project manager to assist in onboarding clients’ assets onto the cloud-based monitoring product. The selected individual will be part of a friendly and willing to teach team and will have the opportunity to gain a variety of exposure ranging from how IoT works technically, to minor configuration and customization of data loggers through a guided mentorship program. 

In this role, you will gain a deep understanding of cutting-edge energy and digital related operations and products, be able to improve communication skills with customer and internal stakeholders and receive guidance and training from top industrial experts. Strong problem-solving skill, independent study capability and self-motivation are the core qualities of a suitable candidate.
 
Roles & Responsibilities:
• Support delivery team on various aspects of IoT implementation.
• Participate in project planning and discussions as part of learning.
• Perform data onboarding and/or data validation in system.
• Perform testing of system/functionality.
• Occasional liaising with clients and/or their partners where applicable.
• Document learning slides based on own experience.
• Assist the team in documentation of project documents & statuses.

Requirements: 
• Undergraduate in any Engineering degree/polytechnic with a strong interest in IoT, Analytics, Smart Buildings and Renewable Energy.
• Team player with a positive learning mindset and strong technical capabilities.
• Highly versatile and adaptable to changes, able to work independently in a fast-moving environment, and able to cross multiple functions. 
• Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
• Excellent listening and interpersonal skills. 
• Ability to communicate in Mandarin and/or Japanese, though not a requirement, would be a bonus.

title: Backend Engineer Intern
description:
Company Introduction:
Join our merry band of smart city enthusiasts who have deep passion to improve the environmental and financial sustainability of city while providing delightful user experience. The smart city industry is ripe for disruption and we want you to join us to enable our partners and customers to achieve tangible savings and bottom-line growth. Be part of our diverse, quirky and high performing team that is dedicated to our vision and has enormous fun doing so.

Job Description:
We are looking for Backend Developers to build Java applications e.g. complex groups of back-end services. Your primary responsibility will be to design and develop these applications, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Thus, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and product quality is essential. If you have hands-on experience developing software with agile methodologies, we’d like to meet you.

Job Scope:
•	Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code
•	Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications
•	Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
•	Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation
•	Document development phases
•	Ensure our applications are secure and up-to-date

Job Requirements:
•	Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer or Software Engineering, with good foundation in algorithm/data structure
•	Familiar with any programming language in at least one of Java, Python, and JavaScript.
•	Familiar with Web development technologies, such as Java Spring/boot, or python flask etc
•	Familiar with the design and application of distributed systems, such as Redis etc. 
•	Basic knowledge of rationally using common distributed technologies for problem solving
•	Familiar with database-related technology such as Mysql/ElasticSearch
•	Strong interest in software technology; possess good learning attitude and strong communication skills and the ability to work well in a team
•	Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

title: Electric Vehicle Product Developer Intern
description:
About Envision Digital: 
Founded in 2007 with a mission to solve the world’s greatest energy generation, management, and orchestration challenges, Envision has grown into a global leader in renewable energy, energy storage, and other low carbon energy solutions. With over 4,000 employees in 15 offices globally, Envision is at the forefront of building the world’s clean energy future. 

Envision Digital specializes in AIoT and Machine Learning, developing cutting edge software applications focused on optimizing solar, wind, and energy storage, and enabling the next generation of smart grid, smart cities, smart buildings, health and human safety, and environmental protection and stewardship.  

Envision Digital seeks an intern with experience in software design, coding and debugging. The intern will gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company. We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative.

Job Description:
•	Document and test new software applications
•	Assess new product features and user stories from product manager
•	Develop applications (coding, programming)
•	Research competitor offerings

Required Skills:
•	Degree in a computer-related or engineering-related field
•	Experience programming in Java, Python
•	Proficient technical knowledge to understand the requirement from product manager
•	Good communication skills to communicate requests concisely to the software development team
•	Critical thinking skills to meet the specific needs of clients
•	Native or bilingual in English & Mandarin

title: Transition of Facilities Management(FM) in the new normal (Endemic)  through utilisation of smart FM technologies and contactless technologies.
description:
With the current situation of COVID-19 evolving and likely to become endemic,  it amplified the need to be less reliant on human interactions in delivering  FM services, such as cleaning, horticulture, pest-control, shuttle services, etc.
This project involves the conceptualisation, planning and implementation of Smart Solutions & Sensors as technology enablers to reduce the manual labour and interaction required for delivering FM Services without significant drop in customer experience.  This can be achieved by using smart solutions and sensors to deliver the FM services“ and possibly through the use of automation, robotics, and remote monitors and controls to deliver FM services. This could then translate to less manual labour, more remote control, and therefore less human interaction.

title: Trainee
description:
As Toppan Security Printing embarks its journey with Industry 4.0, strong leadership in the standards and deployment of Industry 4.0 management becomes a significant factor in ensuring satisfaction of our customers every day, as well as being a key enabler in business alignment, eliminating hidden waste, and increasing our speed.
Toppan Security Printing is looking for an engineering intern with the deployment of IIOT and automation projects across the local manufacturing.
The successful candidate will be an innovative thinker who can learn to understand requirements for automation/robotics in manufacturing and also a key resource in helping to gather necessary information to have a successful project. The candidate will also help to manage updating project plans, reporting progress and ensuring cost savings are reported accurately and on time. He/she should be a great communicator who can work across diverse team inside and outside of the business.
Essential responsibilities include the following:
•	Assist with the development and deployment of Agile Automation Production Systems
•	Gather of appropriate information and data to aid in justification of new projects, and report of existing projects status
•	Help monitor progress for Industry 4.0 projects, and to ensure they remain on time and achieve targeted savings

title: Innovations and Technologies to Reduce the Reliance on Human
description:

One of the focus areas is to leverage on innovations and technologies to reduce the reliance on human, both for internal staffs and external contractor labours. title: Investigating the joint probabilities of occurrence between rainfall and high sea level
description:
The intern will be tasked to analyse historical rainfall and tidal data to better understand the temporal trends and spatial variations of these datasets. Subsequently, the intern will undertake joint probability analysis to investigate the combined occurence of rainfall and high sea level.

Through this project, the interns will gain hands-on experience in data analysis and exposure to programming language.
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application and latest transcript
applicationRequirements:
1. Knowledge in programme (e.g. python, MATLAB, R)
2. Knowledge in statistical analysis
3. Good data analytical skills

title: Investigating historical storm surge events
description:
Tide gauge records capture both astronomical tide and non-astronomical components such as storm surges, which are a result of meteorological forcings/events such as wind. .

In Singapore, 2 to 4 events can happen each year and each event can last between 1 and 5 days. To identify historical storm surges and to accurately quantify the magnitude of past storm surge events , there is a need to perform harmonic analysis on the tide gauge records. Harmonic analysis refers to the mathematical process by which the observed tide or tidal current at any place is separated into basic harmonic constituents. By separating out the astronomical tides, the residual would likely represent the non-astronomical components such as storm surges.

The objective of the task is to perform harmonic analysis on all the historical tide gauge data available in Singapore to investigate the storm surge events that occurred in the past and identify spatial and temporal variation across Singapore’s waters through statistical analysis.

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
BitTitan® empowers IT service professionals to successfully deploy and manage cloud technologies through automation. BitTitan is the developer of MigrationWiz®, the industry-leading SaaS solution for mailbox, document, public-folder and Microsoft Teams migrations between a wide range of Sources and Destinations. Additionally, Voleer is BitTitan’s solution that centralizes and automates IT tasks, helping empower IT service professionals to streamline daily operations and eliminate redundancies. Since 2009, BitTitan has moved over 19 million users to the cloud for 43,000 customers in 187 countries and supports leading cloud ecosystems including Microsoft, Amazon, Google and Dropbox. BitTitan is a global company with offices in Seattle and Singapore.


Quick overview: 

As a Software Engineer Intern on the MigrationWiz team, you will have the opportunity to work on a live product in the market that is 100% SaaS and scales across many countries. You will work as part of a collaborative team with a focus on constant learning and improvement. Not only will you get hands on with adding new functionality into the product but also be able to see the impact of it to our customers. We appreciate engineers who have great ideas to share and the desire to help us on the path to making those ideas a reality. You will help take our industry-leading migration solution to the next level in terms of performance and scalability while implementing new features requested by our large customer base.

In this job, you will: 
*Design and implement high-quality and highly scalable code
*Utilize technologies such as .NET, SQL Server, CosmosDB, Redis and Azure
*Assist with product features from design to deployment, including monitoring and maintenance
*Maintain a high standard of quality by authoring tests; review change requests to identify potential improvements and to prevent errors
*Work on Global SaaS products

We would love to speak with you if you have: 
*Pursuing a degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science or Computer Engineering
*Strong skills in at least one strongly typed, object-oriented programming language such as C#, Java, or C++
*Ability to learn to design and ship high-quality code, scalable SaaS solutions
*Ability to troubleshoot and solve problems in proactive, optimal and efficient way
*Precise communication skills
*Ability to read and communicate effectively in English
*Understanding of Product Domain and value proposition of the offering

Extras that will give you an edge: 
*Knowledge and experience using a cloud platform and their services (e.g. Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
*Azure certification
*Enthusiastic to work in a technology start-up environment


Bring your experience, your talent, your creative energy, and meet a diverse group of people who work together and build software that aims for the cloud. We have a unique culture that is collaborative, customer centric, professional, and encourages hard work with a layer of fun that keeps us in balance. Join the team that makes a positive impact on the future of IT services automation… you’re going to love it! 

At BitTitan, Inc. we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we embrace it for the benefit of our employees, our partners, and our community. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and diversity.

title: ISG - Development of Renovation System
description:
One of the important aspects of HDB’s work lies in the management and maintenance of over 1 million flats. Part of this involves regulating the renovation works that take place in HDB flats to ensure that homeowners do not compromise the safety and engineering integrity of the supporting infrastructure during their home renovation works. To do this well, homeowners are required to engage contractors that are approved by HDB, and also apply for relevant renovation permits before proceeding with specific alteration works such as electrical extension/installation, and air-conditioning installation.

The processes of applying to be a Registered Contractor, submitting renovation applications, and the entire workflow from the evaluation of applications through to their approval have long been supported by an in-house developed application – Building Addition & Alteration System (BAAS). This application was built on Java EE and has been running on HDB’s on-premise datacentre since inception.

This internship project involves being attached to a Scrum team that is in charge of developing the new Renovation System that would serve to eventually replace BAAS. The Renovation System would be designed with a cloud-native architecture, leveraging serverless runtimes and containers as much as possible to afford higher degrees of scalability. The effort also aims to migrate the workflow into a microservice architecture supported by a lighter-weight Python/NodeJS/React stack.

Interns on this project are expected to fulfil the role as a Developer on the team, working with the Product Owner, ScrumMaster, and fellow Developers in delivering features of the Renovation System in an iterative fashion. They would have the chance to:

•	Experience what it is like working in a Scrum team;
•	Be exposed to DevSecOps practices and culture;
•	Learn about cloud-native design and application development; and
•	Have hands-on experience leveraging CI/CD tools for development automation.

Applicants should have a good grasp of web application development using Python, NodeJS, React, or any relevant languages/frameworks. They should also be adaptable and be eager to learn. Knowledge in cloud-based architecture and/or Scrum would be a bonus.

title: Front End Developer Intern
description:
WHO WE ARE

We believe digital transformation is delivered through designing exceptional customer experiences. We are passionate about understanding people and the opportunity they create. We use the power of design to solve problems that positively impact customers and businesses.

Collectively what we do could be called lots of different things but really, we’re a group of smart, creative people who deliver end-end solutions with data, strategy, design and technology. 

Our approach is simple. Identify the fundamental business problem, understand the customer, and design beyond digital re-invention. By doing so we help clients prepare today for the customer of tomorrow.  

At Profero you’ll enjoy working in an ego-less environment with people passionate about thinking, designing and building products and services that people find helpful, convenient and exceptional. 
 
THE ROLE

EXPECTATIONS

title: Research Analyst Intern
description:
The Company:
ShipsFocus is Asia’s first & only maritime venture studio. We are at the forefront of maritime commerce technology, creating solutions and startups in a fast-paced and progressive environment and solving real problems for the trillion-dollar maritime industry. ShipsFocus is committed to an employee-oriented, high performance culture that emphasizes empowerment, quality, continuous improvement, and the recruitment and on-going development of a superior workforce.

The Business Team:
Our Business Team includes highly skilled maritime veterans, shipping specialists and domain experts who make maritime commerce work. The team works closely with our Tech Team with a very clear roadmap in delivering of new solutions to the market place. We focus in innovation and its adoption of applications with a sustainable and scalable business model that generates recurring value.

The Role: 
• Reports to the Investment Manager (of our Maritime Fund)
• Provides research, extract and record data and information on tech startups, their products, and investment needs
• Researches, detects and presents analysis of startups, markets, including patterns and trends of thebusiness, valuations, models, etc.
• Present analysis and reports in easy to understand, succinct and rich-in-content manner

Analyst interns must have strong interpersonal skills and communication skills. They will in future communicate with people who work in a wide range of industries, and they will need to present their investment recommendations to the client. Research skills are crucial because they must complete thorough assessments of all relevant data in order to be able to reach conclusions about the potential success of different businesses. Decision-making skills are important because they must ultimately reach a conclusion about whether or not to recommend investing in a company. Time management and organizational skills are also important to meet investment deadlines and ensure that all relevant tasks are completed.

Job Requirements:
•	Proficient in Advanced Excel, SQL, Python preferred, with experience in working with unstructured data sets
•	Strong capabilities in logical thinking with attention to details, and is passionate about research and problem solving
•	Eager to learn and able to grasp concepts fast with a tremendously positive attitude

Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
• Gain tremendous knowledge about the maritime technology industry, the companies and products
• Learn real-life and practical skills that can apply in actual business requirements with real customers
• Acquire valuable experience in a vibrant maritime venture studio and in an agile development work process

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Zealys is a HR tech startup based in Singapore. We thrive to bring the best people experience to everyone. By building a smarter system to make every task simpler, integrate HR information seamlessly and intelligently.

People is our core. We focus on people and help companies to put people first. Our SaaS platform integrates personnel and payroll management. We will expand the modules in our platform to include leave management, claim application and attendance tracking by 2022, to provide a single holistic platform for HR management.

As our new colleague, you will

At Zealys, we value our interns by providing them valuable learning opportunities. You will gain real world exposure and knowledge on full software development cycle, from conception to deployment, at a startup environment. You will be working closely with our team of experienced developers and product owner to plan for new product features and bring them to fruition. You will have space and opportunity to contribute your ideas and skills, as well as building transferrable skills that you will be able to apply anywhere.

What You Will Learn

•	Collaborate with product owner, designer and development team to conceptualize and prototype new products from user’s perspective
•	Liaise with internal and external users in defining requirements, features and solutions
•	Analyse business or functional requirements to deliver artifacts and prepare detailed specification
•	Research and develop technical prototypes involving new products and features
•	Test the built features and ensure delivery of high-quality solutions

Who We Are Looking For

We especially value applicants who have/are:

•	Proficient in at least one programming language like C# or JavaScript
•	Knowledge of an UI framework e.g. ReactJs
•	Up to date with the latest technologies in web, Kubernetes and micro services
•	A team player who is passionate in technology and loves to share knowledge and ideas with your colleagues

•	Strong analytical skills and enjoy problem-solving

Why you will love working with us

•	Practical experience with wide variety of software engineering tasks

title: 11. IP3D - Research intern – Advanced 3D scanning, modelling and recognition
description:
Job Description:

Panasonic R&D Center Singapore (PRDCSG) is seeking software engineer for image processing and 3D team to research and develop advanced 3D scanning, modelling and Artificial Intelligence recognition solution. As part of Singapore’s smart nation development initiative, there is the desire to digitalize building information for asset management, facility maintenance and improve the productivity of construction. We are developing the technologies to achieve this target. In this programme, the student will investigate the advanced 3D scanning devices, e.g. Lidar, radar and depth sensors. He/she will use the state-of-the-art methods for 3D mapping, modelling and reconstruction. Based on the 3D data, the student will try to recognize the building structure like house floor map or the facility components like pipes and cables. The student will be involved in the POC development of PRDCSG building quality inspection platform.  

For more information, visit our website: https://research.sg.panasonic.com/ 


Other requirements (technical skills):

Along with a very enthusiastic team, the intern will be working on state-of-the-art mapping and localization algorithms using visual cameras and LiDAR sensors. The positioning information enables the robot navigation as well as the centralization and integration of the data captured by robot system. With further development, the technology also can be deployed for personal navigation via smartphone camera and sensor. The student will need to develop and optimize the software on robot or smartphone for speed and accuracy. The intern is required to assist with data collection, testing and analysis.

description:

The work includes interfacing sensors with edge devices such as IoT gateways, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, etc, and data communication over WiFi, 4G, BLE to form a connected IoT network with a cloud server back-end. You will have following responsibilities:

●    Analyze & understand project specifications for industrial applications.

●    Work on modern communication technologies (WiFi, 4G, BLE, NB-IoT, LoRaWAN etc.)
●    Test, debugging, document & troubleshoot IoT firmware, and embedded systems.
●    Coordinate with the back-end software team to achieve hardware-software interface over HTTP/MQTT.
●    Electronic product design and certification of the end-product.

Your mission
Our team will support the candidate by providing insight into the different types of IoT sensors and the interfacing protocols. We will also provide exposure to industrial projects and on-site deployment experience. Following is the learning outcome of this internship:

title: Inventory Optimization though Data Analytics
description:
Intern will support the project of Inventory Optimization though Data Analytics. The description of project as follow:

Background
Inventory Management Section (IMS) manages all stock items (i.e. spare parts) required for the maintenance of equipment by Engineering department within PSA Singapore premises. IMS manages the purchase of stock items on daily basis & also the storage of these stock items.

Objective / Problem Statement
One of the major roles of IMS is to minimize inventory holding value, while upholding the service level (i.e. availability of stock items) to Engineering department at the same time. This is the goal that IMS continue to explore through different means. 
Commencing with data analytics, IMS intends to understand the different nature of stock items by analysing various parameters (e.g. stock movement, commodity, stock age, turnover rate, equipment fleet supported etc.). These parameters shall provide insights for IMS in making decisions related to stock items, including but not limited to purchase & disposal. The ultimate goal of inventory optimization through data analytic is aimed to identify opportunities in reducing inventory holding value, through various purchase strategies designed for stocks of different nature.

General Business Requirements
To understand the different nature of stock items & develop relationships among these parameters. To reduce inventory holding value by formulating purchase strategies based on the understanding on nature of stock items, including but not limited to below areas of interest:
• Purchase cycle & frequency
• Purchase quantity
• Minimum stock holding quantity

Project Scope
• Inventory demand prediction & forecast model
• Inventory purchase cycle, frequency & quantity prediction model
• Verification & improvement on model accuracy
• Dashboard visualization of model output for quick decision making

Special Knowledge / Skills Required:
- Python programming language
- Data analytics
- Machine learning 
- Dashboard visualization (prefer Power BI)

title: Lightweight Object Detector for AIOT Applications
description:
Deep learning based object detection has achieved significant progress recently. However, the high prediction accuracy often comes at the expense of huge set of deep learning model parameters, large memory storage and high computational costs, which limits the direct deployment of these deep learning models on Internet-Of-Thing (IOT) edge computing devices with limited computing resources.

In this project, the intern will get involved in designing  lightweight yet accurate deep learning based vehicle and pedestrian detectors for next generation smart transportation applications. Deep neural network pruning technique will be employed to further reduce the computational complexity of the deep learning models without compromising the detection accuracy. The developed methods will be deployed on an edge device and field trial will be conducted inside NTU campus with real-life data to validate the proposed solution.
agencyAddress: 61 Nanyang Drive, #ABN-01b-14, Academic Building North, 637335, SINGAPORE
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Robust & lightweight vehicle tracking
description:
Edge Computing Platforms allow for on-site processing of the video data to realize real time, low cost and scalable solutions for traffic monitoring and surveillance. An example use case of such a solution is intelligent traffic lights at intersections: video feeds from traffic surveillance cameras is processed on-site to detect the presence of road users such as public buses or pedestrians and dynamically adjust traffic light timings in real-time. However, algorithms that achieve high accuracy for detection and tracking of road users, are also computationally complex and not suitable for the typically resource-constrained Edge Computing Platforms. 

In this project, a vehicle tracking pipeline will be developed that dynamically combines computer vision algorithms for detection and tracking with varying complexity based on scene conditions. For instance, low-complexity algorithms for detection (such as foreground detection) will be employed for light traffic conditions and more complex deep learning-based object detectors will be invoked only when necessary - e.g., in the presence of merges, or when new objects appear at frame boundaries. The pipeline will be developed using the widely adopted OpenCV library and evaluated on extensive video data collected from the NTU campus. It will be tested and optimised on state-of-the-art Edge Computing Platforms.

title: Off-Cycle Technology – Risk Assurance (Data Trust Solutions) Internship
description:
PwC is one of the leading professional services firms in Singapore and one of the largest in the world. At the Data Trust Services team, we believe in enhancing trust while maximising the value and potential of data. We are passionate about helping companies and decision makers utilise data to drive strategic and operational decisions, help organisations grow revenue, reduce cost, increase productivity and more.

We pride ourselves on our supportive team culture and diverse backgrounds. We strongly believe in the importance of potential and a desire to learn. As such it is important to us that you fit well with our team, have a strong desire to learn, develop your own skills and support and coach others.

Apply to join one of the fastest growing professional services Analytics teams in Singapore and you will have the opportunity to be exposed to a wide range of industries and clients, build trust in society through data, and work in diverse and collaborative teams that will support your learning and career growth.

We are looking for interns who can join us between Jan - Jun

Perform work across diverse industries and projects ranging from developing organisational strategies for analytics to building sophisticated data architectures and analytical models
Analyse and interpret large volumes of data from client data systems and external sources using proprietary and open source data tools, platforms and analytical tool kits

Deliver excellent client service and work from both the PwC Singapore office and at client sites

An analytical software (e.g. R, SAS)

A self-driven learner with the ability to quickly learn and apply new tools and techniques such as proprietary analytical software, data models and programming languages

A natural curiosity to identify, investigate and explain trends and patterns in data

A passion for Emerging Technologies related to Big Data, Machine Learning and AI

title: Off-Cycle Risk Assurance - Transformation Assurance Internship
description:
Transformation Assurance is one of the five “Operating Units” in Risk Assurance, which is the advisory arm under the Assurance “Line of Service” as part of the PwC Network in Singapore. Risk Assurance brings insights and independent assurance to provide an invaluable safeguard in today's complex operating environment. Risk Assurance works with clients in their boardrooms and their back offices, delivering business control to help them to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business from people to performance, systems to strategy, business plans to business resilience.

Transformation Assurance provides holistic supports to organisations that plan to or are undergoing transformations. Changes in the global economic social world order are accelerating the need to digitally transform. Businesses need to create a differentiated experience for their customers in the digital marketplace, but this comes with its own set of challenges: consistently driving innovation while meeting regulatory requirements, rethinking the supply chain strategy, identifying an optimal operating model, staying cost-efficient but also cutting edge - and challenging the norm to explore new ways of working. Transformation Assurance offers programme initiative advisory, programme assurance, readiness assessment, deep dive reviews and post-implementation reviews. 

We are looking for candidates for the internship from Jan - Jun 2022.
 
Skills and Responsibilities
As an Intern / Trainee, you will work with a team of problem solvers and Subject Matter Experts, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical skills. Attention to details. Validate data and analysis for accuracy and relevance.
Collaborate effectively with team members and external stakeholders. Able to build trusted relationships. 
Highly driven and motivated with a can-do attitude and ability to drive change in an organisation. Work with existing processes/systems whilst making constructive suggestions for improvements.
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner – both verbally and in writing.
Report to Managers, Directors and / or Partners. 
Follow risk management and compliance procedures.
Keep up-to-date with technical developments for business area.
Invite and provide evidence-based feedback in a timely and constructive manner.
Seek opportunities to learn about other cultures and other parts of the business across the Network of PwC firms.
Uphold the firm’s code of ethics and business conduct.

Requirements and Preferences:
Demonstrates abilities and/or a proven record of experience in working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment:
- Understanding and delivering tasks within an established work plan;
- Demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks;
- Seeking guidance, clarification, and feedback from team members proactively; 
- Communicating potential scheduling and other conflicts to supervisors;
- Participating in discussions and meetings actively, especially with external and senior stakeholders;
- Articulating ideas and structuring clear and concise written documents; and,
- Contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members.

Demonstrates keenness and abilities (if any) in utilising automation & digitisation tools, including but not limited to:
- Knowledge of new and existing technologies, along with experimenting with digitisation solutions;
- Comfortable working with large, complex data sets to build models and leveraging data visualisation tools to provide insights to stakeholders;

Preferred Qualifications: 
- Degree Preferred: Bachelor’s degree or higher
-  Preferred Fields of Study: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Accounting, Business Administration/Management, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Organizational Research, Psychology, Public Policy.

title: Testing Vulnerabilities and Security Threats on Developed AV Prototype
