title: NG-NOC Network Monitoring & Automation
description:
Next Generation NOC use an early warning system comprised of multiple “pattern sensors” that constantly monitor and analyze data in near real-time streams of incoming network and service data. These sensors run automated tasks and algorithms across the data to identify precursors of potential degradations and failures, such as shifts in traffic, capacity and utilization as well as changes in parameterization.

In this internship project, you will work alongside with a project team that consist of passionate network engineers to facilitate the developing of Next Generation NOC tools fo PSA with Big Data and automations. You will:
1. Gain good understanding of enterprise campus networks and how they support PSA critical 24x7 operations;
2. Acquire skills to effectively engage project stakeholders to uncover, measure and document the existing inefficiencies or missing puzzle pieces in managing the network infrastructure and its day to day operations; and
3. Learn how to perform in-depth analysis of problem statements for solutions development.


Deliverables: 
- Develop a dashboard that displays an overview of utilization heatmaps and health status of PSA operations critical network links using commercial products such as Micro Focus NNMi, Solarwinds and/or other opensource tools (eg. Cacti, weathermap, MRTG, etc)
- Enhance the effectiveness in utilizing network operations productivity tools such as Solarwinds NPM
- Enhance visibility and clarity of network system logs shown on operations dashboard so as to improve network operations productivity and efficiency.

Special Knowledge / Skills Required:
'- Basic knowledge of networking concepts such as OSI model, routing and switching.
- Basic knowledge Linux OS administration and protocols such as SNMP and Syslogs
- Development using REST APIs, Python
- Web programming - Apache, PHP, RRDTools
- Ansible

title: Machine-Learning based Attack & Defense methods for Wireless Security
description:
Wireless systems are vulnerable to various attacks, due to the shared and broadcast nature of wireless medium. To support both attack and defense strategies, Machine learning provides automated means to learn from and adapt to wireless communication characteristics.

1. Use Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to demonstrate DoS Attack and Defense,
respectively, i.e., Jamming & anti-Jamming at Physical, MAC layer.

2. Use Re-enforcement Learning and Nonparametric-Bayesian strategies to protect against Eavesdropping.

3. Use mixed machine-learning strategies to protect against spoofing with focus on improving precision of identification & detection, also decreasing the average error & false-alarm rate.

The above tasks require assisting the research team in constructing software simulation models as well hardware prototypes for demonstration to industrial partners.

title: Digital Data Analysis Improvement Project_JTDDA
description:
Modern manufacturing is no longer just about finding ways to operate faster while reducing expenses; it is also about doing so in a data-driven and intelligent way. With technologies such as cloud and data analytics, the vast quantities of data generated can be processed and translated into actionable insights to diagnose problems and identify opportunities for improvement. With machine learning, highly intelligent systems can assist the workforce in optimising processes, predicting equipment failures and changes in demand patterns. At their best, these intelligent systems can also autonomously make decisions and respond to changing internal and external business needs. 

An opportunity exists to enhance performance monitoring through development of interactive digital dashboards to trend key performance indicators (KPIs). Performance dashboards are used extensively during Tier review meetings; data displayed focuses on high level KPI’s for Tier 4 meetings, with associated drill-down data relevant to specific functions required at the lower level Tiers. It is therefore critical that dashboards offer a high level of connectivity and adaptability to enable their use across the tier meeting requirements.

The site goals are to “Improve the yield efficiency campaign over campaign”, to “improve cost of goods”, and to “make GSK a great place to work”.

As we drive in this direction and to assist the site achieve these goals, Data Platform and Data Intelligent Services platform were built by the IT and Advanced Manufacturing Technologies teams. These platforms are managed and used by IT, Data Engineers, Data Scientists/Analysts and intended to be accessible and user-friendly to the site employees so they can perform their own process investigations. 

Project scope:
For this project, you will be supporting the data scientists and working within the Data Analytics team to structure and manage historical operational data in a way that will help to build predictive models to solve pharmaceutical manufacturing problems. You will help compiling findings and recommendations into reports. You will need to have some basic skill set in using Python and / or Matlab (SQL is a plus).

You will also be using solution such as Power BI or other dashboarding tools to visualize new dashboard and / or migrating of existing dashboards to Power platform. You will incorporate the real-time monitoring & data analytics and upgrade these to obtain maximum benefit. All site KPI boards are in scope of digitalisation, including development of drill down screens to enhance inter tier data connectivity, adapted for functional needs and including integrated, automated data collection and analysis.
Project deliverables
Data Science
•	Develop the pipeline in the Data Intelligent Services platform to enable better handling of datasets and include new modes of analyses.
•	Participate in a process use case entailing working with chemists and engineers to understand the business requirement, creating predictive machine learning models, and developing recommendations to improve the manufacturing processes

Dashboarding
•	Create and deploy new standard performance board 
•	Migration of existing dashboard to Power platform
•	Development of performance monitoring dashboard template with automated data extraction and analysis.
o	Student will be accountable for working with key contacts from GPS and the functional lines to produce a standard dashboard template to collect and analyse KPI data.
•	Upgrade each function's dashboard.

Management Skills: You will also be given a chance to lead / assist the data scientist or project managers in the following:  
•	Project management of a use case or digital application project
•	Prepare  communication materials such as slides, videos, workday post (Similar to Facebook)
•	Organize communication sessions with the site users
•	Join and lead / participate in company social events eg Environmental Sustainability or Social Welfare related
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. and transcript with your application.

With machine learning, highly intelligent systems can assist the workforce in optimising processes, predicting equipment failures and changes in demand patterns. At their best, these intelligent systems can also autonomously make decisions and respond to changing internal and external business needs.

As a drive in making yield and processes more efficient and improving cost of goods, Data Platform and Data Intelligent Services platform were built by the IT and Advanced Manufacturing Technologies (AMT) teams in the Jurong New Product Introduction (NPI) site. title: Off-Cycle Technology - Risk Assurance (Financial Services) Internship
description:
Technology - Risk Assurance (Financial Services) Internship
Our Risk Assurance team helps clients to analyse, assess and address a wide range of risks by providing insights and assurance which is invaluable in today's high-risk business environment. 

We work with our clients to build trust across their digital/technology-enabled businesses and address areas such as the loss or misuse of important data, failure to react to changes in the market, implementing and reviewing systems or business processes and ensuring third-party providers are working as expected in managing and controlling their existing and future financial regulatory risk.

We are looking for candidates for the internship period from Jan - June 2022 (Off-cycle internship).
 
Responsibilities:

Will vary by role, but will include an element of:

Execute audits and assessments on cybersecurity, IT systems and infrastructure and processes  
Collaborate with stakeholders such as clients and managers to identify opportunities to improve their key controls across cybersecurity, business and technology processes 
Provide assurance and advisory related services through all major milestones of the sales and delivery lifecycles including identification, proposal development, planning, fieldwork, reporting and debrief processes
Work on specific projects to substantially improve and evolve the capability and quality of the processes, deliverables and thought leadership 
Provide coaching and/or conduct training to junior staff to develop communication, analytical and technical skills

Requirements:
Penultimate year students in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology (IT) or related disciplines with IT focus or experience in IT Audit and Risk/ Control experience
Demonstrated track record in leading engagements within a professional services or consulting environment, combined with ability to work in teams effectively
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good presentation skills, both oral and written
Able to work in a fast pace environment
Good analytical, organizational, and conceptual skills
Excellent soft skills and able to manage stakeholders across multiple disciplines
Excellent project management skills and a demonstrated ability to follow through and complete tasks within tight deadlines
Experience in management and/or assessment of adequacy of controls over technology activities at financial institutions is preferred. 
Familiar with regulatory requirements such as MAS Notices and Guidelines related to technology, cyber security and outsourcing risk management etc. is a plus
Experience in cybersecurity processes such as vulnerability and threat management, patch management and identity and access management is a plus
Ability to provide recommendations, approaches and good industry practices 
Experience in providing regular communication and preparing reports and presentations for clients and senior stakeholders
Good interpersonal skills to successfully interact with internal and external stakeholders such as clients, managers and team members
CISA, CISM, CISSP, PMP or other professional certification is preferred

description:

title: EnOS Platform Support Engineer Intern
description:
Job Description:
Work as a dynamic Engineer that ensures the availability and utility of software applications deployed on the EnOS platform. The job scope can involve application monitoring, responding to alerts, answering user queries, and working with the Development team to provide permanent fixes to issues. Since most of these applications are external facing, there is also a rising need to handle communications with external customers and partners. This role requires individuals to be comfortable with the responsibility of running the software used by the entire business. As your contribution and knowledge grows, your exposure to IOT fields and business domains will grow as well.

Roles & Responsibilities:
As a Support Engineer, the focus of the job scope is to support the team to ensure a stable, productive environment, and improve the operations process by documenting issues encountered.
•	Analyse issues encountered and provide viable workaround, if any. Scan through application log files to debug the issue encountered where applicable. 
•	Escalate issues with no viable workarounds 
•	Document operations tasks and processes with guidance from operations lead. 
•	Able to follow instructions from operations lead and perform simple troubleshooting.

Requirements:
•	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering 
•	Basic Java, Javascript, or Python developer skills 
•	Understanding of Unix shell script. Hands-on exposure in shell scripting may be required 
•	Able to analyse output from monitoring tools 
•	Problem solving mindset, able to work independently with minimal supervision 
•	Able to follow standard operating procedure (SOP) and trouble shooting guide

Preferred Skills:
•	Understand Containerized software deployment pattern (e.g. Kubernetes) 
•	Good communication skills, able to handle client and internal communication
•	Being able to speak, write and read Chinese is a bonus, as majority of Development and other backend support teams are Chinese speaking 
•	Understanding of IoT concept is a bonus 
•	Documentation skills – to track issue workarounds/resolutions and contribute to operations knowledge base 
•	Basic understanding of ITIL guidelines is a bonus

title: Root Cause Analysis of CVEs
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:
In the cybersecurity ecosystem, vulnerability researchers play a crucial role in discovering software vulnerabilities and disclosing them responsibly to software developers for fixes to be produced in a timely fashion. Researchers worldwide discover and submit bugs to database such as OSVDB, NIST's NVD etc. For obvious reasons, the bugs listed in the databases usually do not entail too much details.

To anyone aspiring to become vulnerability researchers, it is useful to study some of these reported vulnerabilities to understand how the vulnerabilities come about and can be exploited by malicious actors. Such efforts can go to a long way towards improving software development security.
- Interns will be tasked to perform root cause analysis on the CVE
- Interns are expected to reverse engineer binaries and perform source code auditing

Learning Points for Intern:
- Security research on vulnerabilities

Job Requirements:
- Knowledge and experience in Programming/Scripting (e.g. C, C++, Python, Java,PHP)
- Debugging Skills (e.g. winDbg, ollydbg, x64 debugger, GDB)
- Network analysis skills
- Reverse Engineering Skills
- Knowledge and experience with/writing Fuzzer
- Confident and able to work independently
- Possesses a strong sense of self-initiative and passion in his/her work
- A problem-solving mindset

title: Platform for Open Source InTelligence (POST)
description:
Description:
OSINT (a.k.a. Open Source Intelligence) is the practice of collecting information from published or otherwise publicly available sources. OSINT processes use advanced techniques to search through the vast haystack of visible data to find the needles for achieving the goals and learn information that many don't realise in public. Data is obtained legally and meets copyright requirements. The raw data collected is then analysed to help understand the information more clearly and derive intelligence. An OSINT platform could be used to support decision making, assess perceptions, forecast changes, and etc. 

Learning Points for Intern:
- Interns will get the opportunity to learn and explore the various advanced search tools to find useful online data and subsequently perform analysis to derive intelligence.
- These tools include OSINT image search, Search Engines, Fact Checkers, etc.
- Advanced Machine Learning/Deep Learning techniques will also be introduced to perform the analysis of the collected data.
- The project allows interns to build a platform through collation and synthesis of open source OSINT tools to analyse open domain data

Job Requirements:
- Strong Python programming skills
- Fundamental understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts and applications

title: Using Blockchain for Better Security
description:
1. Background: We are a tech innovation unit within a larger public security community passionate about creating software products that leverage the latest cloud and blockchain technologies to bring about digital transformation to better secure Singapore.

2. Objective: The technology in blockchain along with its intrinsic properties of being an incorruptible ledger provides us with the opportunity and potential to develop and deploy more secure distributed applications (dApps), that will open new discovery opportunities and drive innovation for the public security community.

Learning Points for Intern:
Guided by an experienced mentor, you will learn to design, develop, secure and test the fast-evolving blockchain cloud apps using micro-service architecture. You will learn to build automated unit test cases, to package and deploy software that are compact and flexible to continuously integrate and deliver new features to the users rapidly in a modern cloud platforms. By taking multiple small steps in an agile way, you can achieve the desired project outcomes that may seem daunting and challenging to you in the beginning. You will be assigned to work in one or more of the following projects:

- Digital ID Wallet: With the increase in popularity and complexity of web services, it is becoming ever more difficult to manage our digital identities. Currently, there is an over-reliance on existing centralised systems which are inherently prone to intrusions and insider attacks. We are exploring alternative digital identity management systems, which return control to the identity bearers and provide more convenient authentication processes compared to current day solutions. In this project, you will be working on distributed identity management systems as well as user authentication protocols to provide users easy access to our blockchain based dApps.

- Decentralised Social Media: Current centralised social media providers act as an intermediary between the users on their respective platforms. Besides collecting an overwhelming amount of private data for advertising revenues, they also have access to the users' uploaded photos, data and messages (potentially to their benefits), leaving users with little control over their own data. Hence, blockchain is introduced, to by-pass untrusted third party intermediaries and rogue insider admins. In this project, you will be working on such truly peer-to-peer social media dApp

- Asset Tokenisation: The growing popularity of Asset Tokenisation bridges the gap between traditional and newer financial markets. Real life tangible and intangible assets can be converted into digital tokens governed by smart contracts that exist across a distributed, decentralised blockchain network. The smart contract controls the execution of transactions which are trackable and verifiable. In this project, you will be working on self-executing smart contracts binded with the terms of the agreements of transactions being written into lines of code. 

Knowledge/Skills Preferred: To set you up for success, we will revise and walk-through with you the prerequisite skills and knowledge during the on-boarding stage.
- Fluent in the essential front-end web development languages, i.e., HTML5, CSS and JavaScript.
- Practical hands-on experience in at least one web development framework, preferably React, Node and Typescript.
- Familiar with agile software engineering practices and test-driven development processes, such as UML design and unit testing
- Working knowledge of Blockchain and Smart Contracts will be advantageous
- Effective communicator and comfortable with conducting presentations and demonstrations to management
- Must be Singapore citizens

title: Driving Innovation with Cloud AI
description:
Project Description
1. Background: We are a tech innovation unit within a larger public security community passionate about creating software products that leverage the latest cloud and blockchain technologies to bring about digital transformation to better secure Singapore. 
2. Objective: AI is making it easier for people to do things everyday, whether it is transcribing a video, translating an article or identifying objects in the video. AI also provides new ways of looking at existing problems, from rethinking security practices to advancing new discoveries. To this end, we aim to prototype and build Cloud AI applications to open new discovery opportunities and drive innovation for the public security community.

Learning Points for Intern:
Guided by an experienced mentor, you will learn to design, develop, secure and test the fast-evolving blockchain cloud AI apps using micro-service architecture. You will build automated unit test cases, to package and deploy software with bare minimal dependencies in Docker containers, which are compact and flexible to continuous integrate and deliver new features to the users rapidly in a modern cloud platforms. By taking multiple small steps in an agile way, you can achieve the desired project outcomes that may seem daunting and challenging to you in the beginning. - Data track: Web scraping and collecting of semi-structured and unstructured data . Construct and refine processing pipelines to improve workflows and efficiency
- UI track: Design and develop front-end UI applications to facilitate our users to interact with our AI models and APIs
- API Track: Construct backend API services with CI/CD to ensure that our front-end apps can send and receive timely and accurate information

Knowledge/Skills Preferred:

title: Malware Analysis - What's next?
description:
Description:
Malware analysis is a technically challenging field. It requires analysts to be able to break down malware into low-level code which then need to be deciphered in order to determine the purpose, intent and capability of the malware. 

Innovation abounds in the field - academia is actively tackling the problems faced by malware analysts, and industry develops new technology that makes malware analysts' lives easier. 

For this project, successful interns will be introduced to the world of malware analysis, and help our malware analysts research and develop solutions to solve real-world malware analysis problems. These can include improving malware analysis processes, and/or identifying and categorising families of malware. 

Students would be tasked with one or more of the following: 
- Explore and evaluate new technology to assess their utility towards addressing malware analysis challenges
-Develop automation tools via API programming to streamline compilation of data from disparate malware analysis tools
- Apply data science skills including machine learning towards malware analysis 
- Develop solutions that can circumvent anti-analysis techniques employed by malware authors
- Examine the program compilation process to identify unique attributes which can aid malware analysis efforts
- A solution or end product that could be integrated into the existing analysis framework t enhance detection and analysis capabilities

Learning Points for Intern: 
- Work alongside experienced malware analysts who are passionate about nurturing the next generation of malware analysts
- An opportunity to exercise your creativity in designing solutions in a multitude of different areas of interest
- Experience the challenges and constraints faced by malware analysts

Requirements: 
-Programming/ Scripting knowledge, especially in Python 
-Knowledge/ experience in data science including machine learning could be advantageous
- Preferably with understanding of/ experience in malware analysis 
- Confident and able to work independently
- Possesses a strong sense of self- initiative and passion in his/ her work 
- A problem-solving mindset
- Presentation skill

title: Machine Learning for Network Analysis
description:
Description: 
The freedom and convenience provided by the Internet is double-edged. Not only has it brought about new possibilities for humanity, the same platform has also spawned various threats affecting our way of life. Advanced adversaries pose a major threat to both private and public entities with the potential to cause grave damage primarily through the exfiltration of privileged information. 

Malicious activities manifest themselves in various manners and Locard's exchange principle reminds us that any activity will leave behind traces. These can be found within compromised hosts, or across networks. While there are established means to identify malicious traffic across a network is non-trivial as one needs to sift out malicious traffic amongst a large volume of benign traffic, especially with the presence of inconspicuous and persistent adversaries. This project will require students to research and develop a tool that will improve the analysis of Network Packet capture (PCAP) files through the use of Machine Learning (ML). Students would be able to gain useful knowledge and skillsets in analysing PCAPs, extracting valuable insights and identifying threats in the cyberspace. The project will also be an opportunity for students to have a multidisciplinary experience by applying data analytics in the realm of cybersecurity. 

Students would be tasked with one or more of the following: 
- Devise means to collect and build up a substantial dataset of labelled data (eg. malicious an benign traffic) for subsequent model training purposes
- Feature Engineering to extract indicators of malicious activities like period beaconing, bulk exfiltration and other anomalies. 
- Develop supervised models to classify malicious network traffic
- Utilise unsupervised machine learning techniques to derive insights in network data
- Design and develop a system to ingest and process PCAP files to extract relevant features

Learning Points for Intern: 
- Work alongside cyber intelligence professional
- An opportunity to exercise your creativity in designing solutions in a multitude of different areas of interest 
- Experience the challenges and constraints faced by cyber intelligence professionals when tackling threats faced by the real world

Requirements: 
- Applicants should have experience in programming, especially in Python
- Knowledge of network architectures and protocols and/or strong foundation in statistics o machine learning would be preferred
- Interest in cybersecurity will be advantageous but not mandatory
- Confident and able to work independently 
- Possesses a strong sense of self-initiative and passion in his/her work 
-  A problem -solving mindset
- Presentation skill

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Vulcan-AI is an enterprise AI solution provider that helps enterprises do more with less. Better outcomes, with lesser resources and carbon footprint. We build AI to better manage the Internet of Things (IoT) and power responsible enterprises.

We build intelligent applications that incorporate industry, functional processes and engineering know-how into AI applications that can be deployed >10X faster than typical consulting engagements. 

Our products are elegantly and beautifully designed not just on the outside, but also on the inside, creating a User Experience that both Users and Enterprises love.

Our goal is to democratize AI and make it easily accessible to our clients at a fraction of the cost and a faster time to market compared to current approaches. Our team works on cutting edge tools and technologies related to artificial intelligence and IoT. We offer a fun environment where you are an inventor at our AI & IOT garage where the digital and physical world come together to create new solutions / products. 

At Vulcan AI you’ll work with a team of people who are passionate about AI, IoT, Big Data and Design and love their respective crafts. The founding members are leaders from Accenture and EY where they incubated and scaled AI practices. The Management Team has a successful track record of delivering successful AI and IoT projects across APAC and building analytics business that were very successful commercially. Our AI team members have several research papers and patents in the field. You will be working with, and learning from the best.

As an Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for ideating, designing, developing and deploying cutting edge Applied Intelligence full stack applications and solutions that help industrial businesses drive digital transformation.

title: MITRE Att&ck: Attribution and Investigation Platform
description:
Project Description:
MITRE ATT&CK is a knowledge base of adversary tactics and techniques based on real-world observations. You will be working alongside Cyber Intelligence professionals to learn about the different tactics and techniques used by adversaries through online research. Enhance the ongoing development of an attribution and investigation platform, and come up with improved algorithms to identify and correlate various tactics and techniques between adversaries to facilitate ongoing attribution and investigations.

Students would be tasked with one or more of the following:
- Research on MITRE ATT& and other related framework that can aid in Cyber Investigation and attribution
- Enhance development of the existing platform to include additional features
- Develop new or improve on existing algorithms to enhance attribution accuracy
- Creation of an API to convert existing data set to integrate with other systems

What you can expect from this internship:
- Learn about the MITRE ATT&CK framework, various tactics and techniques used in the real-world adversaries
- Pick up various Cyber Threat Intelligence and Analysis knowledge, tools and skillset
- Work alongside Cyber Intelligence professionals to enhance a tool to aid in real-world Cyber Threat attribution and investigation

Job Requirements:
Applicants should have experience in programming, especially in Python.
- Knowledge of architecture and protocols and/or a strong foundation in statistics or machine learning would be preferred
- Interest in cybersecurity will be advantageous but not mandatory
- Confident and able to work independently
- Possesses a strong sense of self-initiative and passion in his/her work
- A problem-solving mindset
- Presentation skill

title: VISA Software Engineer Semester Internship
description:
Due to COVID-19 travel and entry restrictions, this year’s Internship Program is only available to candidates with the right to work in Singapore. We will review and adjust this approach as appropriate for future programs.

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description:

The Visa Internship Program is the biggest step you can take to joining our Revolution of Payments Innovation. You will take on meaningful work, get executive exposure, engage in out-of-the-box problem solving, and participate in social and community service activities. From technology to business, we are looking for people who can innovate, collaborate and drive Visa into the next era of an already rapidly-evolving digital market place. If you’re up for the challenge, please consider joining our team.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
• Investigate, troubleshoot and monitor critical products. This will also include end to end application support, engaging customers and business, analyzing functional and technical in-depth solutions.
• Work closely with the corresponding development teams in terms of bug fixing and suggesting new features and enhancements based on live issues.
• Implementation of one or more phases of software development lifecycle, from Design, Build & Code, Test, Security, and Deployment.
• Gain understanding of Object-Oriented Analysis & Design (OOAD), Microservice architectures and nuances of multi-threaded programming
• Adopt TDD and BDD practices
• Create unit and system test cases using industry standard test frameworks such as CppUnit and JUnit
• Drive and increase automation on CI/CD pipelines
• Design and develop test automation framework compatible with current application
• Design and implement manual and automated test cases utilizing UFT, Selenium, TestNG and RestAssured
• Support overall testing lifecycle (upstream and downstream) as part of the testing team assigned to development and integration projects
• Ensures overall quality standards are incorporated into test plans
• Provide ideas and develop tools that will ease the day today activities of the team.
• Dive deep and understand every issue occurred and own them completely for end to end closure.
• You will be coding in various programming and scripting languages (e.g. Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, etc.) and work with open source cutting edge software to implement projects or part of projects

The different Visa Technology teams you will have the opportunity to be part of are the following:

-Digital and Developer Platform: Digital and Developer Platform (DDP) develops and manages platform-oriented technology to advance the global growth of digital commerce and the mobilization of payments. Pairing a customer-first approach and relentless product innovation, we build the underlying technologies that enhance value propositions for Visa cardholders and business partners around the world.

-Network Processing: This is the team behind VisaNet, the payments network that connects consumers and merchants with financial institutions. The team strives to maintain quality through high-availability and high volume to enable industry collaboration and innovation today and tomorrow.

-Data Product Development: Visa's position as the global leader in electronic payments enables us to collect and analyze a rich trove of data. Our team enables Visa to tell our data story through business intelligence and develop innovative data-driven products.

-Issuer Processing: Our Issuer Processing platform processes over half of all Visa Debit transactions and is the largest single prepaid processing platform for Visa prepaid transactions in the U.S. The team also partners with third-party companies outside of the U.S. to deliver value-added services through Visa-owned assets.

-Operations + Infrastructure: Operations & Infrastructure builds, operates and maintains best-in-class IT infrastructure services that are secure, scalable, and continuously available.

title: Drone Technology and Applications Development
description:
DSTA is a top-notch technology organisation that drives innovation and delivers state-of-the-art capabilities to make the SAF a formidable fighting force. Our engineers and IT professionals harness multidisciplinary expertise to equip our soldiers with advanced systems to defend Singapore. We also contribute our technological expertise to support national-level developments.

With an internship in DSTA, you can look forward to gain an immersive experience with hands-on opportunities in the exciting and multidisciplinary work in engineering, infocomm technology and cybersecurity. You will be guided under the mentorship of our dedicated engineers with cutting-edge technologies and experience what it is like working at the forefront of defence science and technology.  
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Project scope:

Drones are getting increasingly common in consumer, commercial and industrial spaces. The technology is getting cheaper, smarter and ever more customisable. This gives rise to new application areas for drones.

This project aims to exploit the customisability of industrial and consumer-grade drones for search and rescue operations. It also includes the development of logic for perception, localisation, drone behaviours and control. The development will be on a simulation environment or drone platforms such as Unity,  Gazebo, Pixhawk or drones with SDK support.

The learning outcomes are, Command, Control and Communication (C3) applications developments using drone, simulation and computer vision technologies as well as verification and validation processes.

The student will be doing the internship with DSTA C3 Development Programme Centre.

Deliverables: Development of or enhancement to a prototype and a report.

Our Deals services span across the entire deal continuum, from strategy formulation to deal origination, transaction support and finance raising, through to post deal integration and exit. Our services cover M&A, Infrastructure and Distressed sectors. We consistently lead the league tables for mid-market deals in Asia Pacific, and also received various accolades on infrastructure project finance and transaction support services.

We are looking for candidates to join us for our off-cycle internship from January to June 2022 (6 months).

Responsibilities: 

Working as part of a multi-disciplinary team in buy-side and sell-side transaction advisory engagements, providing due diligence support and post deal assistance to major corporate, MNC and private equity clients.
You will learn how to deal with large volume business data, including performing data extraction, transformation and data visualization from a merger and acquisition prospective by utilizing data analytics tools.
Analyse business and financial data to identify historical trends and potential risks under the guidance of senior team members
Assist in preparing reports and schedules that will be delivered to clients
Perform industry and company research utilizing online tools and publicly available information
You are also expected to support senior team members in developing and marketing new products or service offerings.

Requirements:

Degree in Accountancy (+ data analytics) from local and overseas universities
Knowledge of power query, power pivot or Alteryx is a plus
Good track record of academic achievements
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Strong ability to work independently and effectively in a deadline-driven environment, while maintain quality at all times
Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Team player and keen learner

What we offer:

Opportunity to work for an impressive array of leading companies, with broad exposure to a variety of industries and assignments
Opportunity to work with fast paced and innovative environment along with a group of world-class and entrepreneurial professionals
Accreditation with PwC DDA badges after completing a full 2 years program

Application Deadline: 3 September 2021
agencyAddress: #12-00 / 7 Straits View, Marina One East Tower, SINGAPORE, 018936, SINGAPORE

title: Global Structuring Transfer Pricing Internship
description:
Our Global Structuring practice focuses on the complex cross-border and transactional aspects of global tax advice. The team comprises experienced specialists in mergers and acquisitions, transfer pricing and tax efficient international business structuring. 

As professional advisors, our well-known clients require us to apply in-depth business, finance and tax knowledge to solve difficult multi-disciplinary and multi-territory problems on dynamic and high profile projects. The nature of our advice is fast-paced and high pressured, but also extremely rewarding for those who thrive in such a culture.

We are looking for candidates to join us for our off-cycle internship from January to June 2022 (6 months).

Responsibilities: 

You will assist the Seniors and/or Managers on tax matters related to mergers and acquisitions, transfer pricing, and tax efficient international business structuring. You will also be involved in benchmarking studies to derive a comparable price and creating adequate transfer pricing documentation.

Requirements: 
 
Accountancy, Business, Economics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or Law students from reputable local and overseas universities
Are keen to develop themselves in the profession
Are highly motivated, enthusiastic, confident and creative
Have a good co-curricular activities record
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills
Are service-oriented and committed to teamwork and excellence

title: Cybersecurity Testing (Intern)
description:
You will assume an exciting role delving into the functionality of cybersecurity products. You will gain a comprehensive understanding of international standards and certification process, particularly in IEC 62443, that enables you to perform testing on cybersecurity products. Besides, you will undergo on-the-job training and gain experiences interacting with clients and colleagues from various departments. 

Key Responsibilities:
- Conduct testing on cybersecurity products (e.g. IOT products), including penetration test
- Derive conclusions from testing results relating to functionality & security
- Perform product development lifecycle analysis
- Utilize tools to conduct software vulnerability assessment
- Develop testing specifications and methodology based on industrial standards
- Perform actual test setup and prepare test reports
- Contribute to as part of the team responsible for business and customers

Key Requirements:
- Currently pursuing a Degree in Computer Engineering or Computing in Information Security
- Result and service-oriented individual who possesses initiative, good written and verbal communication skills 
- A proactive team player with the ability to work independently in challenging projects and timelines 
- Enthusiastic and resourceful with a "can-do" attitude

title: Tax - Knowledge, Analytics and Solutions Internship
description:
The Tax Knowledge, Analytics and Solutions (KAS) department, within our Tax Risk & Quality Services is responsible for capturing, developing and communicating essential information to PwC’s Tax Practice. We collaborate with other PwC teams to implement digital tax solutions and help our clients use the guidance process to facilitate transactions, minimise compliance burdens, and prevent or resolve tax disputes. We also work with government agencies on guidance related to tax regulations, revenue rulings and industry practices on tax matters.

An internship with KAS will provide you with the opportunity to be involved with the digitisation and transformation of knowledge management (KM), gain exposure to various types of tax processes and find out more on what a career in Tax entails.  

We are looking for candidates to join us for our off-cycle internship from January to June 2022 (6 months).

Responsibilities:
Assist in KM digitisation and data analytics projects
Assist in the upkeep of the KM databases and ensuring that they are up to date

title: Network Information Security Internship
description:
PwC is driving major change across information and cyber security by building a centralized model to provide security services across the entire network of member firms.
 
Mandated at the network level, Network Information Security (NIS) operates outside Information Technology (IT) and is responsible for this major program initiative, from definition of the security strategy to the execution of the global Cyber Readiness Program, moving from local to globally-provided services.
 
Our mission is to identify, control, and reduce the attack surface across the network of member firms while increasing our adversaries’ cost of attack.
 
In order to deliver the Cyber Readiness Program, the NIS team is structured into the following Pillars:
 
Information Security Risk and Compliance (ISRC)
Chief Information Security Office (CISO)
Security Architecture, Engineering, Innovation and Transformation (SAEIT)
Cyber Security Services
Strategy and Alliances
Chief of Staff
 
NIS is redefining cyber security on a global scale at PwC. Our mission protects 223,000 PwC members across 157 member firms worldwide, as well as our global clients.
 
If you are seeking an exciting career with the scope to grow your cyber security skills through major change on a global scale, then NIS will empower you to do so.

We are looking for candidates to join us for our off-cycle internship from January to June 2022 (6 months).

Scope of Responsibility:    
 
Conduct analysis of member firm needs in order to make appropriate decisions for the implementation of NIS global security strategy;
Engage with member firm stakeholders to assess security threats/vulnerabilities and manage business risk;
Facilitate member firm support from Security Architecture, Engineering, Innovation, and Transformation (SAEIT) and Cyber Security Service Management throughout the NIS service lifecycle;
Assess service availability, adoption rates, and maturity to manage risk to business programs and processes;
Govern member firms for compliance with PwC’s Information Security Policy (ISP) and legal/regulatory frameworks; and
Engage with Global IT and Applications to review security controls against information security policy
 
Strategic and Technical Orientation / Job Content:  
 
Individuals selected for this role are expected to have both extensive knowledge and managerial know-how related to the following aspects :

Open to students from any disciplines of studies
Interest in Cybersecurity
Good to have knowledge of Excel
Diligent and willing to learn as role provides on the job learning 
Good written and communication skills
Meticulous and possesses an eye for details
Experience managing multi-function relationships throughout major transformation;
Understanding of security technology;
Experience in a role balanced between business stakeholders and a central service organization;
Navigating a multifaceted, matrix organization; and
Collaborating with  multiple stakeholders across functional and technical skill sets
 
Application Deadline: 3 September 2021

title: Software Engineering Analyst (LOA Internship)
description:
Helicap is hiring interns for its Credit Fund and Investment Deal Platform in its Singapore office. 

Website: https://www.heli-cap.com, https://www.arcorcapital.com/, https://www.33-capital.com

Helicap is one of Asia's fastest-growing Fintech-enabled firms specializing in the alternative lending space in Southeast Asia and Australia. Helicap uses its proprietary credit scoring technology to analyse and assess data from origination platforms to address a $500 billion market opportunity. Our goal is to fill a credit gap and enable financial access to over 300 million unbanked and under-served people through our partnerships with a curated list of 300 FinTech platform partners. 

We work closely with Family Offices, HNWIs, Impact Funds, and Institutional Investors. Established in 2018, our investors include Credit Saison, East Ventures, Soilbuild Group, and senior executives from Temasek, GIC, Morgan Stanley, and Blackrock. 

Helicap is based out of Singapore with subsidiaries licensed or registered by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS):
- Helicap Investments; RFMC registered with MAS 
- Arcor Capital; CMS License for Dealing in Securities by MAS. 

https://kr-asia.com/more-than-a-lender-helicap-crunches-credit-data-startup-stories https://kr-asia.com/singaporean-fintech-helicap-bags-usd-10-million-in-saison-capital-led-series-a-round

Duration
LOA Software Engineering Analyst Internship 2022, with a potential of conversion.
Candidates will be given a stipend, meal allowances as well as transport allowance when required.

Job Description
Our Tech Team is building cloud-native Deep-Data Analytics & Investment Management Platforms using cutting-edge, modern Tech Stack. 

As a Tech team Intern, you would get the opportunity to work directly with CTO & Tech Leads and get excellent exposure to end-to-end SDLC, from capturing requirements to design, development, testing, deployment, and some of the Tech Risk & Cyber-Security Implementations. 

Key Responsibilities that you may get engaged in could be: 
• Platform Build-out & Maintenance – Frontend, Backend, Automated Testing, Cloud Deployment Automations 
• Roll-out of various Workplace Technologies 
• Implementation of Tech Risk & Cyber-Security measures

Skills Sets and Requirements:
• Strong interest in Coding & Software Development 
• Have some prior knowledge/experience on one or more of these Technologies 
o Backend - Golang, Java, REST 
o Frontend – React.js, Material-UI, Node.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS 
o Databases – MongoDB, PostgreSQL 
• Ambitious, entrepreneurial, and enjoys startup culture 
• Open-minded, curious, and willing to learn 
• Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
applicationInstructions: Interested candidates can send their resumes to hiring@heli-cap.com before 1st Oct with the subject title “LOA_SoftwareEngineering_Internship_2022_FirstName_LastName”. Applications will be conducted on a rolling basis.

title: DevOps Engineer Intern
description:
Project Description: 
The DevOps Engineer Intern will report directly to the DevOps Engineering Manager/Staff Engineer and will be part of the Global Product DevOps team. He/She will have the chance to be involved in the development of DevOps tools & pipelines and work in a team with various stakeholders including software developers, product managers and fellow Sr. DevOps engineers. The successful candidate will also experience working together with the broader DevOps team in our headquarters, located in San Diego, US.

Roles and Responsibilities: 
•	Work as part of DevOps team to maintain and extend codebase for DevOps solutions for SaaS genomic application extending the capability, improving robustness and quality, and optimizing for performance
•	Develop solutions to drive optimization of cloud operations around cost management, time to market, security and privacy, and delivery of worldwide capability 
•	Apply state of the art cloud best practices 
•	Troubleshoot and resolve continuous integration/continuous deployment defects
•	Contribute to DevOps design reviews and code reviews
•	Learn and have fun!

Qualifications and Requirements: 
•	Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate, master’s or PhD program, ideally in Computer Sciences or Engineering
•	Competent in at least one software programming language including Java, Perl or Python
•	Understanding design patterns is a plus
•	Experience in extracurricular activities such as hackathon, open source projects is a big plus
•	A passion to apply modern cloud computing to the transformation of human health with genomics

Learning Objectives: 
This internship opportunity aims to provide students whose interests and directions lie beyond research in an academic environment, with practical experience of how they can continue to apply and leverage on the knowledge they have acquired in a different role. 

The goals are to help the student achieve the following learning objectives:

•	Real-life experience of working within a highly-regulated global manufacturing/business environment
•	Develop an understanding of DevOps processes and industry best practices
•	Opportunity to apply actual learning to different areas of work
•	Develop strong interpersonal and communication skills

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title:  Data Science Intern
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:
DSBJ is a leading worldwide technology partner providing critical components for IoT intelligence, with a special focus on Telecommunication Equipment and Metal Precision, LED technologies and Interconnect solutions. Technological innovation is in the DNA of entire organization and is also the cornerstone of DSBJ’s success. With cutting-edge production facilities and advanced technology, we constantly deliver state-of-the-art products and quality services. Towards this, DSBJ has established the data analytics COE to fully incorporate Big data and Artificial Intelligence into a strategic roadmap and enable digital transformation and smart manufacturing initiatives.

The Data Science Intern will work with an experienced Data Scientist Lead to explore advanced analytics opportunities and build prototype solutions to address the specific business problems. You will be working alongside bright minds across big data, software engineering and data science, and also be involved in research & development of cutting-edge data & analytics techniques to support specific business requirements and products. Your duties and responsibilities include:

•	Perform EDA using SQL and Python/R (or other script language)
•	Build ML/AI prototype models that result in data-driven predictability to improve decision-making capabilities.
•	Collaborate with data scientist lead to provide statistics or business analysis that can help to drive data insights. 
•	Perform progress checks, solution review and documentation on the regular basis.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Cybersecurity Intern
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:

Internet-of-Things is a predominant technology trend worldwide. IoT integrates a variety of devices into networks to provide advanced and intelligent services. On the other hand, IoT also increases the cyber-attack interfaces, especially for viruses. However, some legacy devices do not have the capabilities to install or patch the antivirus software timely. In addition, in the real scenario, there is a delay to detect viruses and there is another delay to kill viruses. The project will research on the efficient technologies to automatically detect viruses and deploy the best practice with the best technology to kill the viruses timely in DSBJ cybersecurity R&D platform. 

DSBJ is a leading worldwide technology partner providing critical components for IoT intelligence, with a special focus on Telecommunication Equipment and Metal Precision, LED technologies and Interconnect solutions. The student in this project will have an opportunity to conduct useful research and gain hands-on experience based on the DSBJ industrial environment requirements. Your duties and responsibilities include:

•	Research on the best technologies for automatic virus detection.
•	Deploy the best practice with the best technology to detect and kill viruses.
•	Conduce experiments and evaluate performances. 
•	Perform progress check, solution review and documentation on the regular basis.
•	Submit a final technical report and source codes.

Training Location, if differ from company address:

11 Bishan Street 21 #03-01 Singapore 573943 (same as company address)

title: [Internship] Trustworthy AI
description:
The growing adoption of AI to augment a human decision-making or to autonomously make a decision have made regulators and consumers more sensitive towards the trustworthiness of AI systems.  IMDA’s vision is that organisations using AI in decision-making should ensure that the decision-making process should be explainable, transparent and fair; and that AI solutions should be human-centric.  

The T2PO team of IMDA is looking for an intern to join us as we explore and develop technical tools and methodologies to test and validate the trustworthiness of AI.

Responsibilities
•	Support the design and development of
o	POCs and methodology for technical testing of AI explainability, fairness, repeatability/reproducibility and/or robustness
o	Visualisation to represent testing results in a manner that non-technical people can understand
•	Support the implement of software codes and modules to enable automation of data extraction, data transformation and test execution
•	Conduct desktop studies of AI testing and auditing landscape, technology tools and solutions
•	Conduct evaluation and exploration of open-source AI testing tools
•	Write and maintain technical documentation (e.g. software installation/configuration guides, use cases, AI testing procedures.)

Skills
•	Passionate in technology, with strong interest in learning and understanding AI governance and testing
•	Good foundation in software engineering and software development
•	Proficient in programming languages such as Python, R and the relevant data science and machine learning libraries
•	Knowledge in foundational AI/ML concepts and/or Statistics will be an advantage
•	Experience and/or interest in with some form of visualization tools would be a plus
•	Must be a team player, who is inquisitive and independent, with strong analytical and communications skills
agencyAddress: 10 Pasir Panjang Road #03-01 Mapletree Business City, SINGAPORE, 117438, SINGAPORE
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: [Internship] Privacy-Preserving Technologies
description:
Privacy-Preserving Technologies (PPT) such as fully homomorphic encryption, differential privacy and secured multiple party computation are emerging computation techniques that have transformative potential.  IMDA believes that PPT will enable organisations to derive richer and deeper insights from sensitive datasets while protecting the underlying data and preserving data privacy.

The T2PO team of IMDA is looking for an intern to join us as we explore these technologies and co-develop POCs and use cases to enable trusted analysis that can demonstrate business value.

Responsibilities

•	Support the design, development and implementation of POCs and algorithmic approaches using Privacy Preserving Technologies (e.g. differential privacy, homomorphic encryption) to enable trusted analysis
•	Conduct desktop studies of privacy preserving technologies landscape, open source tools
•	Conduct evaluation and exploration of open-source privacy preserving tools (e.g. Google Full HE) to understand performance, applications and gap(s)
•	Write and maintain technical documentation (e.g. software installation/configuration guides, reference architectures for different use cases.)

Skills
•	Passionate in technology, with strong interest in learning and understanding data security and emerging technologies such as Privacy Preserving Computation
•	Good foundation in software engineering and software development
•	Proficient in programming languages such as C/C++, Python
•	Knowledge in logic gates operations, cryptography and data security will be an advantage
•	Experience and/or interest in frontend development such as .NET, web application development would be a plus
•	Must be a team player, who is inquisitive and independent, with strong analytical and communications skills

title: [Internship] Use Case Network Performance Characterisation
description:
As use cases advances, the dependency on comms and connectivity also increases. Understanding the network performance requirements of these use cases become key to ensure network(s) selected or designed, is able to meet the use case demands, whether they are Wi-Fi, 5G or other technologies. Characterising network performance has to move beyond “Mbps required” , “round trip latencies”, etc. ,  into areas such as payload size and variability, effects of transmission intervals, effects of multiple data streams, effects on scalability etc. Example use cases include low latency video streaming, augmented reality, synchronous interactive audio, automated systems, etc. 
The C2PO team of IMDA is looking for an intern to join us as we profile network performance requirements of use cases, to enable these use cases to be deployed in actual live scenarios.

Responsibilities
•	Conducting desktop research on the network performance requirements of different use cases
•	Design and conduct tests/experiments to determine and/or validate the network performance requirements of identified use cases 
•	Analyse test results to improve understanding, refine hypothesis, etc. of the demands of identified use cases

Skills
•	Passionate in technology, with strong interest in learning and understanding how comms and connectivity are designed and used by different use cases
•	Good foundation in software engineering and networking
•	Knowledge in network/application traffic profiling will be an advantage
•	Must be a team player, who is inquisitive and independent, with strong analytical and communications skills

title: [Internship] DevSecOps Engineer
description:
DevOps has become a standard set of practices for software development and IT operations, to deliver software of high quality and at shorter release cycles.  DevSecOps is a more recent evolution of the DevOps practice, where the aim is to integrate security practices as early as possible into the software development lifecycle in order to produce secure software products.  Together with DevSecOps, the MLOps (Machine Learning Ops) is a related discipline that embraces the DevSecOps methodologies and tooling to ingest, train, deploy and monitor machine learning models.
The AIPO Engineering team of IMDA is looking for interns interested in DevSecOps to join us as we explore and develop technical tools and methodologies to improve the existing DevSecOps and MLOps automation pipelines that are used by the software development teams in AIPO Engineering.

Responsibilities

•	Support the design, development and adoption of DevSecOps and MLOps methodologies and tools for 
o	Automating the software build, test and deploy pipeline for a larger set of software technology stacks
o	Automating security scanning and penetration tests as part of the release automation pipeline
•	Support project teams in implementing the DevSecOps and MLOps automation for the software built by the project teams
•	Conduct evaluation and exploration of open-source frameworks and libraries for continuous improvement of the DevSecOps and MLOps processes
•	Develop software templates which include CI/CD pipeline-as-code for multiple technology stacks as reference examples
•	Write and maintain technical documentation (e.g. software installation/configuration, step-by-step guides, use cases and testing procedures) for the DevSecOps and MLOps tools and processes

Skills
•	Proficient in one or more of the following programming languages: Javascript, Typescript, Python, Java, C# 
•	Strong interest in CI/CD automation, with strong interest in picking up new knowledge
•	Strong interest or prior experience in automated unit testing
•	Good foundation in software engineering and software development
•	Knowledge in foundational AI/ML concepts and/or Statistics will be an advantage
•	Must be a team player, who is inquisitive and independent, with strong analytical and communications skills

title: Software Development or Maker Intern @ VIVITA, Creativity Accelrator for Children and Youth
description:
Software Development or Maker Intern @ VIVITA, Creativity Accelerator for Children and Youth

Join us if you like to create, and is excited about using your creative skills and energy to empower children in their making journey! You can either be facilitating them to turn their imagination and ideas into life, or be involved in developing a solution that will accelerate their creativity.

Who is VIVITA?

VIVITA is a global community of creators with a vision to empower children with the skills to create a better future. A for-impact organisation, we produce creative learning environments, develop new tools, and build a community connecting like-minded children from all over the world. We believe in leveraging children’s interests to transform their inspirations into real skills. We support their passion, curiosity, and self-directed exploration of learning through the joy of making.

To achieve our vision, VIVITA provides creative learning spaces call VIVISTOP, develops 21st-century creative platforms and tools called VIVIWARE, and creates global communities of creative children.

Our creativity studio in Singapore VIVISTOP Orchard is equipped with a wide variety of modern and professional creative tools and materials, for children to explore many possibilities of making. This ranges from robotics and electronics, to 3d printing, laser cutting, craft, fashion, furniture making, and even cooking! VIVISTOP has no structured curriculum - and children decide what they want to work on. By removing the limits of a structured curriculum and let children exercise their agency, VIVITA is building a community of self-directed learners where each is free to experiment with different ideas and explore new skills without the fear of failure. Last but not least, we have a creative team who has professional making skills and cares about empowering children, to support each child’s journey. Membership to VIVISTOP is free of charge, as we want to empower children from all walks of life. For children 9-15 years old. 

For more information, please visit vivita.sg, or lighthouse.vivita.sg

You can refer to the post below to find out more about the experiences of our past interns.
vivita.sg/internship

Roles and Job Scope

i) For Computer Science and Engineering Students
You would be involved in some or all of these projects.
- Development VIVIBOOM, a SaaS education portal used by the VIVITA members globally for project sharing and skills acquisition). Tech stack: Front-end React JS, Node JS, MySQL. Back-end - AWS EC2, AWS Amplify, RDS, S3, SES (Note - you do not need to know everything before applying)
- Developing VIVIBOOM's mobile application.
- Mentoring of children's project - members of VIVITA create the product, games, videos, app, furniture, etc.. as their projects. You will be assisting us in facilitating and mentoring their projects and tinkering.
- Workshop and program organisation related to digital skills.

ii) For Electrical and Electronics Engineering Students
- Development of workshop, projects and content in the area of electronics and robotics that inspire children in their pursuit of making and tinkering.
- Develop content for our in-house-developed robotics/IoT kit, VIVIWARE Cell (https://cell.viviware.com/).
- Conduct engaging workshops related to engineering and electronics to students from 8-15yo.
- Mentoring of children's project - members of VIVITA create the product, games, videos, app, furniture, etc.. as their projects. You will be assisting us in facilitating and mentoring their projects and tinkering.

For both of the above positions, we also give our interns opportunities to initiate your own project! You would be given time to think of a project that you are passionate about and could inspire children in their making, and carry them out to our members. In addition, you would be working with a team with a diverse skillset, exposing you to new possibilities beyond your area of studies.

Location - VIVISTOP Orchard, and remote work possible depending on your project.
Working Hours - 5 days a week, including one weekend (either Sat or Sunday)
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a cover letter, a copy of your C.V, and your project portfolio with your application, and send it to hoileong@vivita.sg
applicationRequirements: We do not look at your grades! We hope to look for someone who is passionate about empowering children, and is passionate about what they are doing!

title: Supply Chain Analyst Intern (Global Supply Management)
description:
Job Description

Corning’s internship program provides an opportunity to learn on-the-job skills and gain business experience at a Fortune 500 company. Not only does our program provide a firsthand look at a career field, it provides an opportunity to network with regional professionals, strengthen academic skills, build resume credentials for future job opportunities and explore Corning’s 170 years of history.

Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, a unique combination of material and process innovation, and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges. The Global Supply Management (GSM) Function is recognized as a critical function for business success.  It delivers the training, tools and opportunities needed to create innovative solutions for the function & the corporation.  GSM has leading edge, effective processes to anticipate and exceed customer requirements.

To know more about Corning, please visit us at www.corning.com. 

Scope of Position
The intern reports directly to the Global Supply Chain Collaboration Leader. title: ePlanner

Developed in-house by Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA), ePlanner is a one stop, multi-platform, geospatial urban planning analytics system that integrates data from various sources to enable advanced spatial visualisation and analytics. ePlanner enables planners from URA and other agencies to access and analyse various land-use planning information such as planning, development control, real estate, land sales and car park easily, on a single platform, and especially while they are on-the-go. title: Secure Over-the-Air Firmware Update
description:
Xnergy Autonomous Power Technologies Pte. Ltd. is a young local deep-tech startup company specialized in the development of high-power wireless charging technology and has acquired a certain know-how as well as technical innovation capacities in the domain of electrified mobility which includes but not limited to automated guided vehicles (AGVs), automated mobile robots (AMRs), electric vehicles (EVs) and robotics arms.

After the deployment of Xnergy wireless chargers, Firmware updates are necessary over time to add more features or to fix bugs. As an IoT-enabled device, creating a secure over-the-air firmware update is critical to the product development. It allows the engineers to update the firmware remotely and securely. The security parts come to protect the integrity of the charger’s firmware and more importantly to prevent unauthorized party to do the updates or collect confidential information during the updates.

This project involves in multi-programming (C, python) and cross-device platform (microcontroller, windows/Linux application). Knowledge of Bootloader for real-time microcontroller, industrial communication protocol (UART, SPI), and Windows/Linux application development are required to do the project. Familiarity with Texas Instrument microcontroller is a plus.

title: Development of Portable Smart Tester for Wireless Charger
description:
Building towards together in the green and clean environment initiatives, more robots will be deployed across all fields everywhere. In order for these robots to be more autonomously operated, wireless charging will be the key driver to allow energy to be transferred to the robots’ batteries without any human intervention. 

However, robots are designed and built both functionality and aesthetically differently. Moreover, each robot systems are using different communication protocols. Therefore, the integration of wireless charger product process onto different robots could become a challenging tasks and time consuming. A portable smart tester is necessarily to reduce the time taken to complete performing a series of integration testing and even applicable for battery testing.

This project involves developing a portable control module that can monitor the various readings such as voltage and current to automate the integration testing process or collect battery charging behaviour. Thus, it requires software programming skills using Python language to develop the integration testing sequences.

title: Internship: APAC Sustainability
description:
Introduction:
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities:
Across the world, countries are implementing Post-pandemic recovery plans, and Climate/Green investments are an essential component for countries and clients to achieve and accelerate their Sustainability and ESG goals. The global Sustainability market is expected to be $28.9B globally by 2024, growing at a CAGR of 27% and 92% of CEOs believe integration of sustainability will be critical to the future of their businesses.
IBM has led the industry in environment and climate protection with 50 years of ESG Reporting. From 1990 through 2019, IBM conserved 7.7 million MWh of electricity, avoiding 4.5 million metric tons of CO2 emissions and saving $646 million. IBM has successfully developed and deployed Sustainability solutions as “Client Zero”, and worked with industry leaders like Shell, Wells Fargo, Unilever and Yara to help establish and further their ESG goals.
We have recently launched our Sustainability and Climate Change practice to help our clients in their journey to become sustainable enterprises. We will bring value to our clients through industry leading Cognitive Enterprise solutions designed and delivered by GBS using AI & Hybrid Cloud, integrating IBM and Ecosystem Partner solutions.
•	Are you looking for a role with greater purpose which is helping to advance our clients’ sustainability agenda? 
•	Do you enjoy working in a dynamic environment with diverse multi-cultural teams?
•	Are you interested to be a pioneer and support IBM APAC’s Sustainability go-to-market?
•	Is planning and execution of large-scale initiatives and building communities one of your strengths?
•	Are you excited about the opportunity to accelerate your learning curve and apply your newly gained skills & knowledge as you go?

If your answer to above questions is “Yes”, then you might be the right one for this exciting opportunity to join our team APAC Sustainability Team. 

We are looking for highly talented and passionate individuals who are keen on doing a 6-month internship with the IBM APAC Sustainability team.

The role and your responsibilities
•	Understand Sustainability trends, conditions and landscape in APAC and work with Industry to define Industry and client specific Point of Views. Focus industries are: Energy & Utilities; Industrial Products (Manufacturing, Mining and Real Estate); Chemicals & Petroleum; Consumer Products and Retail; Financial Services
•	Understand IBM’s Sustainability offerings portfolio and work with service line leaders to curate and adapt relevant offerings for APAC. Focus offering groups are: Sustainability Strategy; Climate Risk, Carbon and Financial Reporting; Electrification, Energy Transition and Emissions Management; Smarter Infrastructure & Intelligent Operations; Sustainable Supply Chain and Circularity; Weather Network and Services
•	Contribute to sales and delivery engagements. Primary responsibilities will include market and client specific research, analysis of data and preparation of reports and presentations
•	Contribute to practice building activities including curation of assets, accelerators, managing and scheduling tasks and management of the knowledge repository

Required Professional and Technical Expertise:
•	Studying for a Bachelors/Masters/PhD in the following disciplines – Environmental Studies/Climate Change/Business Studies
•	Good understanding of information technology. Data Science and AI skills will be an advantage
•	Strong analytical skills. Able to absorb and synthesize new information quickly
•	Strong communication and presentation skills, written and verbal
•	Good business acumen and broad understanding of industry trends
•	Prior experience in Sustainability (ESG) consulting or projects will be an advantage
•	Curious, hands on, able to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity and rapid change

title: Internship: UI/UX Development (STELA Project)
description:
Introduction:
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities:
IBM designs the world’s best servers and its supercomputers are second to none.  This success did not happen by chance; at IBM, we have dedicated system verification teams around the world that ensure their success.

STELA (Systems Test Event Logging and Analysis) is an automation framework used by system verification and development teams for log collection and data mining. It consists of a suite of automation tools running on a server as well as a web component to ease tracking of failures across systems. Dedicated to IBM high-end server development, this tool has various user groups located all over the world.

The candidate will be tasked with refreshing STELA’s UI, with a more modern front-end, utilizing popular JavaScript UI frameworks available such as React, Angular and Vue.js. She/he would be expected to build the foundation for a front-end which is highly modular in nature and make design choices with the aim of improving the overall UI/UX of the application while still maintaining compatibility with the existing MariaDB database in the back-end.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise:
•	Studying for a Bachelors/Graduate Diploma the following disciplines - Digital Solutions Development / Information Engineering and Media / Computer Science / Computer Engineering
•	Strong knowledge of Linux, SQL, Angular/React, Express.js and Node.js (Full Stack)
•	Experience in working with web server technologies including Apache, Node.js, Nginx
•	Experience in REST API design and development
•	Good understanding of AJAX and jQuery
•	Knowledge of Perl, PHP or Python will be beneficial
