Today, most countries across the world lack access to the internet and with that, the resources to do business, exchange ideas and learn.  At Transcelestial, we are building a space laser communication network to deliver the future of Internet Distribution worldwide. This will be the fastest way to bring the rest of the world up on the bandwidth and connectivity curve. 

Founded in Dec 2016, the Transcelestial team is located in Singapore and is backed by major investors such as Wavemaker Partners, EDBI, Airbus Ventures, Cap Vista, SEEDS Capital (Enterprise SG), Entrepreneur First and others. Right now, we are using the free space optics laser communication technology to provide a rapidly deployable, affordable, low cost and high speed Last Mile Connectivity solution, CENTAURI, which speeds up adoption of 4G and 5G globally.

Transcelestial is looking for technically strong and curious interns to work on maximising the impact of our hardware and software platforms and shape the future of how our civilization will communicate!

Bring the best version of yourself. You will join a highly experienced international team, get the opportunity to contribute in high level design discussions regarding systems architecture. You will be embedded in daily activities of the R&D team, enhance your technical problem solving skills, get exposed to new tools, methods, and  programming languages. You will gain practical experience ranging from prototyping to testing and implementation.

We offer internship opportunities in:
Electronics, and Embedded Systems
Control Engineering, Computer Vision, and Signal Processing 
Precision Optics and Mechanical Engineering
Software Engineering and Machine Learning
Mission Planning and Spacecraft System Design

If you have demonstrated a strong commitment to academic excellence and motivation to contribute your knowledge outside the classroom, we want you! In your application, you should include your CV, and links to your portfolio or projects you are working on.

title: Satellite: Mission Planning for New Microsatellite Project
description:
Whilst typical low earth orbit satellites (LEO) fly at altitudes of 500 kilometers or higher, very low earth orbit (VLEO) satellites like ESA’s GOCE and JAXA’s TSUBAME flew at altitudes below 300 kilometers. Flying at such low altitudes poses several challenges such as aerodynamic drag, strong gravitational pull and so on. The successful candidate will be required to perform orbit analysis using FreeFlyer Software in the consideration of those factors to provide simulation result to verify design of satellite spacecraft subsystem.  
At the end of the internship, the student will be able to gain experience in satellite mission design, analysis and operation.

title: AI powered radar and optical sensors fusion
description:
Mobile robots rely on sensor data to build a representation of their environment. However, sensors usually provide incomplete, inconsistent or inaccurate information. Sensor fusion has been successfully employed to enhance the accuracy of sensor measures. This work proposes and investigates the use of Artificial Intelligence techniques for sensor fusion. Its main goal is to improve the human gesture recognition capability of the robot in its work environment, based on measures obtained from different sensors.
The project will provide the opportunity for student to understand the principle smart sensing and the commercial value of AI based imaging processing and data fusion. The students will work on the system integration, indoor/ outdoor experiments, AI relevant signal processing.

title: AI: Federated learning
description:
The next generation of artificial intelligence is built upon the core idea revolving around “data privacy”. Federated learning (also known as collaborative learning) is a machine learning technique that trains an algorithm across multiple decentralized edge devices or servers holding local data samples, without exchanging them, which can be implemented to solve the data privacy problem. This approach stands in contrast to traditional centralized machine learning techniques where all the local datasets are uploaded to one server, as well as to more classical decentralized approaches which often assume that local data samples are identically distributed.
The project will provide the opportunity for student to understand the concept of federated learning and work on the useful applications. The students will work on the AI relevant signal processing and programming.

title: IoT data analytics for Singapore Cyberspace
description:
Internet of Things (IoTs) are growing at a staggering rate and is expected to surge from 8.4 billion in 2017 to 75 billion by 2025. Given the increasing proliferation of IoT devices, coupled with the poor provision of cybersecurity safeguards, it has given rise to increasing cybersecurity concerns and challenges. The crippling of US internet infrastructure by DDoS attack from the infamous MIRAI botnet in 2016, was the starting point when policymakers worldwide realised the extent of the problem of insecure IoT devices. Compromised IoT devices (e.g. cameras) were so rampant that collectively as a botnet, they managed to bring to bear a record of 1.2 Tbps DDoS attack on Dyn (a US-based DNS provider), thus crippling access to essential websites like Amazon, CNN and Twitter. 

With increasing digitalisation of businesses and consumer adoption of smart IoT devices, there is growing concern in this unregulated area, which is facing increasing threats. If this is left unmonitored, there may be an increased risk of a large-scale attack on our national IT infrastructure. More importantly, as a well-connected country with good digital infrastructure, we could be leveraged upon as a botnet platform to attack other countries. This could affect our reputation as a global secure IT and business hub. 

Hence, IoT data analytics is needed to provide CSA with information and analysis of the global as well as Singapore IoT threat landscape. These insights will allow CSA and other Government agencies to put in place policy and technical measures to safeguard the cybersecurity of IoT devices and address the threats before they cause damage.

Shodan is a search engine that lets the user find specific types of IoT devices (such as webcams, security systems, routers and industrial IoT devices) connected to the Internet.  
Using Shodan, the intern shall identify emerging trends in the IoT space specific to the Singapore cyber landscape as well as the global cyber landscape. By analyzing Shodan data, the intern will also help to identify potential security issues with IoT devices located in Singapore.

title: Development of Strategic Analysis Workbench
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:

The National Cyber Threat Analysis Centre (NCTAC) provides the Government with strategic insights into global and local cyber threat landscape. The cyber threat analysis team conducts cyber research and in-depth analysis on cyber threats and risks to provide valuable insights to stakeholders for decision making and national cyber policy-making and inform CSA’s operations of attacks and campaigns.

This project will focus on automating the extraction of relevant data from third party threat intelligence providers, which will be collated in a database. Visuals maps or graphs will also be developed to support the cyber threat analysis teams’ research and analysis. 

The intern is expected to develop an automated system to ingest data feeds from multiple threat intelligence providers and build dashboards for data visualisation to support trend/threat research and analysis.

title: Intern at Lab of Systems Biology & Data Analytics
description:
Project 1: SG10K analysis platform improvement
Project details/job scope: On-cloud large-scale genomics web-services development 
The ever-increasing ease of genomic information acquisition is fostering a new era for data driven clinical practice and health care: Precision Medicine (PM). The A*STAR Genome Research Informatics & Data Science Platform (GRIDS) aims to develop the institutional and computational infrastructures addressing the challenges that arise from the processing of these massive multimodal biological and clinical datasets. We are developing and deploying on public cloud (mostly AWS, but also occasionally GCP and Azure) typical big data analytics stacks (K8s, Spark, ElasticSearch, Juptyer) to compute & visualize trillions of data points (>10,000 genomes x ~3 billion data point per genome).
The selected NTU student will join GRIDS’ dev-op team and owing to his/her skills and interest, be involved in several aspect of the data analytics infrastructure and web-services GRIDS is providing to the Precision Medicine research community:
•            Improvement of automate cluster deployment (advanced AWS CloudFormation templating)
•            Extension of analytics toolkit (Pyspark / Hail)
•            Design and implementation of web-services solutions (NodeJS / ReactJS)
•            Development of APIs (ElasticSearch / graphQL)  

Project 2: Optimizing and Extending the BANKSY Spatially Regularized Clustering Algorithm
Project details/job scope:
Over the past decade, clustering algorithms have been a major tool for identifying different types of cells within genomics datasets. With the advent of "spatial"-omics technologies--which track the positions of objects in physical space in addition to the more traditional gene expression feature space--within genomics, there is a need to generalize machine learning methods to incorporate this spatial information. Recently, we developed 'BANKSY', a clustering algorithm that uses a spatial kernel to perform spatially regularized clustering, and in doing so, dramatically improves clustering performance. 

We are looking for a highly motivated student to work on improving the algorithm in multiple directions. Firstly, the student will optimize its python implementation to match its theoretical computational complexity, and incorporate multi-threaded parallelism into this implementation. Next, we will test the performance of the algorithm on different types of datasets and look at the possibility of integrating it with feature selection and data integration algorithms. Finally, if time permits, we will study the possibility of a deeper integration between the graph based clustering and the spatial kernel computation aspects of the algorithm. 
We will also welcome applications from candidates from the School of Art, Design and Media, with the project description above modified to focus on the user interface and user experience (UI/UX) of the BANSKY software, along with developing beautiful demonstrations of the technology. 

Project 3: Improving pathology models using spatially-resolved transcriptome measurements
Project details/job scope:
The prediction of clinical and molecular phenotypes from whole slide images (WSIs) of tissue sections is of great interest for applications in diagnosis and prognosis. Advances in deep learning have greatly improved the performance of models trained to directly predict phenotypes of interest from WSIs. More recently, studies have shown that training on auxiliary tasks even under weak supervision (for e.g. training to predict bulk gene expression collected from a whole tissue sample) can further improve performance and interpretability of these models. At the same time, new technologies are now available for measuring gene expression at higher spatial resolution i.e. of much smaller subsections of the tissue. The goals of this project are to 1) investigate if models trained on bulk gene expression of whole tissue samples generalize to new spatially resolved measurements, 2) investigate if fine-tuning models on spatially resolved measurements improves prediction and interpretation of bulk gene expression/clinical phenotypes. Skills needed: familiarity with python, experience with deep learning libraries (pytorch, tensorflow), some existing knowledge of machine learning, deep learning, computer vision.

Project 4: Hierarchical deconvolution of spatially aggregated measurements
Project details/job scope:
New technologies in spatial transcriptomics now enable us to collect spatially-resolved measurements of gene expression within a tissue. However, current commercial technologies have not yet reached single-cell resolution, and so multiple cells might contribute to the measurement at a given spatial location. There is hence a need for algorithms that are able to accurately deconvolve these measurements into cell-type compositions. Current methods for deconvolution are not aware of natural cell-type hierarchies that users may wish to enforce. This project will extend existing algorithms in the space to take into account user-specified cell type hierarchies. Skills needed: familiarity with python, some knowledge of linear algebra and numerical methods (hierarchical non-negative matrix factorization) 

Project 5: Scaling single-cell clustering to millions of cells
Project details/job scope:
Collecting single-cell RNA-sequencing data of millions of cells is becoming increasingly routine. However, common steps in the analysis pipeline of these datasets, in particular clustering, do not scale well without access to large compute clusters. Others have tried to address this challenge via sketching algorithms that seek to provide a representative sample of the dataset. Quality of the clustering then depends on the quality of the sampling. This project will investigate if streaming can provide a robust alternative that achieves exact, high-resolution clustering while maintaining a low memory footprint. Skills needed: familiarity with C++/python, some knowledge of graph data structures and algorithms, especially graph clustering.

Project 6: Predicting signaling interactions between cells using spatial genomics data
Project details/job scope:
Cell-to-cell communication is mediated by the interaction of ligands (from sender cells) with receptors (on receiver cells). Current methods for detecting interactions in spatially-resolved transcriptomics data are mostly focused on local (physical) interactions between adjacent cells, where both ligands and receptors are displayed on the cell-surface. However, global regulation requires longer-range communication that is typically mediated by secreted ligands. The diffusion dynamics of each ligand drives a concentration gradient that determines how receiver cells respond. This project will investigate if combining (a) a spatial diffusion model of secreted ligands with respect to their binding partners (i.e. their cognate receptors) and (b) prior knowledge of the downstream target genes of these secreted ligands can identify interacting ligand-receptor pairs. Skills needed: python, some knowledge of hypothesis testing/statistical inference.

Project 7: DUBStepR: speed-up of correlation range computation
Project details/job scope:
DUBStepR (Determining the Underlying Basis using Step-wise Regression) is a feature selection algorithm for cell type identification in single-cell RNA-sequencing data. DUBStepR selects a basis set of strongly correlated genes that maximally explain variation in gene-correlation space, and then expands this basis set to identify the features (genes) that optimize cluster separation.

DUBStepR is based on the concept that DE genes specific to the same cell types would tend to be highly correlated with each other, whereas those specific to distinct cell types are likely to be anti-correlated. In contrast, non-DE genes are likely to be only weakly correlated. We therefore hypothesized that a correlation range score derived from the difference between the strongest positive and strongest negative correlation coefficients of a gene, would be substantially elevated among DE genes. Indeed, we found that the correlation range score was significantly higher for DE genes relative to non-DE genes.

Computing this correlation range score is the rate-limiting step as it involves calculating correlations between all pairs of gene vectors. As part of their undergrad thesis, the student will work on speeding up this approach to significantly reduce the time and memory complexity of the correlation range computation. DUBStepR is written as an R package, and its preprint is currently on bioRxiv (doi: 10.1101/2020.10.07.330563).

Project 8: Efficient large-scale analysis of structural variants in 10K samples from three diverse Asian populations
Project details/job scope: 
Structural variants (SVs) are defined as genomic rearrangements of 50 bp or more and encompass a broad range of mutational classes, namely deletions and duplications (i.e. CNVs), insertions, inversions and translocations [1]. Because of their size and number, they account for most varying bp in the human genome, and have been identified as an important driver of phenotypic changes, including associations with disease [2] and ethnicity [3]. 
Multiple tools exist to perform de novo discovery of SVs from whole genome sequencing (WGS) data, which leverage multiple sources of information, namely read depth (e.g. GenomeSTRIP, CNVnator) and paired-end alignment patterns (e.g. Manta, Delly). No single tool can detect all types and sizes of SVs, and specialised tools also exist to better resolve challenging loci (e.g. MELT for transposable elements, ExpansionHunter for tandem repeats) and complex events (e.g. svtk resolve). As a result, analysis workflows for SVs tend to rely on more than one tool, which poses additional challenges for merging, filtering, genotyping candidate events, and running workflows at scale.
The goal of this internship is to build and deploy a production-ready pipeline for the detection of SVs from short-read WGS data, leveraging on expertise from the research team. The pipeline will be designed to run efficiently on cloud, initially on a set of 10K samples, and with a vision to quickly scale beyond that. Useful skills include: 
-	Experience in Python, applied to task automation and data analysis, and version control (git).
-	Familiarity with cloud-compute (AWS), software packages (Docker) and pipelining languages (cwl, nextflow).
-	Familiarity with WGS and analysis of large datasets.
-	Experience designing, deploying and supporting robust software products.
-	Strong communication skills and ability to work as a team.
-	Ability to learn quickly on the job.

title: Ocular Epidemiology (Artificial Intelligence) / Data Science
description:
The Ocular Epidemiological Research Group at SERI conducts ophthalmic epidemiologic research in Singapore and Asia under the Singapore Epidemiology of Eye Diseases (SEED) program. SEED aims to determine the prevalence, incidence, biomarkers, risk factors and impact of major age-related eye diseases (e.g. age-related macular degeneration, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, and vision impairment). 

We conduct large population-based studies and multi-centres collaboration research with a particular focus on diseases that are prevalent in Asia-Pacific. In addition, together with Retina and Glaucoma Research Groups at SERI, we are conducting several clinical projects, collectively involving over 10,000 study subjects, with comprehensive image and genetic data. The data collected would also be utilized for a myriad of downstream projects such as to develop Artificial Intelligence. 

Under the direct supervision of the Clinician Scientists/ Data Science Unit Lead, the intern will be expected to: 
-Assist with image processing, machine deep learning, and/or 
-Data cleansing and statistical analysis 

Requirements: 
- Familiar with regression analysis 
- Familiar deep learning and python, TensorFlow 
- Meticulous 
- Willing to learn 
- Able to work independently 
- Sensitive to patient privacy and confidentiality of records

title: Software Development Intern
description:
We currently have an internship role in Digital Services, CoE, within the Robotics team for software development. We are currently working on a cutting-edge assessment system that encompasses various aspects of robotics and software engineering. We are looking for a dynamic intern, preferably from a computer science or electronics background, with a keen interest in computer programming. Our system uses the popular ROS platform. The intern should learn and adapt quickly and become an active contributor to the development work. He/she should be a good team player. This role gives an excellent opportunity to learn and develop robotics, computer programming, databases and software integration knowledge. This position requires some exposure/coursework to computer programming languages such as C/C++, Java, C# etc. Knowledge of applied mathematics is an advantage. This position would be reporting to the lead of the Robotics team.  

The intern would be required to furnish the university requirements for the training, which would be done in consultation with his/her university supervisor. The expectations of the intern and the university requirements will be taken into consideration while setting the goals, KPI’s and assessment milestones for the intern.

The supervisor will then introduce the intern to the team, and the project, upon joining, will familiarise him/her with the codebase and the architecture of the AS3 software under development. It will follow familiarisation with software development processes and practices that the team follows. The intern will be given familiarisation training on essential robotics standards and their usage in the AS3 system. The intern would also be given targeted exercises to learn and develop skills related to the development work such as ROS, C++, databases etc. Upon successful acquaintance, he/she will be assigned various tasks for feature implementations, development of test cases and validation of various software components. The learning path and assessments for the intern would be in line with the university requirements and the intern’s learning interests while keeping in mind TÜV’s business requirements.

title: Intern – Scientific Research (A*STAR)
description:
The A*STAR Research Institutes (RIs) offer research internship opportunities to STEM undergraduates. It provides students (1) first-hand research experience, (2) exposure to industry-relevant and translational research work, and (3) an appreciation of the research work A*STAR does and its contribution and impact to the industry and Singapore’s economy.

Learning outcomes: Students will be trained to have the right aptitude in planning effective experiments, the right skills in laboratory techniques and use of cutting-edge, sophisticated lab equipment, be exposed to opportunities to practice critical and creative thinking in trouble shooting and coming up with practical solutions when experimental results are not satisfactory as hypothesised, gain knowledge in- and exposure to- possible scientific research trends that would equip students with relevant aptitude, knowledge and skills, and an appreciation of what research work entails and the importance of ethical decision making in relation to the confidentiality issues on intellectual property.

Pre-requisites: A*STAR looks for students who demonstrate a keen interest and passion in scientific research, have the willingness to learn and engage scientific researchers productively, and the ability to be good team players who are independent, proactive, responsible, and sensible. Prior research experiences preferred.

title: Data Science Internship
description:
Full Job Description
About the Team
There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities. At Yara, the Smallholders Digital Team is part of the Crop and Digital Solutions Unit. 

About Crop and Digital Solutions

Yara aims to be the crop nutrition company for the future and is leading the development of sustainable agriculture and digital tools to contribute to solving global agricultural challenges. We have a worldwide presence with sales teams in ~150 countries and around 17,000 employees. Yara Farming Solutions, will lead the transformation towards more sustainable and efficient food production, by innovating our offerings and the way we work. Crop and Digital Solutions is responsible developing and scaling new “on-farm” digital and integrated tools and solutions for an efficient and transparent food system.

Responsibilities

Conduct novel data analysis in Python to generate real-time insights for business stakeholders.
Develop new models utilize sensor technology to solve problems for smallholder farmers.
Support the improvement of data collection and infrastructure.
Required Profile

Experience manipulating and analyzing data in a scripting language such as Python or R, with Python preferred. Knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Personal/ professional interest in agriculture and developing country contexts.
Strong understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts underlying data analysis and machine learning.
Familiarity with AWS products is a plus.
Additional information
We strive to reflect the diversity in society and encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply. We are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances
​​​​​​​

Why us?

Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.

title: Intern - Maintenance Associate
description:
Intern - Maintenance Associate

THE OPPORTUNITY

To work in a culturally diverse and high-performance team who has built a lot of capabilities in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing. 
Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and named one of the Best Companies to Work for in 2019 by HR Asia
Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years
Our Manufacturing Operations teams are the people that make our products. We work in the manufacturing plants with a “Safety First, Quality Always” mindset striving for continuous improvement. We work in the local plant connected to our global manufacturing network to ensure the highest quality of raw materials, intermediates and finished products.

Reporting to the Engineering Manager, the Engineer will be joining a two-year WDA training program. The WDA program aims to support those who is willing to take up traineeship opportunities in biopharmaceutical sector. These traineeships will help candidates develop their skills professionally, equip them with valuable industry experience and allow them to gain a firmer foothold in the job market across various sectors.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Critical responsibilities but not limited to:

Maintenance associate (Internship) will be assisting maintenance team to complete planned work activities timely, efficiently and satisfactorily. Trainings will be provided by maintenance engineers.
Key responsibilities:
1.    Support maintenance inventory management (Spare parts of equipment /instrument)
2.    Support quality system improvement program (QSIP) roll out initiatives such as SOP, instructions, PM task list, etc.
3.    Support cGMP supplier qualification process
4.    Contractor & Vendor management (Qualification, monitoring and documentation)
5.    Preventive maintenance (PM) optimization for safety critical plans

WHAT YOU MUST HAVE

Qualification

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Science or Equivalents 

Experience:

Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Have a positive, proactive, can-do attitude
Keen to learn
good team player
Strong problem solving skills

LEARNING OUTCOME

1.    Exposure to the inventory management process in pharmaceutical manufacturing plant.
2.    Provide insights to the quality systems that supports the highly regulated pharmaceutical industry.
3.    Exposure to cGMP environment of pharmaceutical industry.
4.    Experience the real time and process of engaging vendors and contractors for manufacturing environment.
5.    Understand the types of PMs available and the rigor associated with PM execution.
 
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT

Limitless opportunities across various areas in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing.
A state-of-the-art facility that delivers solution to its customers world-wide
Highly engaging team that aims to innovate the future

Our Manufacturing & Supply Division is committed to be the most trusted supplier of biopharmaceuticals worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, create an interdependent global manufacturing network that’s committed to delivering a high quality, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time.

title: Product Owner Internship
description:
About the Unit

There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.

In 2017, Yara created a new digital development unit to build solutions for smallholder farming communities. Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.



Responsibilities

Work with the PO and team to create product requirement and process documentation.
Work with PO and team for end to end user testing on our app/system-related document user manuals.
Work closely with engineers and developers in debugging process
Assist PO translate business requirement into technical deliverables roadmap 
Support the PO with feature analysis and help to develop informed insights. 
Support the PO with technical product/market research.  


Required Profile

Strong personal/professional interest in the LSM segments (developing countries, low-income markets, etc) and agriculture in general.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Data driven with strong analytics skills
Familiar with Jira / confluence software is a plus
Strong interest in digital product development with project management experience.

We strive to reflect the diversity in society and encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply. We are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances
​​​​​​​

title: Supply Chain Management Intern (Logistics)
description:
Siemens Mobility is the world’s leading provider of mobility solutions that enable the efficient, safe and environmentally friendly transport of people and goods – and help improve the quality of everyday life for millions of people on all continents. Driven by innovation, we develop intelligent solutions for the increasing digitalization of the transport sector. Our range of offerings includes rail vehicles, rail automation, road traffic management systems, rail electrification and services.

Be a part of it, design the future of Mobility and join us for your internship with Siemens Mobility Singapore.

What are my job responsibilities?
• Inventory management that includes accurate recording of inventory, consolidation and distribution 
• Organize transportation activities, including storage of goods, managing information accrued from point of origin to delivery, orchestrating transportation movements, and arranging for services as necessary
• Coordinate and track movement of all import/export shipments and ensure all documents such as advanced shipping notice, pick slips, bills of lading are accurately recorded.

What do I need to qualify for this role?
• Currently pursuing a Degree or Masters in Business / Business Administration / Management / Engineering / Economics / Supply Chain Management or Related field of study.
• Availability to intern for 6 – 9 months will be a plus
• Strong math, analytical, problem-solving skills
• Excellent oral, written, and technical communication skills 
• Enthusiastic and positive attitude
• Self-motivated and team oriented
• Proficient in Microsoft applications, Sharepoint and Excel
• Basic programming and Tableau background are a bonus

To be eligible for this position, applicants must possess a Valid Student Pass in Singapore or satisfy the Ministry of Manpower’s Work Holiday Pass (WHP) requirements

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Internship – Digital Specialist
description:
About Us:

ComfortDelGro is one of the world’s largest land transport companies with a total fleet size of over 41,688 buses, taxis and rental vehicles with more than 24,329 employees. Headquartered in Singapore, the Group also has operations in China, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Australia, Vietnam and Malaysia.

Our Digital team focuses on driving digital transformation with business and operations to deliver values to our customers. You will be collaborating with users to define and iterate through ideas and requirements to drive the adoption of digital technologies.

Why an internship at ComfortDelGro?

1. We believe that the best classroom is learning by doing, and we trust that you know what you’re doing and that you can learn what you don’t!

2. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit to demonstrate and support digital innovations with the users. We encourage thinking outside the box to solve real problems.

Project Scope:

As a Digital Specialist, you will work closely with our Digital team and business users on an end-to-end process, i.e. gathering user requirements, technology research, designing and deploying functional Proofs-of-Concept (PoCs), and writing the business case to key stakeholders. Key responsibilities include:

- Discuss with users on business and project requirement;
- Research and explore probable solution;
- Test and build working prototypes;
- Do market research, analyse and support justifications for projects.

The Role:

- You are available for at least 12 – 18 weeks
- You should have a knack for resolving complex people and business issues
- You are a full-time student majoring in Computer Sciences, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related fields
- Independent, out-of-the-box thinker and looking to create the maximum impact in the shortest time!

If you have what it takes to bring ComfortDelGro to even greater heights, we welcome you to join us in our global endeavours!

title: Cloud Engineer Intern
description:
Our Company
For more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

Our Singapore IT Hub
Established in 2015, our Company’s Singapore IT Hub aims to harness digital solutions for better business outcomes. One of its key focuses is in using analytics and data science to guide better decision-making.  

Home to more than 300 employees with over 20 nationalities, the Singapore IT Hub is part of a global network, with sister hubs located in the United States and Czech Republic. In Singapore, the hub houses a wide span of IT capabilities teams ranging from Data Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity & Risk Management to Enterprise Platforms and many more. Across Japan, China and the Asia Pacific region, the hub works closely with colleagues from all divisions of the company to drive our core business.

The Cloud Computing team develops the strategy and works with teams worldwide to govern, grow, and operate Cloud solutions.  Our team embraces the regulatory challenges of our industry and drives innovative, secure, and compliant use of Cloud Service Providers.  We collaborate closely with internal and external partners worldwide to mature our ability to utilize Cloud Service Providers.   Our team also impacts application development agility worldwide via our cloud-based application hosting Platform as a Service (PaaS).

Organize and visualize raw data using data visualization tools

Knowledge of front-end languages (JavaScript, HTML/CSS) will be a plus

Excellent verbal, written communication and documentation skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrates a growth mindset and comfortable working in agile environment

Opportunity to gain more exposure in cloud computing domain

title: Electrical Engineering Hardware (EE HW) Intern
description:
At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Aruba is redefining the “IT EDGE”. Creating new customer experiences by building intelligent spaces and digital workspaces. We are focused on campus, branch, mobility and the IoT to transform business models with the combined power of compute, context, control and secure connectivity.

As an Electrical Engineering Hardware (EE HW) Intern, you will enjoy being part of a global community of top engineers, who are at the heart of the company’s innovative technology infrastructure products. You will have the opportunity to work on design and development of Printed Circuit Assemblies (PCAs) used in our Ethernet switch systems. You will also take part in conducting feasibility, design margin and validation analysis, and empirical testing on electronic subsystems of network switches designs.

In a typical day as an Electrical Engineering Hardware Intern, you would ·

title: Security Analyst
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:

As a Security Analyst, you will participate in the qualification of vulnerability reports submitted by our community of ethical hackers, to its analysis and to support our clients in the assessment vulnerabilities in order to better understand the impacts and possible solutions. You will also participate in creating internal tools, as well as their maintenance and evolution for the benefit of our hackers’ community.

Your main missions will be :
Security Analyst: 
• Creation and reproduction of Proof-of-Concept. 
• Assessment of the severity of vulnerabilities according to the context. 
• Restitution, technical popularization to our customers. 
• Ensure dialogue with our community of ethical hackers. 
• Monitor the vulnerability reports workflow. 
• Coordinate with the Customer Success Manager (CSM) department

R&D: 
• Development of internal solutions related to the position. 
• Development of tools for our community.

Skills that you master : 
• Security fundamentals such as the Top 10 OWASP 
• The CVSS criticality assessment system and its application 
• Specific tools such as BurpSuite 
• Development in Python 
• Fluent English (spoken/written)

The following notions will be are a plus: 
• Development on Frameworks such as Django / Flask 
• Participation in Open Source projects 
• Constant monitoring of Cybersecurity subjects (CVE, research, vulnerabilities, etc.)

Your Profile 
You are curious by nature, passionate about Cybersecurity and have a strong interest in understanding how an information system works and how to secure it. 
You have participated in CTFs and Infosec learning platforms. 
Rigorous, respectful of good security practices, your team spirit and your interpersonal skills will allow you to take on your main missions successfully.

title: Intern - Data Engineer
description:
How Will You Make an Impact? 
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We are at the heart of global response to COVID-19 outbreak and have delivered 1/4 of the COVID-19 testing needs. Our customers includes hospitals and clinical diagnostic labs, pharmaceutical and biotech companies, universities, research institutions and government agencies. You will contribute your part to make a better world.

What will you do? 
You will help to deliver deep analytical solutions using data science processes (CRISP-DM and Agile), technology, and machine learning algorithms to the microarray group marching towards Industrial 4.0 in Thermo Fisher Scientific. You will apply your knowledge of statistics, machine learning, data structures, programming to recognize patterns, identify opportunities and translate into valuable business solutions.
•	Provide support to data science projects including analysis, querying, coding, visualization, modeling, and deployment.
•	Be involved with many aspects of model design and evaluation tasks and prove the efficacy of models built using business driven measurements and sound statistical principles.
•	Automate predictive processes with monitoring tools, anomaly detection, time series forecasting, and other potential algorithmic solutions that deliver better insights of our manufacturing process and activities that leverage data science technology to drive incremental impact to the business.
•	Work with engineers and other stakeholders to ensure the effectiveness of models with rigorous scientific observation and evaluation of data science products.
•	Work with cross functional teams to support data collection, visualization, and integration.
•	Collaborate closely with other data scientists on developing and improving model performance and conduct other ad hoc analysis as needed

How will you get here?
•	Being a undergraduate or post graduate student, major in machine learning, statistics, AI or related to business/data analysis 
•	Good understanding of statistics and machine learning concepts and willing to learn with a desire to contribute using real world data
•	Familiarity with Python or R and SQL
•	A plus to be familiar with cloud architecture (AWS preferred), experience with Linux, SageMaker, deep learning, image classification
•	Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

Learning outcome (at least 3 points):
•	By end of internship, the student will learn:
•	Gain experience of complete life cycle of data science project with business understanding, data ETL, exploratory analysis, modeling, evaluation and deployment.
•	Get familiar and utilize tool like Python/R, SQL, PowerBI, AWS Cloud to solve real world business issues
•	Apply knowledge learned in the University and acquire skills needed to become hands-on data scientists
•	Gain interpersonal skills that promotes personal growth and development

On this highly cross-functional team, you will work with partners in Engineering, Product management, and other customer-facing teams. While much of the team output is content and responding to developer queries, engineering is at the heart of everything we do. In order to teach developers how to use these technologies, we first have to understand them deeply ourselves. You may be the first developer to build something with a new API. Additionally, you will help to develop/maintain tools that are frequently used by DevRel team.

title: Intern UX Research
description:
Position Overview
The Forge Research and Analytics team is seeking a User Experience (UX) Research Intern to help cross-disciplinary product teams develop empathy and a better understanding of their customer. We provide insights and recommendations to help teams make decisions and deliver ideal product experiences for our customers. The role will require top-notch research skills, along with a strategic mindset and the ability to collaborate with different product teams.

Responsibilities
•	Work with Senior Experience Design (XD) Researchers to plan and execute customer research throughout the design and development lifecycle, from early strategic direction through post-release validation
•	Employ a wide range of research methods, including generative design research and contextual inquiry, participatory design workshops, interviews, formative and summative usability studies, and quantitative methods, such as surveys and data analytics
•	Collecting existing research and insights to inform your research questions from around the company, including market and business intelligence, usage analytics, and previous work by other XD researchers
•	Assisting with empathy and design-thinking workshops with cross-functional teams to ensure that findings and insights are translated into actionable product goals and direction
•	Sharing customer insights with the broader organization in creative ways to increase customer empathy, including posters, immersion rooms, blog posts, and workshops

Minimum Qualifications
•	Full-time student, pursuing a degree in User Experience Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Science, Data Science, or a related field
•	Demonstrated experience with conducting user research studies and documenting findings (user research for class projects is acceptable)
•	Good written and oral communication skills in English
•	Experience with design tools such as Sketch, Figma, inVision, as they relate to interaction and user interface design
•	Familiarity with web/mobile development languages/platforms

Preferred Qualifications
•	Knowledge of the Autodesk family of software products or knowledge of manufacturing, architecture, or engineering fields
•	Familiarity with data visualization or analytics platforms such as Tableau, Google Analytics
•	Pursuing an MS or PhD in User Experience Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Science, Data Science, or a related field

Learning Benefits
•	Gain experience working with a cross-disciplinary team including UX designers, product managers and software developers
•	Apply UX research methods to real-world problems and show the value of research in helping teams make design / engineering / business decisions
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Learning and Application of Integrated Work System (IWS) – Generalist
description:
Intern under this Project would have a better understanding on IWS System and its application to Manufacturing Industry. IWS is an extensive set of capabilities and asset that creates differentiated results compared to traditional operational improvement programs learnt in Textbooks.

By the end of internship, Intern would be able to apply Daily Management System (DMS) and appreciate its capability to review production performance and area of opportunities in the Factory.
These DMS includes; 
              Incident Elimination DMS -  use to address work safety related issue
              Defect Handling DMS – use to resume equipment to base condition and achieve high equipment efficiency
`             Center Line DMS – use to standardize equipment set point in order to achieve good product quality and equipment efficiency
              Clean Inspect & Lubrication DMS – use to perform equipment cleaning and find defect that will cause losses to production efficiency and quality
Breakdown Elimination DMS – use to analyses component failure and CAPA to eliminate recurrence of break down
Maintenance Preventive & Scheduling DMS –  use to develop preventive maintenance task based on DMS outcome, to achieve cost reduction.

title: Robotics Engineer Intern @ Eureka Robotics
description:
Company presentation
*****

Featured in The New York Times, The Guardian, The Economist, TechCrunch, CNN,... Eureka Robotics is revolutionizing the field of industrial robotics. Empowered by cutting-edge Robotics and AI research from MIT and NTU Singapore, Eureka Robotics masters tasks with High Accuracy and High Agility (#HAHA) requirements. Eureka Robotics prides itself on helping clients achieve vastly improved productivity, quality, safety, and agility.

Our mission is to liberate humans from routine, tedious and labor-intensive tasks by bringing advanced and intelligent robotics to the shop floor. We take on the most rewarding automation challenges, across a range of high-precision industries, such as handling optical lenses with tens of microns accuracy. Our customers and partners include world-leading manufacturing and robotics companies.

Want to know more about us? Visit https://eurekarobotics.com/ or follow us on https://www.linkedin.com/company/eurekarobotics.

Responsibilities
*****

[Design track]
- Design, prototype, validate, and fabricate custom mechanical components to fit particular applications, such as: gripper, stabilizer, coupling, workcell, etc.
- Design, prototype, validate, document, and certify electrical circuits for industrial robot applications
- Liaise with mechanical/electrical contractors to ensure that the designs are executed appropriately and on time
- Design, integrate, and test robot systems comprising multiple devices (robot arm, controller, end-effectors, cameras, lighting, pneumatic systems)

[Development track]
- Develop user interfaces for Eureka industrial robotic systems
- Develop and implement computer vision algorithms (classical and Deep-Learning-based) for segmentation, object localization, scene understanding
- Design and implement back-end services for reliable, high-performance, motion planning and control
- Develop and implement calibration algorithms, e.g. intrinsic camera parameter estimation, stereo transform estimation, robot hand-eye calibration, robot cell calibration, etc.

Requirements
*****
[All] Experience with Python
[Design track] Solidworks or other CAD software
[Development track] Experience developing/deploying software, algorithms, C++
agencyAddress: 67 Ayer Rajah Crescent, 07-16/17 JTC Launchpad, 139950, SINGAPORE

3) Send an email to careers@eurekarobotics.com so that we can track your applications on Summation and Inplace, and provide further instructions

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: A large-scale WIS image analytic pipeline for defect detection and classification
description:
Description: 
1. Data Engineering: The project deals with engineering large quantity of data. In real engineering world, data comes from various source in machine learning pipeline. Even if most of them are structured, data still needs to be efficiently and effectively merged and engineered, taking cost and speed into consideration. 
2. This process is the backbone of a good application which sometimes even determines the feasibility of a solution. 
3. The project integrates and transforms data from Hadoop, GCP, Snowflake, mongoDB, SQL and other platforms. Due to the complexity of the machine learning solutions, the project developers also need to work with large group of stakeholders from modelling teams and user teams from various engineering backgrounds to understand the real needs.

Modelling: 
1. The pipeline takes advantage of cutting-edge computer-vision and deep learning methodology in image pattern recognition. 
2. WIS images are generated in production line which is a large-size indicator for production line to identify defects and troubleshooting. Being part of the i-WIS team, you will have the opportunity to expose to image analytics, image pre-processing, post-processing analysis, ETL pipeline development and UI development. 

Scope:
1. To design and develop a stable data engineering pipeline to support WIS to assist production line automation, issue identification and troubleshooting. 
2. The pipeline is expected to meet user expectation of data extraction and engineering speed.
3. To tune deep learning classification model to improve accuracy. To automate data pipeline as much as possible to improve training and prediction efficiency.

Deliverable: 
1. Provide efficient classification training and prediction support for WIS related issue identification and recognition to fulfill user requirement. 
2. Improve model performance to assist issue troubleshooting.
agencyName: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: IoT Particle Monitor and Tableau Equipment Metrics
description:
Study and develop real time particle monitoring IOT (Internet-of-Things) device for Prober cleanliness monitoring.
Analyze and develop equipment metrics reports for Equipment Performance monitoring using Tableau.

Description: 
1. Regular check on particle counts are required in Probe Probers to ensure the cleanliness is within control. 
2. In this project, students will have exposure to actual Industry 4.0 applications and develop a IoT use case for real time equipment monitoring.
3. High equipment utilization is affected when the equipment is not running efficiently. 
4. Resources spent on deciphering the losses due to inefficiencies is time consuming if performed manually. 
5. To develop equipment metrics report using Tableau to speed up data analysis. 

Scope: 
1. Conduct research on suitable and cost effective IOT particle monitoring sensors and IOT edge devices. 
2.Develop a project plan to fabricate a prototype for testing. 
3. Work with Automation team to establish data feeding to server and establish a monitoring platform using Fab10 statistical process software application. Student will be able to learn product design and development, project management as well as to use fab-specific applications and software.
4. Study equipment log files, perform data processing and develop Tableau report.

Deliverable: 
1. Develop and install a cost-effective particle sensor IOT device to be installed within a prober and establish the real time monitoring system.
2. Develop equipment metrics reports for Equipment Performance monitoring using Tableau.
3. Expected learning outcome of internship: IoT applications, Data Visualization. Data analysis and project management.
4. Key functions/skillsets to lookout for in interns: Perl, python, tableau, IoT, linux, experience in arduino, Rpi advantageous.
agencyName: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.
applicationInstructions: Please ensure that you attach a copy of your C.V. with your application.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Operation Analytics Smart Monitoring and Alert System
description:
Description: 
1. The semiconductor industry has one of the most complex manufacturing line to fabricate its product. 
2. To handle this complexity, Micron scheduling and analytics system runs 24/7 to operate the plant and takes in more than 200 million of data each time it generates a schedule for the whole fab. 
3. Aside from that, it generates multiple analytics products that are continuously uncover insights for the production team to help with critical decision making. This project aims to build a smart monitoring and alert system to keep close watch of all our Scheduling and Analytics systems. 
4. This will help the team detect deviations early and resolve it before it turns into an issue as well as quick alerts and automatic response whenever there is any issue occurs.

Scope: 
1. The project will be centered around analytics and system building. 
2. The student will be challenged to explore and design new methodology & failure modes from the multiple systems that is very critical to the fab operation. 
3. Knowledge in programming language is a need especially in python and SQL. Analytical thinking, capability to innovate and strong drive to deliver for results is important traits to have.

Deliverable: 
1. At the end of the project, the student is expected to contribute new failure modes monitoring that can automatically detect, alert and prescribe action that will help the team to keep the system running reliably.
agencyName: MICRON SEMICONDUCTOR ASIA OPERATIONS PTE. LTD.

description:

Spares Planning Team at F10, involved in wide range of activities ranging from Forecasting Spares Parts to computing the Accuracy of Forecast and Creation of Maintenance Plans on SAP to their Review & Revision on a Regular basis. Industry4.0 Stimulus for Automation resulted in SQL and Python scripts automating various manual activities.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Machine Learning Metrology Optimization
description:
Description: 
1. Scatterometry is a technique that uses light to measure critical dimension of a post-etch structure during wafer fabrication. 
2. Machine Learning (ML)-based scatterometry uses supervised learning model to evaluate the measurement value from the light information. 
3. Users run scripts to train these ML models, and the models are then deployed in production environment for real-time measurement evaluation. 
4. There is a constant need to improve the learning algorithm, improve user experience on model training and reduce lag in real-time evaluation.

Scope: 
1. The student will be introduced to scatterometry measurement technique.
2.  He/She will be able to learn the application of supervised learning technique and building a deployment pipeline in a manufacturing environment. 
3. The student will study the existing ML-based scatterometry framework and apply object-oriented programming as well as other Python scientific libraries, including Pandas and SciPy to the framework.

Deliverable: 
1. To propose improvement plan on existing ML-based scatterometry framework and develop solutions in Python.

Key Skill set: 
1. Fluent in Python and its scientific libraries, fluent in object-oriented programming, some background in supervised learning, good troubleshooting skill

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Improving automated diagnostic statistical analysis methods
description:
Description: 
1. Failure analysis is a time-consuming affair that can require multiple teams, manual data extraction, and non-standardized methods for resolving root cause. 
2. Automated analysis helps to reduce the need for manual investigation, and it saves engineering time by pinpointing potential root causes or sources of commonality. 

Scope: 
1. The student will be introduced to Micron’s Backend Assembly/Test Manufacturing process flow to understand the benefits, requirements, and limitations of automated analysis, and to find opportunities to improve it. 
2. The student will work with engineers from multiple departments to gain a broader insight on the semiconductor manufacturing process and be exposed to the different kinds of production datasets available as part of that process. 

Expectation: 
1. To extend the methodology on new datasets, to find opportunity in improving the current methodology, and to build innovative solutions using various algorithm, including but not limited to, statistical methods and/or machine learning to improve the accuracy and reliability of the automated diagnostics analysis result.

Pre-requisite:

a) One of the following program (R, Python, Java, C++)
b) ETL, Database (MS SQL, Oracle, MySQL, Snowflake etc)

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Natural language processing and deep learning for industrial internet of things audio processing.
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:
1. Internet of things (IoT) is becoming one of the core elements for the smart manufacturing. 
2. Microphone have been introduced for the health monitoring of the manufacturing systems. 
3. Large amount of audio data are being generated in real time which would require advanced analytics such as machine, deep learnings and natural language processing. 
4. In this project, the student will have the opportunity to learn the industrial state-of-art IoT frameworks, have hands-on experiences on both the hardware and software, and work with a team of IoT experts to contribute to the practical issues solving which will have real impact on the manufacturing process. 
5. The intern will also have opportunity to participate to an end-to-end solution development team to contribute ideas and learn from industrial subject experts. 

Scope: 
1. Explore natural language processing, supervised, unsupervised machine learning and deep learning algorithm for the large amount of audio data processing. 
2. Explore unsupervised clustering algorithm for the data processing. 
3. Explore deep learning for the data classification. 
4. Explore machine learning or deep learning for the novelty detection. 
5. Explore descriptive analytics to facilitate easier decision making by end-users.  

Deliverable:

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Computer vision helps a picture speaks a thousand metrics?.
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:
1. Are you passionate about cameras and imaging? Join us to work on and advance the state of the art for process monitoring and control. 
2. Current manufacturing has thousands of process steps spanning over several months of production. 
3. Detecting process deviations early ensures that issues can be contained and rectified to maintain the capacity, cost, quality, and yield. 
4. Together we will create tomorrow’s manufacturing detection systems to keep Micron competitive in the industry. ​

Scope: 
1. Work with other exceptional scientists and engineers to research, build and deploy camera system that will excite the semiconductor industry. 
2. Deployment of state of the art machine learning algorithms such as OpenCV to Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) to translate image into measurable metrics that improve the required process control granularity. 
3. Metrics will be used to correlate to with non-complying dies and probe yield to surface out new opportunities for process improvements.​

Deliverable: 
1. Image processing solutions to monitor nozzle positions for process drift detection and WISecam images of wafer apex to correlate with wafer stress. 
2. The former would eventually be fed into failure detection monitoring and latter would be by space control charts.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Early detection of burn in board shading by machine learning image recognition with factor analysis.
description:
Project Description / Internship Job Description:
1. Burn in board shading is usually detected only when there is considerable yield loss that triggers tedious data extraction and manual fail map image analysis. 
2. Early detection of hardware shading could allow test engineers to react promptly and mitigate yield loss. Factor analysis assist and speed up the investigation for resolution. 

Scope:
1. Student has to build an image recognition model to detect hardware shading on large production data. 2. The project includes factor analysis in machine learning to reduce the large numbers of variables into fewer numbers of factors. 
3. In the course of internship, our student will gain opportunity to understand test engineering jobscope and work with inter-department teams.

Deliverable:
1. Machine learning model development with factor analysis for proactive and speedy yield improvement.

title: Project Title / Internship Job Title: Intern -  SSD Media Management Algorithm Validation and Comparison
description:
Scope:
1. Media management algorithms are crucial to ensure SSD program success. 
2. Hence, it is very important to properly validate the media management algorithms developed by our FW partner, such as Vector Read Level Calibration, Media Scan, Probabilistic Read Disturb Handling, Block Family Error Avoidance, Read Error Handling, etc. 
3. The student will be able to learn the coding/scripting knowledge. 
4. Also, he/she will be introduced with some basic SSD FW architecture and the concept of different MAG algorithms. In the course of work, he/she may have the opportunity to work with engineers from other department and gain more knowledge through peer sharing.

Requirements:
1. Basic understanding on coding and scripting, such as C code, Matlab, Python and/or Perl. 

Deliverable: 
1. To develop/maintain a server/tool that consolidate the media management algorithm data. 
2. To develop an automated tool to compare and analyze media management algorithm data across different programs.

title: Internship - Digital Systems
description:
Digital Systems manages a wide range of projects to enable SMRT Trains to leverage on technology and digitalization, in enhancing rail operational, engineering and maintenance effectiveness and efficiency.  Engineers on internship will not just be exposes to the various facets of project management, but also gain hands-on technology management, business value assessment and strategic planning.

Digital Systems also function as SMRT Trains Digital Transformation Office (DTO) to innovate and deliver digital solutions. SMRT Trains adopts the transformational Kaizen approach for our digitalization strategy. We aim to be a Digital Transformer and Data-driven organization by 2025.  The setup of Trains Digital Transformation Office (DTO) under P&D and MMS Office will oversee and operationalize Digital Trains masterplan. We are building sustainable Rail Operations and Maintenance with emphasis on Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) to achieve our goal of Sustainable Mobility. We will leverage on digital platforms and Digital Twin (DT) technologies. Most importantly, digital transformation will serve and benefit our people to re-profile and upskill our workforce. 

The highlights of Intelligent Trains (iTrains) digitalization are as follows:
1.         Innovating and changing our ways of working through Business Process Re-engineering
2.         Sustain RAMSS and achieve Kaizen productivity savings
3.         Invest in capability-leap projects: 
a.         Video Analytics & AI for iStation and Digital Twin enabling technologies for iControl
b.         Streamline MMS and achieve Predictive Maintenance with REAMS
c.         Intelligent Automation for iDepot

Duties and Responsibilities

1.	Perform project management including management of budget, timeline, user, vendors and all relevant stakeholder
2.	Understanding and consolidate user requirements from various Rail Ops, Engineering and Maintenance functions.
3.	Work with all stakeholders to define project specifications
4.	Identify and review technologies and potential vendors for suitability of proposals
5.	Ensure on-time and on-target delivery of project
6.	Projects currently undertaken by DS include digitalization, Workforce 4.0, digital twin, intelligent automation and predictive decision support systems.

Work Location: Bishan Depot

Organisation Relationship
Reports To: Senior Manager, Digital Systems
applicationInstructions: Interested candidate please submit your CV and latest transcript to AlanLauKahWei@smrt.com.sg with the internship project title as subject header, Thank You.
applicationRequirements: CV and latest transcript
